loans.name: Ivette Del Socorro

texts.es:
This young woman of 36 lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood is married and has three children aged 10,15 and 20. Her husband is a merchant and she helps him out selling blank CDs and DVDs whosale. Her brother in law, who is a haulage contractor, helps her by bringing boxes of these products from Panamá which allows her to obtain higher profits because she does not need to spend money on transportation. Thanks to this arrangement she is able to offer lower prices which in turn has meant an increase in sales.

Her hope if that her children don't suffer the hardships she did as a child. Thanks to her work her children are able to get an education which she feels is the best inheritance she can leave them. She is asking for a loan to take advantage of a trip her brother in law is going to take. She plans to bring enough boxes of merchandise to last until his next trip.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Esta joven señora de apenas 36 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Santa Rosa, casada y madre de 3 hijos, de 10,15, y 20 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y ella lo apoya vendiendo CD y DVD en blanco al por mayor, para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñado que es transportista y le trae de Panamá las cajas de este producto esto le ayuda a tener mejor ganancia ya que no gasta en el transporte, este ahorro que tiene con el apoyo familiar que tiene ha significado un crecimiento en sus ventas al dar buen precio.

Su anhelo es que sus hijos no sufran ni pasen las necesidades que ella pasó de niña. Con su trabajo a sus hijos no les falta su educación que es la mejor herencia que piensa dejarles. Solicita un crédito para aprovechar un viaje que tiene su cuñado y mandar a traer suficientes cajas y tener suficiente inventario hasta el próximo viaje.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of DVDs and CDs to stock up

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia is a member of the community bank Santo Domingo D. Acocro, lives in the district of Acocro which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Apolonia is married, is 55 years old and has 2 children. Apolonia has a grocery store in her home located in the main plaza of the district of Acocro. Also, she works in the growing of cereals which she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Apolonia needs a loan of 1500 soles (USD $575), money which will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, ham and candy.

Apolonia dreams of having a large shop in the city of Ayacucho and living in Ayacucho with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Apolonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santo Domingo D. Acocro, Apolonia es natural del Distrito D. Acocro que esta ubicado a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Apolonia es casada, tiene 55 años y 2 hijos, Apolonia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa ubicado en la plaza principal del Distrito D. Acocro. Además Apolonia se dedica a la agricultura D. cereales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Apolonia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas, cerveza, arroz, azúcar, jabón y golosinas.

Apolonia sueña con tener una botica granD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y vivir en Ayacucho junto a sus hijos.

loans.use: Apolonia needs a loan of 1500 soles (USD $575), money which will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, ham and candy for her store.

loans.name: Futuro De La Mujer Group

texts.en:
Marileidi is a beautiful young woman with two children (ages: 6, 8). Their family lives in the small, coastal town of Samana in a nice quiet community. With this loan, she wants to start a business selling clothes. She plans on traveling to S. Domingo (the capital city) to purchase her initial stock, and then will sell it at a higher price in her town. Marileidi is a very motivated and intelligent woman, and one day wants to open her own store. During her free time, she enjoys watching the popular Spanish soap operas on TV.

Thank you for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana started the business out of necessity and because she has always wanted to start one. Because there was a lack of jobs in her hometown, she had no choice but to move to Monterrey with her family—her husband and three children. She started selling shoes by catalogue 4 years ago, making small shoe demonstrations amongst her friends and neighbors until establishing a client base that allowed her to increase her income.

She now needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to purchase an awning so that she can put on demonstrations at home with her neighbors. With your help, Diana will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Diana inició el negocio por necesidad y para empezar un negocio por su cuenta dado que siempre quizo tener un negocio, debido a que de la comunidad donde proviene el trabajo es escaso seo vio obligada a radicar en Monterrey con su familia ( su esposo y sus tres hijos). Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo zapatos solo sobre pedidos y haciendo pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas, hasta que genero una cartera de clientes que le permitio mejor sus ingresos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar un toldo para hacer demostraciones en casa y con sus vecinos. Con tu apoyo Diana saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase an awning

loans.name: Andrea Justina

texts.es:
Mrs. Andrea is 63 years old and was born on November 29, 1945. She studied through 5th graD. and speaks both Spanish and the native language of Aymara. She is currently separated from her husband; she has six children of whiC. only one is currently studying. The others are all grown with their own families. She owns her own home with all basic services (light, water, etc.) on Ejercito Avenue in the Yunguyo province.

Andrea used to work selling clothing for adults and youth but she struggled to sell it. Selling just one item seemed to take forever. She began knitting clothing for babies (sweaters, sleepwear) whiC. she was able to sell very easily so she changed her inventory. Now, she sells clothing for children (cotton t-shirts, wool sweaters, small socks, dresses, shirts, and pants) in the markets of Chacachaca, Huapaca, and Yunguyo.

She is also a designer; she makes clothes for cold-weather suC. as vests, pants, and ponchos for children. She is a member of the “Villa Copacaban” village bank where she first received a loan of $125 in order to buy sweaters, pants, and hats for babies. With this $1,050 loan whiC. she will repay in 3 months, she plans to purchase wholesale clothing for babies.

She is very grateful for her loans whiC. helps her substantially in her business and improve her earnings. She hopes that one day her daughters will become professionals and that they will have a clothing factory.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Andrea tiene 63 años D. edad nació el 29 D. noviembre D. 1945, estudio hasta quinto D. primaria, habla es castellano y el aymará. Actualmente su estado civil es separada, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales solo uno esta estudiando, los demás ya son independientes con familia, la casa donD. vive es propia tiene todos los servicios básicos y esta ubicada en la Av. Ejercito del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo. Andrea cuenta que anterior mente se dedicaba a la venta D. ropa adulta, jóvenes con la que tenia problemas para venderlo, no tenia suerte, se demoraba bastante en vender una prenda, empezó a tejer ropas para bebes (chompitas, ajuares ) que vendía con mucha mas facilidad, motivo por el cual cambio D. mercadería. Ahora se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. niños (roponcitos, politos D. algodón, chompas D. lana, medias pequeñas, vestidos, camisas, chullos, pantalones.) en las ferias D. Chacachaca, Huapaca, en el mismo Yunguyo. Andrea es Modista, confecciona Ropas D. tela polar como chalecos, pantalones, ponchos, todo para niños. Ella integra al Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” también inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 comprando un docena D. chompitas D. bebes, pantaloncitos, gorritos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses, comprará ropa D. bebes al por mayor. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito, que le ayuda bastante en su negocio y incrementa sus ingresos. El gran anhelo que ella tiene que sus hijas saquen sus títulos profesionales, que tengan una fabrica D. confección.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale baby clothing

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. M. Thi Nguyen, 32 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 2006. The family’s finances are encountering many difficulties; her husband works as labor for hire and she stays home to take care of their young children and work the fields. The farming work does not take up all her time, so she planned with her husband to join the Fund to start a home business and supplement the family’s income. The project she decided to invest in was making statues from plaster. The work is not too arduous, but the profit is still relatively high. In subsequent rounds of funding she always invested in buying more plaster. Since she has been in the Fund and doing this trade, the family’s finances have improved greatly, and she still has time to do farm work and take care of her children. In this round of funding she is requesting 9,000,000 VND to buy more plaster. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị M. 32 tuổi, tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 2006. Kinh tế gia đình còn gặp nhiều khó khăn con còn nhỏ chồng đi làm thuê còn chị ở nhà nuôi con. Công việc làm ruộng cùng nhàn rỗi nên chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn để chị ở nhà làm thêm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Dự án mà chị đầu tư vốn là làm tượng bằng thạch cao, công việc không vất vả mà thu nhập cũng tương đối cao nên các vòng vốn chị đều vay để đầu tư mua thạch cao làm tượng. Từ khi chị vay vốn và làm nghề kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rất nhiều, đồng thời chị vẫn có thời gian làm ruộng kết hợp chăm sóc con. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ để mua thạch cao. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy more plaster to make statues

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik C. is 45 years old. He learned his profession as a cattle farmer from his father when he was 18 years of age. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. 

In addition to the animals, he also buys and sells agricultural goods to raise more profit. With his previous loans, he purchased two more cattle. He sold them already and purchased two young calves which he is rearing to sell. 

Today he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) which he's promising to repay within 12 months. From the profit of his business, Malik wants educate his children at the University. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela. Lucia es casada, tiene 54 años y 7 hijos, Lucia venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en una D. las puertas del mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes con la ayuda D. su hija, diariamente Lucia arma una carpa improvisada que la pueda proteger D. las lluvias. Además Lucia tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donD. venD. bebidas variadas, este negocio esta administrado por su hija.

Lucia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pescado congelado, arroz y aceite. Los sueños D. Lucia son vender condimentos por mayor, su hijo menor culmine sus estudios y descansar.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Marcela communal bank. Lucia is married, 54 years old, and has 7 children. Lucia sells food in one of the doors of the Magdalena market every afternoon with the help of her daughter. Every day she builds a tent that will protect her from the rains. Furthermore, Lucia has a small store in her house where she sells various drinks. This store is administered by her daughter. Lucia needs a 1500 soles loan to purchase frozen fish, rice and oil. Lucia dreams of selling her condiments wholesale, seeing her youngest son complete his studies, and resting.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lucia needs a 1500 soles loan that will be invested in the purchase of frozen fish, rice and oil

loans.name: Segunda Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de trece y nueve años, realizó estudios superiores y vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una nueva socia del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Desde los 34 años de edad se inició en este negocio, el cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, aumentará su capital para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener lo que ella no tuvo y que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Elisa is 42 years old and is a single mother of 2 children, who are 13 and 9 years old. She did her higher education and lives in the Jr. Sanra Cruz s/n, in the district of Juli, Chuchito, Puno.

She is a new member in the Pequeña Roma Community Bank in Juli. At the age of 34, she started her business, which allows her to take her children forward.

With this loan of 200 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will increase her capital so that she can buy more merchandise for her business of selling clothes.

She dreams that her children can have what she didn’t have and that they can be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es: Ronaldo tiene 27 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos con quienes vive. Desde hace 6 años es agricultor, actividad que inició desde que tuvo su primer hijo. Pero siempre le agradó trabajar en el campo, y el producir frutos cítricos ahora, es lo que más le agrada, aunque sus cosechas sean anuales, pero muy rentables, ya que cuando inicia la temporada de naranjas, es muy solicitada esta fruta en grandes cantidades, por ello cuida sus cultivos, para obtener  muy buena cosecha. Menciona también, que lo difícil es sembrar las plantas y cuidarlas de los insectos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Ronaldo  invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de  insecticidas y abonos  para sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Ronaldo is 27 years old, married, and has three children that he lives with. He has been a farmer for six years, an activity he undertook after having his first child. However, he has always taken pleasure from working the land and now particularly enjoys cultivating citrus. Although his crops are annual, they are very profitable, and during the orange season they are very much in demand in large quantities. For this reason, he cares for his crop carefully so he can benefit from a good harvest. He also mentions that it is difficult sowing the plants and protecting them from insect infestation. This is his first loan with MFP. Ronaldo will invest the funds he requests into purchasing insecticides and fertilizers for his farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach K. is a villager in Trapaing Prey village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy five more piglets and pig food to breed them. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Khat Muon, is a construction worker. Mrs. Mach K. is 40 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is in the left of the photo.

loans.use: A loan to buy five more piglets and pig food to breed them.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has one son. She owns a small business that sells jeans at the market. Svetlana has been in this business for 10 years. She was able to develop this business to have several locations. She always tries to have large assortment and good quality at affordable prices. Her business goal is to build a small store.

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 7,500 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to make additional profit and pay her son's university tuition.

loans.use: to increase her assortment

loans.name: Qalamirza

texts.en:
Qalamirza A. is a 62-year old man.  Qalamirza and his wife, who is a housekeeper, have 4 children.  

He has been running his own small business for nine years.  He has a store that sells shampoos, detergents, tooth-paste, brushes and other items.  Qalamirza is very friendly and polite, which attracts clientele. 

He is requesting a loan of $1200 so that he can purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale.  Qalamirza promises to pay his loan during a 15 month time period and thanks everyone who decides to support him.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale.

loans.name: Coeurs Unis Group

texts.en:
The “Coeurs Unis” or “United Hearts” Group is made up of twenty male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying both their first and second loans, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their third loan. 

Dieusenie G. is one of four representatives of the group. She is a single mother with a two-year-old child. This hardworking mom sells a variety of merchandise, mostly foods and things related to cooking. Her small stand usually has cookies and small treats for the children as well as rice, beans, oils, and spices for the adults. She really appreciates that previous loans enabled her to buy her merchandise in bulk. Buying in bulk saves her money and expands her margin for profit. She hopes that the profit from her business will one day help her to build a house for her family and to send her daughter to school in a few years. On behalf of Dieusenie, Coeurs Unis and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: COOKIES, CANDY, OILS, FRUIT, VEGETABLES

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony sells shoes retail to his customers. He is 37 years old and single. The demand for his shoes is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He would like a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is an active LAPO client and she lives in Lagos State, the commercial capital of Nigeria. She sells drinks wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 60 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a loving housewife of Angel G.. They raise their family in the rural area of Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have been blessed with two children, who are presently studying. Their children are Angelo Simon, 17 years old and a college sophomore, and Allan, 14 years old and a sophomore in high school. Teresita is hoping that her two children will someday finish college. 

She manages their small sari-sari store (village store) at home. She is selling different goods and commodities for her neighbors. She wants to borrow additional business capital, amounting to PHP 13,000, from lenders for her to develop her store and earn more profit. Her desire to increase her daily income has motivated her to ask for a loan.  This will enable her to sustain her children's education. She wants to improve her store by converting it into a mini grocery store so that she will satisfy her customer’s needs. 

Teresita is doing her best in order to meet her ambitions in life and she also believes that by patience and hard work, she can able to achieve all her desires in life.

loans.use: to improve her store

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four people who live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Vuth M., age 38, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. Vuth M. and her husband are currently local fishermen. They depend on catcH. fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. That is the main place for fish's sheltering. They have been fisH. for a long time and earn at least $5 per day. This income they use to support her family's living expenses and especially to make sure their five children get the highest education. Vuth M. is applying for a loan in order to buy a machine to connect to their boat so that they can use it to fish more quickly. The other three borrowers are:
Mrs. S., a fish hunter, who is applying for a loan to purchase nets for fisH..
Mr. H., who is asking for a loan to buy more tools for his fisH. business.
Mrs. K., a local fish catcher, who is requesting a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a machine to connect to their boat

loans.name: Arimerit Amuleni Bena Group

texts.en:
A. Bena is a 24 year old business lady and mother of two children going to school. She looks after four dependents, who are her brothers and sisters, who are also in schooling.

A. has been dealing in produce, such as sorghum, millet, ground nuts, and peas, for two years. She is using the loan to purchase more of this produce. She is happy that now she can take care of her self and family. She is a hardworking and active lady whose dream is to educate her children, brothers, and sisters and, God willing, she will purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase sorghum, millet, ground nuts, peas, and other produce.

loans.name: Ni Luh Parwati

texts.en:
Ni Luh Parwati (DNR.M-0704) is 35 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu-Melaya. She is married with two school-aged children. To making a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Luh Parwati joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,200,000 IDR from DINARI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a loan of 3,600,000 IDR to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Luh Parwati - (DNR.M-0704) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Luh Parwati memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Luh Parwati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Parwati menghasilkan sekitar 1,000,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Luh Parwati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh Parwati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,600,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Parwati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Helena Da Conceição

texts.pt:
Helena Da Conceição S. nasceu em Manica tem 45 anos de idade e mãe de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 8 aos 28 anos de idade. Os quatro mais novos e que se encontram a estudar.

Após o casamento, Helena sai de Manica com seu esposo este que residia na cidade capital Maputo, apos sua chegada passava a maior parte do tempo sozinha, pois seu marido era camioneta, sendo assim a vida fica difícil e ela inicia seu próprio negócio de pastel eira actividade que aprendeu com sua mãe na sua infância. Anos depois seu esposo compra um terreno no Município da vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia e constrói uma casa onde ela vive ate então, hoje e proprietária de uma lanchonete sita na Escola Secundária da Namaacha trabalha das 4h as 22h, horário em que termina o curso nucturno e conta com dois empregados que auferem 1.500.00MT cada. Tem como melhor produto de venda (pasteis, chamussas e bolos) que tem feito por encomendas para baptismos, casamentos e aniversários viaja uma vez por semana onde adquiri o saco de trigo a 920x6 e bidões de óleo a 760x6 e dois sacos de açúcar a 1200.00MT cada gastando no mínimo um valor de 15.000.00MT obtendo de lucro um valor de 10.000.00MT mensalmente. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive com ela em sua casa

Este e terceiro empréstimo de Helena na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva os dois primeiros foram usados para aumentar o volume do seu produto, estes 15.000.00MT serão usados para o mesmo fim e esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a obra do seu armazém no mercado informal shoprite e meter mercadoria, pois ela pretende vender a grosso.
texts.en:
Helena Da Conceição S. was born in Manica, she's 45 years old and a mother to 6 children between the ages of 8 and 28 years old. The 4 younger ones are attending school. After getting married, Helena left Manica with her husband who resided in the capital city of Maputo at the time. At the beginning of her life there, she used to spend a long time on her own because her husband was a truck driver. She then started a business selling Pastel ( a typical deep fried treat), a trade she learned from her mother during her childhood. Years later, her husband bought a plot of land in the city of Namaacha in the Swaziland boarder and built the house where they now live. Nowadays, she is the owner of a snack bar located inside the Namaacha secondary school. She works from 4 am to 10 pm, time when the night classes end. She is helped by two employees who earn 1.500,00 MT each. Her best selling items are pastel, chamussas and cakes. She makes them to order, for baptisms, weddings and birthday parties. Helena travels once a week to buy wheat flour, vegetable oil cans and two bags of sugar for 1.200,00MT each, spending at least 15.000,00 MT and getting a profit in the amount of 10.000,00 MT monthly. Besides being responsible for her children, she also has her mother under her care. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. Her first two loans were used to increase her production, this one will be used for the same purpose. She is confident she'll be able to repay her loan before the payment due date. She plans on requesting another loan in the future in order to finish building her shop in the informal market "Shoprite" and increase her stock because she plans on selling items wholesale in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Sarah Atieno

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and a married mother of two children aged 13 and 15. Sarah sells Irish potatos in the Kibuye market. Her plan is to expand her business to become a wholesaler of potatoes supplying hotels and restaurants in her area. She says that her work can be challenging because if she doesn’t have enough customers her potatoes spoil.

Sarah hopes that her children can get a proper education. Sarah is also a Community healthcare worker, which means that she visits the sick, elderly, and vulnerable people in her community on a regular basis. As a Community Healthcare Worker, she wishes that she could have more money to support the people that she visits – many of them are undernourished.

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Sarah. For more information about K-MET, click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24.

loans.use: To purchse more stock

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a member of the Itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 29 years old woman,she is married and she cares for 2 dependents.

Sophia started her own business selling Tapes and DVD 1 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sophia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more Tapes,DVD.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,sophia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more Tapes, DVD for her business

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Marianela es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Marianela junto a su esposo tienen una fotocopiadora en un local alquilado, además vende accesorios y repuestos de fotocopiadoras.
Marianela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago del alquiler de la tienda.
Los sueños de Marianela son ampliar su negocio, que sus hijos aprendan del negocio y tengan su propio negocio.

loans.use: Para el pago del alquiler de la tienda.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: B. Cécile est née vers 1969 à Maxi dans le Département du zou. Cécile est mariée à BONOU LOKO Albert, un forestier, agent permanent de l'État. Ce couple a à charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Yagbé, une banlieue de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Cécile mène comme activité la vente des produits vivriers (Maïs, haricot mil, tubercule d’igname...)et des sacs de charbon de bois en gros. grâce au revenu de ses activités, Cécile vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Cécile a déjà eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Cécile demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Cécile B. was born around 1969 in Maxi in the Zou prefecture (in Benin). Cécile is married to Albert Bonou Loko, a forest range, a government agent. This couple has five children in the care, all of whom are in school. The family lives in the Yagbé district, a suburb of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Cécile runs a business selling food products (maize, beans, millets, yams...) and bags of charcoal in bulk. Thanks to the income from her activities, Cécile is able to help her husband in providing for the family. Cécile has already obtained three credits through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners), all of which she repaid without problems, and with which she was able to raise the level of her business. To continue developing her business, Cécile is seeking a fourth loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and yams

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de su suegra. Desde hace 4 años tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde atiende diariamente a su clientela, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, su esposo también la ayuda con la atención y de esta manera, este negocio les permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para su familia. Gladys se ha dando cuenta de la importancia de la atención que ofrece  a sus clientes, pues así la logrado retener a muchos de sus vecinos, quienes se han convertido en sus clientes regulares. Gladys está permanentemente alerta ante los cambios y las mejoras  que pueda hacer en su negocio, es por ello que planifica su futuro con miras a incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece.
Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta por ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de mercadería para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Gladys is 31 years old, and lives with her husband and children in her mother-in-law's house. For the past 4 years she has had a grocery store, where she daily tends to her clientele which are mostly her neighbors. Her husband also helps tending the store and in this way this business allows them to obtain the income necessary for their family. Gladys has realized it is important to look out for her clients, because in this way she has been able to keep many of her neighbors who have become regular customers. Gladys is permanently alert to the changes and improvements that can be done to her business, and this is why she plans to her future with the goal of increasing the variety of products she offers. This is the sixth time she has a loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank, which is why she is committed, once again, to be on time in her payments. The money she requests will be invested in increasing her merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Exson Ivan

texts.es:
El Sr. Exson Ivan S. T. de 22 años de edad y vive con su conviviente la Sra. Mirian Lili Huarcaya Carlos de 21 años de edad. Ellos tienen una niña de 2 años de edad la cual es su impulso para seguir adelante. 
Cuentan con casa propia en la zona de Pariña Chico perteneciente al Distrito de los Aquijes en Ica – Perú. 
Trabaja en un Tico (Automóvil – taxi) alquilado desde hace 3 años de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. en la ruta Ica- Los Aquijes y Los Aquijes – Ica. 
Gozan de buenas referencias, no cuentan con experiencia crediticia ya que los pocos bienes que han ido acumulando lo han obtenido siempre al contado con los ahorros obtenidos de su trabajo.
Solicitan el crédito para mejorar la fachada de su casa y poder colocar lunas a su puerta y ventana ya que se encuentran actualmente con cartones desde hace años. Además desean empezar a tener experiencia crediticia para más adelante obtener un financiamiento mayor y poder comprarse una unidad propia que le permita un mejor ingreso y así poder mejorar su vivienda para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su niña que aun esta pequeña. 
Son personas bien responsables a pesar de su edad, sobretodo con bastante ansias de superación.
texts.en:
Sr. Exson Ivan S. T. is 22 years old and lives with his partner, Sra. Mirian Lili Huarcaya Carlos, who is 21 years old. They have a 2 year old daughter who is their motivation to move forward. Exson and his family live in their own home in the Pariña Chico neighborhood, which is in the district of Los Aquijes in Ica, Peru. He has been driving a rented “tico” (taxi) for 3 years. His work schedule is from 7am to 7pm, and he makes several trips between Ica and Los Aquijes. Exson has good references, but he does not have credit experience since he has accumulated few assets and has paid with cash from the savings he sets aside from his work income. He is requesting a loan to improve the façade of his house and install glass in all the windows and doors because they are currently covered with cardboard. Exson would also like to establish a credit record so that he can obtain future financing to purchase an upgraded vehicle. This will enable him to earn a better income so that he can make other home improvements and provide his family with a better quality of life while his daughter is still young. Despite their young age, Exson and his wife are responsible people who have the desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming and commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Rose makes a living selling textiles and footwear. She sells her goods while traveling around town, or in the local market square. Rose has been in business for seven years and has applied for this loan to expand her business by buying goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy textiles to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong C. sells onions and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan from Kiva through BRAC southern Sudan so she can purchase cooking oil to sell. Hong is married with three children who are all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children up through higher learning.  

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. 

Mary is a fishmonger. She says she buys fresh fish from the local fishermen/women and smokes them herself. She hawks to sell and supplies to food vendors in her locality. Mary has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13, 11 y 8 años de edad en el caserío Punto 9, distrito de Mochumí, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral. Usualmente cría pavos, patos, chanchos y pollos, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque o a compradores ocasionales que llegan a buscarla. Este negocio constituye una fuente importante de ayuda a la economía de su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como operario en un taller de mecánica de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

La temporada de fiestas de fin de año hace que la demanda por sus animales crezca, por este motivo ella planea comprar más alimento para engordarlos pronto y comprar más animales para no desabastacerse. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una buena educación. Ella es una madre trabajadora, responsable y muy estimada por lo vecinos de la zona por donde vive.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their three children, who are 13, 11 and 8 years old, in the Punto 9 village, in the district of Mochumí, which is half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For six years, she has raised and sold animals. Usually, she raises turkeys, ducks, pigs and chickens, which she fattens and later sells in the market in the city of Lambayeque or occasionally to traders who come to find her. This business is an important source of income for her family, since her husband works as an operator in a workshop in the city of Lambayeque. Because of the holiday season, the demand for her animals has grown. Because of this, she plans to buy more food to fatten them soon and to buy animals to meet this demand. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest desire is to offer her children a good education. She is a hard-working and responsible mother, who is respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Mrs. Mann Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mann T. is a village bank president who leads 16 people in Domrei Chhang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mann T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this farming, she faces a small problE. because her soil is infertile. In order to deal with this problE., Mrs. Mann T. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Oeun Ai, helps her on the farm. Mrs. Mann T. is a mother of one child who is employed in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rodolfo's Group

texts.en: Rodolfo V. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. He is 58 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Rodolfo is married and has three adult children. He owns and operates a transportation business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle used in his business. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair and maintain the motorcycle used in his business

loans.name: Rodolfo Jr.

texts.en:
Rodolfo Jr. B. is from the village of Mohon Aloran Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old. Rodolfo Jr. is single. To earn a living, Rodolfo Jr. owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to his local community. Rodolfo Jr. has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 1700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rodolfo Jr. joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo Jr. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Rodolfo Jr. is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Rodolfo Jr. from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase tools and other equipment to expand his business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit-offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Ivan Francisco

texts.es:
Ivan Francisco C. J., tiene la edad de 25 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa, y no tienen hijos. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca,realizar mejoras dentro de los cultivos y así mejorar sus cosechas. La idea es poder ampliar las áreas de los cultivos, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los diversos cultivos como café, hortalizas en tre otros, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Ivan tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ivan Francisco C. J., 25, is married and lives with his wife; they don't have any children. He will use the loan to make improvements to his farm so that his crops will be better. The idea is to extend his growing fields so that he can provide proper care and management to his crops, among which are coffee and vegetables, among others, so that the best quality can be obtained and subsequently higher income at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms given. Ivan has been working in agriculture for several years. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farm improvements.

loans.name: Amistad Rsr. Group

texts.es: El grupo “Amistas rsr” esta representado por la señora Maria y conformado por 11 socios D. los cuales 4 son miembros varones y el retos esta conformado por mujeres, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. La señora Maria  que es la presidenta del grupo está casada su esposo se llama Jorge ambos tienen 1 hijo el  cual va al colegio, su esposo trabaja como chofer D. radio taxi  en las cuidad D. La Paz  para poder mantener a su familia, viven en una pequeña casa que comparte con sus hermanos,  las expectativas D. Maria y su esposo son D. crecer poco a poco y poder comprase un terreno para tener su propio hogar, Maria se dedica  a la venta D. Electrodomésticos en el mercado y requiere el préstamo para la adquisición D. mercadería. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría se dedica a  diferentes actividades como venta D. ropa (para niños, accesorios, lencería) ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, una socia se dedica a la venta y confección D. redes para arcos otras son vendedoras D. comida, celulares y artículos D. ferretería. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donD. venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, unos comprarán más insumos, mercadería y otros modernizaran sus puestos D. venta con herramientas para agilizar su trabajo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución en el cual ha demostrado responsabilidad y honradez en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The “Amistad RSR” group is represented by María and maD. up of 11 members; four men and 7 women; this bank is noted for being very united and cheerful. María, who is group president, is married to Jorge; they have a son, who is in school. Her husband works as a radio dispatch taxi driver in La Paz to support the family. They live in a small house that they share with her siblings. María’s and her husband’s expectations is to gradually grow so that they can buy a small lot to have their own home. María sells home appliances in the market and needs funds to buy stock inventory items. The other group members are in a variety of commercial activities, such as: clothing sales (for children, accessories, lingerie) either door-to-door or in fixed stands. One member makes and sells nets for arches and others sell food, cell phones and hardware items. The group as a whole has quite a bit of experience in the various businesses they run and are well known in the markets where they sell their wares. Although competition is widespread the group has both the experience and the regular customer base that recognizes their work and asks for their services; on the other hand, the enthusiasm with which they do their work is noteworthy. The current loan will be used for working capital. Some will buy more ingredients and merchandise; others will modernize their sales stands with tools that will facilitate their work. The group’s expectation is to continue working and, above all, continue to count on financing to reach their goals. The bank has quite a bit of credit history since this isn’t the first loan they have gotten. The present loan, for example, is the second one with our institution and they have demonstrated responsibility and honesty in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise and work tools.

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, en el distrito de José Leonoardo Ortiz, limita con la ciudad de Chiclayo, es considerado el distrito más poblado de la región Lambayeque, pero también el que presenta más índices de pobreza, generalmente su población se encuentra ubicada en “pueblos jóvenes” (zonas urbano marginales). 

Desde hace 03 años se dedica a la venta de diarios recorriendo las calles del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz (donde reside) y Chiclayo, además suele ir a lugares con bastante concurrencia de personas, como terminales de transportes y mercados. Cliente también tiene un pequeño exhibidor en su casa donde su mamá le ayuda a vender. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos economicos con la que cuenta por lo que da todo de sí para sacarlo adelante.

La demanda por los diarios que ofrece ha aumentado, sobretodo porque los diarios ofrecen diversos suplementos que son de utilidad para su público objetivo. Luis se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de suplementos de diarios, como son libros, CDs, revistas, etc., que las personas suelen pedirle pero que no puede atender por falta de capital. 

Luis es un joven trabajador y con muchas ganas de progresar. Sus familiares y conocidos lo estiman mucho y lo consideran una persona responsable y servicial.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old, single, and lives in the home of his parents in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz, which borders the city of Chiclayo. It is considered to be the most populated district in Lambayeque Region, but it also has the highest poverty index, generally among those living in “pueblos jóvenes” (the marginal urban areas).

For the past three years, Luis has been selling newspapers around the streets of the District of José Leonardo Ortiz (where he lives) and in Chiclayo. He tends to go to places that are busy, such as bus terminals and markets. Luis also has a small newsstand at his house where his mother helps with the sales. This business is his only source of income, so he gives everything he has in order to succeed.

The demand for newspapers has increased because they provide enjoyment to his target audience. Luis is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of items to supplement the newspapers such as books, CDs, magazines, and other products that people often ask for but he hasn’t been able to provide due to a lack of capital.

Luis is a young worker who is eager to make progress. His relatives and acquaintances respect him greatly and consider him to be a responsible and helpful person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to add to his inventory of newspapers

loans.name: Felitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio.
Felicitas es viuda, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Felicitas vende diversas maquinas para panaderías, mecánicas, productos que trae de Huancayo previo pedido.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de motores.
Los sueños de Felicitas son tener casa propia y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Imperio Communal Bank. Felicitas is a 53 year old widow, and she has four children. Felicitas sells various machines for bakeries and mechanics. She gets the products, which have been previously ordered, from Huancayo. Felicitas needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy motors. Her dreams are to have her own house and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy motors

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.en:
Leonidas is the coordinator of her group El Milagro (The Miracle), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Leonidas is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling beauty products such as makeup and creams. She will use the profits to continue to grow her inventory as well as contributing to her community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Parkimaso Ole

texts.en:
Parkimaso Ole N. is 45 years old, married to Naipano N., and the father of seven children. For the last seven years, he has farmed his own piece of land.
Parkimaso learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from a friend who is already a KADET-registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 KES of the loan on preparing his farm for planting wheat and 20,000 KES to buy a few heifers for fattening to sell later. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production. He also hopes to buy more heifers for fattening and selling later.
Parkimaso's future dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer, both in wheat farming and livestock keeping. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To prepare his farm for planting wheat and buy a few heifers for fattening

loans.name: Vodou Houndjenouko

texts.fr: cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pagnes,elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante.elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé ou ce commerce est très développé, elle a une grande expérience de cette activité ce qui lui de bien gérer son commerce. elle veut agrandir son commerce raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour s'acheter des pagnes de différentes qualité.elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants
texts.en: Vodou A. sells pagne cloth to make money. She walks around to sell the cloth rather than operating her business from a fixed location. She buys the cloth in the grand market in Lomé, where the fabric market is well-developed, and has lots of experience in this sector, which helps her to manage her business effectively. She wants to grow her business, which is why she is taking out her first loan with WAGES in order to buy different-quality pagne cloth to sell. She is married and has three children.

loans.use: achat de pagnes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy S. is from the village of Thailand, Basilan, South Cotabato. She is 47 years old. Lucy is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lucy runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lucy has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Lucy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Lucy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 36 años, vive con Jorge de 45 años, y sus 4 hijos, en casa de su madre, en plena carretera central hacia Tarma. Atender a sus animales, como: cuy, gallina, cerdos, carnero y asnos, es lo que más le gusta, por eso es muy cuidadosa, y procura darle el alimento necesario para que estén bien gordos y sanos, de ello depende para poder venderlos a buen precio. Paralelo a ello, también se dedica a cultivar papa, olluco y avena. Es así que ha transcurrido 12 años realizando estas actividades agrarias, ya que le permiten cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Con el tiempo espera comprar reses, en especial vacas, para que pueda extraer la leche y elaborar quesos de diferentes tamaños para llevarlos a comercializar en las tiendas de su localidad o a las ferias semanales de la ciudad de Tarma. En tanto su esposo, tiene un taller de carpintería donde fabrica los mejores muebles, pero en sus tiempos libres apoya a Adela en la agricultura. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y se muestra contenta de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, a quienes respeta mucho por que son muy laboriosos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará de 10 a 15 carneros, que criará por algunos meses hasta engordarlos y venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
36-year old Adela lives with 45-year old Jorge and their four children in her mother’s house on the main highway into Tarma. She raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, sheep, and donkeys, work that she really enjoys. She is very careful and gives them the necessary food so they grow up fat and healthy and she can sell them for a good price. As well as raising livestock, Adela grows potatoes, olluca (a root vegetable), and oats. She has spent twelve years working in agriculture which has allowed her to pay for household expenses. In the future she hopes to buy more animals, especially cows, so she can use the milk to make cheese of different sizes to sell in local shops or weekly markets in Tarma. Adela’s husband has a carpentry business where he makes very good furniture. In his spare time he helps Adela on the farm. This is her sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP and she is happy to continue working with the members of her community group whom she respects greatly for their hard work. With the loan she will buy 10-15 cattle which she will fatten for several months and then sell them for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with four children. All of her children attend school. She also takes care of three orphans. She resides in and rents a house which has no electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

She owns a stall where she sells second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. In addition to this clothing business, she owns a poultry farm at her home.

Jalia has been in this business for the last seven years. She works at the Bwaise market and sells to all types of people, both retail and wholesale.

She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her main business challenge is the seasonality and transportation of bales of clothes from Owino market to Bwaise market, where she works.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda L. is from the village of Burgos, Naguillan. She is 52 years old. Yolanda is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Duncun

texts.en:
Duncun is married with two children, both of whom attend school. His wife is a tailor and she helps in the upbringing of their children. 

He has been taking photographs door-to-door for the last five years, with his potential customers being wedding parties, parties, his neighbors and passersby. His other source of income is from his wife's earnings. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to open a stall to operate a photo studio. Duncan faces the major challenge of high transport costs when moving from place to place and also seasonality.

He hopes to own the biggest photo studio in the future and earn more income. He decided to work with Yehu to get financial assistance to improve his business. He lives at a rental house with electricity but no piped water and cites food and transport as his greatest monthly expenses.

loans.use: To open a photo studio shop

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda O. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a vegetable vending businesses. Her husband, Sergio O., is 56 years old and helps his wife with the businesses. They have 6 children who arebetween the ages of 23 to 32 years. 

Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 500/day, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for the business. She hopes to continue to save up for the future and to provide for the needs of her family. Merlinda O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es: Ciro tiene 47 años, es un padre de familia muy abnegado, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos. La gran responsabilidad que tiene Ciro, lo ha llevado a tener dos trabajos, durante las noches trabaja como vigilante en una fábrica textil y por el día ofrece el servicio de transporte público. Para él es muy importante que sus hijos terminen de estudiar en el colegio para que luego se formen una profesión y por ello debe trabajar duro y parejo. Es amante del trabajo, por ello, sus vecinos lo buscan para cualquier servicio que requieran, de ese modo multiplica más sus ingresos, ya que por lo pronto desea construir su casa, en donde pueda acondicionar varias habitaciones para poder alquilarlos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFV, y se compromete en seguir pagando cada una de sus cuotas puntualmente, puesto que desea contar con nuevos préstamos mas adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fierros, cementos y demás materiales de construcción, para techar una parte de su casa.
texts.en:
Ciro is 47 years old and a dedicated father. He lives in his own home with his wife and five children. Ciro has a great amount of responsibility since he holds down two jobs. At night he works as a security guard at a textile factory and then he provides public transportation services during the day. Ciro believes it is important for his children to finish high school so that they can later pursue a profession. This drives him to work hard and put in long hours. Ciro enjoys working, so his neighbors look to him to provide any services that they need to have performed so that he can earn some extra income. He wants to build a house and plans to equip several of the rooms so that they can be made available for rent.

Ciro is taking his fourth loan with MFP. He promises to continue submitting each of his payments on time so that he can be eligible for subsequent loans. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy iron bars, cement, and other construction materials so that he can install a roof over part of his house.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to put a roof over part of his house

loans.name: Slamet

texts.en:
Slamet H. (PK-10331) is a 46-year-old man living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  He is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Slamet owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  

Slamet has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 600,000 IDR a month from these activities. Slamet really enjoys this business, especially when seeing the buyers are satisfied with the service.

In 2010, Slamet joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve  his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Slamet is requesting a new loan of 4,500,000 IDR from MUK which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Slamet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of his children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation, and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


  


Slamet H. (PK-10331) merupakan 46 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Slamet memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual makanan ringan & makanan kecil lainnya di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Slamet sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Slamet menghasilkan sekitar 600.000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2010, Slamet bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Slamet telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4.500.000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli inventaris & modal kerja tambahan.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.  Slamet berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking..  "

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat S. (pictured above) is 42 years old and her husband, Mr. Sarat Vat, is 48 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have two children -- one son and one daughter. The son is a driver and the daughter has full-time employment.   

Mrs. Sinat sells clothes in Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists his wife in the business. He hopes establish a business selling meatballs, but he does not have capital. Hence Sinat is asking for a loan of $500 to provide capital for her husband.  

Sinat’s husband will use the loan to buy a motorbike to carry meatballs for sale.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to carry meatballs for sale.

loans.name: Mercy Akinyi

texts.en:
Mercy O. is 22 years old and married to Alfred Odhiambo. They have two children, Eugene is four years old and in baby class and Chrissy who is three months old. They live in Oruba area in Migori.

Mercy is a tailor and has been doing this business for the past three years. She is known for making nice African clothes and has thus created a large clientele. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client of KADET. Mercy will use the money to buy materials to add to her stock so that she can meet the demands of her clients during the festive season. Her monthly income comes to Kshs 8,000.

Her desire is to expand her business and open  a big wholesale shop for her materials in Migori town.

loans.use: Buy supplies of materials to add to her inventory

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy S., 52, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temples. 

S. refines rice wine, earning an income of about USD 12 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. S. has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 65 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit A. operates an internet club providing internet and computer services.  Davit started by providing his services for free, following his University graduation.  After acquiring experience and permanent clients Davit has opened his own business, serving the local community’s increasing demand.  Davit is planning to use the loan to make two more computer cubicles.

loans.use: To make two more computer cubicles for his internet and computer services business.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre A. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. He is 31 years old, separated from spouse, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Silvestre owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services while his wife is buying and selling foods to local community members. Silvestre has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Silvestre joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvestre has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI., which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Silvestre is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be Silvestre's second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-age children, and is the only income provider for the family. He's been working as a taxi driver / student driver since 2006. In addition, he works as a food chef on occasion.
