In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or a small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing and other family expenses.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to repaint his van and perform the necessary maintenance so he can transport students and customers in a secure vehicle.

loans.use: To repaint his van and perform the necessary maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He started his career at a young age working in a barber shop for eight years. This young man was able to open his own barber shop in 2007. He cooperates with his parents in the family’s income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his shop by placing new bricks and doing needed painting to attract more customers and serve them in an appropriate place.

loans.use: To place new bricks and do needed painting

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 31 años, es una mujer hermosa. Su familia la conforma su esposo Edwin y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama mucho. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Para salir adelante, Rebeca trabaja en conjunto con su esposo, quien se dedica al trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas La Merced – Santa Ana. Mientras ella trabaja como mesera en un restaurante de comida típica. Pero el mayor pasatiempo de ellos es la agricultura, donde siembran café, plátanos y rocoto. Todos los fines de semana ellos salen a los campos a cuidar de sus cultivos. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello y  sus planes es mejorar sus cultivos y así obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde depositó toda su confianza segura de que podrá lograr sus objetivos. Rebeca, a diferencia de todos los agricultores de su zona, se está preparando para la cosecha, y para la siguiente plantación de café. Por ello con el crédito que recibirá, comprará 5 mil plantitas de café, en el que luego lo plantará en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 31, is a beautiful woman.  Her family is made up of her husband, Edwin, and their three children, whom she loves very much.  They live together as a family in their own house located in the community of Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  To get ahead, Rebeca and her husband both work.  He’s in public transportation covering the La Merced-Santa Ana route while she works as a waitress at a restaurant serving typical dishes.

Most of the time, however, they spend farming coffee, bananas and peppers.  They go out every weekend to tend to their fields.  They have been in this line of work for 5 years now and their plans are to improve their fields to earn better profits.

She is a member of the “Prestatarios de la Unión” (La Unión Borrowers) and this is the first loan she’s had with MFP where she placed all her trust sure that she will be able to reach her goals.

Rebeca, unlike all the other farmers in her area, is getting ready to harvest and then start on the coffee planting.  Because of this, she will use the loan she’ll get to buy 5000 little coffee plants that she’ll then plant in her fields.

loans.use: To buy 5000 coffee plants.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is married and lives with her husband and 6 dependents. Her husband is a security man.  Alima sells charcoal in both small and larger quantities at Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is responsible for the utility bills as a way of supporting her husband financially. Her loan will be used to purchase additional bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.
In this picture, Alima is standing beside a bag of charcoal. The black polyethylene bags have charcoal in them to serve those who cannot afford the bigger bag but can acquire some in a smaller quantity.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Saint Joseph Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINT JOSEPH est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes de la même Communauté Ecclésiale. Ce sont des femmes qui se retrouve au tour des activités de leur Paroisse. Elles mènent en général le petit commerce et l'élevage de porcs. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de l'Association des femmes Catholiques de la Sainte Thérèse.

Madame ÉMILIE C. (debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.

Elle fait du petit commerce de  biscuits et de produits laitiers. Elle pratique cette activité bien avant qu'elle n'adhère au Banc Villageois

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers.

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la nourriture de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The Saint Joseph solidarity group was created on December 4, 2007. It is composed of nine women who belong to the same church community. They see each other at parish activities. They run small businesses and raise pigs. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of the Association of Catholic Women of Sainte Thérèse.

Mrs. ÉMILIE C. (standing at the far left of the photo) is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She runs a small business selling biscuits and dairy products. She started this activity long before she became a member of the Banc Villageois. Her new loan will allow her to better develop her activity and boost her revenue.

Her goal is to help feed the family while increasing her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To develop and promote her small business activity

loans.name: Varinka

texts.en: Farming is the main way of life in Pokr Sepasar, Armenia.  Most of the inhabitants were born there and try as best as they can to raise families.  Varinka Minisyan was also born in Pokr Sepasar and has been faming the land for 20 years.  She and her husband have been blessed with five children – three daughters (22, 23 and 24 years old) and two sons (10-year-old twins). Varinka would like to grow the business with a loan to purchase feed and livestock. She expects the family income to grow by 25 percent with the investment.  By expanding her business the family wants to continue their life in Pokr Sepasar.

loans.use: To purchase feed and livestock

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard lives with her husband and two children in the village of Argina. The family's main income comes from agriculture and horticulture. The family has a cattle farm and grows apricot trees. Alvard’s husband has a tractor which gives him the opportunity for additional income during the high season. Currently the agricultural machinery requires repair before the busy season starts. This loan will cover the costs of repair work.

loans.use: to repair machinery

loans.name: Moritas Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe Fabiola E. cruz, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos a su responsabilidad  y son: Lucia Guadalupe de catorce años, Luis Daniel de once años, Alberto Epifanio de cinco años,  y la más pequeña de cinco meses de edad Fabiola Jacqueline.
           Solicito el préstamo  invertirlo en la compra de mercancía y así poder  surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en la que inicio hace unos meses  y comenta que le va bien.
          Para iniciar con esta actividad  lo planeo con su esposo, así trabajar juntos y tener ingresos para sacar adelante a su  familia  que es muy importante para ellos  dos el bien estar de cada uno de sus pequeños.
         Su más grande deseo es lograr incrementar  día a día  su negocio, para tener ahorros y solventar los gastos generados en el crecimiento  de su niña que nació de seis meses por una operación que le realizaron a Fabiola y fue muy peligrosa, pero gracias a Dios estan bien. 
Las dos integrantes mas del grupo son: 
Lucia L. A.: cambio de negocio y esta vez sera para la venta de pollos aliñados.
Lizbeth Z. S.: utilizara el prestamo en la compra de productos para su estetica.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Fabiola E. Cruz lives in Coapilla in Chiapas state in Mexico.  She is married and has four children in her care who are: Lucia Guadalupe who is 14-years-old, Luis Daniel who is 11-years-old, Alberto Epifanio who is five-years-old, and the youngest who is five-months-old is Fabiola Jacqueline.  

She is requesting the loan to invest it in buying merchandise so that she can stock her grocery store that she started a few months ago and that she says is doing well.

To begin with this activity she planned it with her husband so that they could work together and have income to get ahead with their family as the welfare of each one of their children is very important to both of them.

Her biggest hope is to be able to increase her business day by day, to have savings, and to pay for the expenses generated by the growth of her daughter who was born six months ago and for the operation done on Fabiola that was very dangerous, but thanks to God they are okay.

The two other members of the group are: Lucia L. A. who changed her business and this time it will be for the sale of marinated chicken and Lizbeth Z. S. who will use the loan to buy products for her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to be able to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda, a  41-year-old married mother of a two-year-old, has been selling beer for three years, She is assisted in this well-organized business by two employees and operates from 6 am until 12 pm everyday.  Sauda has requested a loan from Kiva to purchase more beer to sell including Skol, Primus, Redbrul, etc. With the additional profits, she will renovate her house and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beer to sell such as Skol, Primus, Redbrul, etc.

loans.name: Monjuma

texts.en:
Monjuma is 35 years old and lives in Sinkor.  She is married with 4 children between the ages of 8 and 15 years.  Her husband is a health worker. 
Monjuma started manufacturing soap four years ago.   Her biggest challenge is the heat which causes a lot of problems.  Monjuma is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and caustic soda to manufacture more soap. She hopes to be a big business woman and earn more money in the future.

loans.use: to purchase oil and caustic soda to manufacture more soap

loans.name: Thoi's Group

texts.en:
Thoi is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is N. Xá 1 - Nhóm 18 (18).

Thoi  is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily chickens, for sale. Thoi has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from it.

In 2007, Thoi joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thoi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Thoi's 4th loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and to buy ducks.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thoi  0 (0) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Thoi  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là N. Xá 1 - Nhóm 18 (18).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Thoi  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thoi  kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Thoi  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thoi  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 0,007 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Huề  là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế như sắt vụn.


2.  Vân là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng lúa.


3.  Hiển là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.


4.  Hương là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm như trứng gà, trứng vịt.


5.  Thực là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải.


6.  Hương là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm như gạo, đỗ, lạc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, ella vive con su novio y tres hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Esta es una zona rural de condición humilde, que no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Rosa es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (harina, arroz, fideos, condimentos, azúcar, etc.) y bebidas en una pequeña bodega instalada en el interior de su domicilio, afortunadamente Rosa cuenta con clientes establecidos en su zona. Rosa también se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, que luego comercializa en los caseríos cercanos al suyo.

Rosa solicita un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega, además comprará alimento balanceado para su ganado y hará algunas mejoras en el interior de su casa, el dinero restante será de uso personal.

Rosa es una clienta conocida para Edpyme Alternativa y goza de un buen récord de pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old and lives with her boyfriend and three children in the district of Tambogrande – Piura.  This is a rural zone, with humble conditions, that does not count on all the basic services.

Rosa is a hard-working woman that has a great desire to help her family get ahead.  She dedicates herself to selling groceries (flour, rice, noodles, condiments, sugar, etc.) and beverages from a small general store located in her home.  Luckily, Rosa counts on established customers from her area.  Rosa also dedicates herself to raising sheep and poultry, which she then sells in the villages near hers.

Rosa requests a loan of 2000 new Peruvian Soles that she will invest into the purchase of groceries to supply her store.  In addition, she will buy balanced feed for her animals and will make some improvements to the interior of her house.  The remaining funds will be for personal use.  Rosa is a client known to Edpyme Alternativa, and she enjoys a good loan repayment history.

loans.use: buy groceries for her store, balanced feed for her animals, and improve her home.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a 51- year old married woman living in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Guillerma’s husband works as a farmer.

Guillerma has been growing rice for 18 years. She works hard to help her husband sustain their family. She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, gasoline for the tractor and to pay for labor.

Guillerma hopes to have her younger children finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, gasoline for the tractor and helps pay for labor

loans.name: Jamal's Group

texts.en:
Jamal, 42, is the treasurer of this group. She is bringing up two sons, both of whom are at school. In order to earn money to meet the family needs, her husband went to work in Russia. 

Two years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Jamal purchased 50 chickens and started to breed poultry. Selling the eggs and some chickens, she earns an additional 2000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to repair the house. With money received from the loan, Jamal wants to purchase feed for poultry. In the future, she wishes to build a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for poultry

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del  departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Margarita se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace varios años, negocio que a instalado en su domicilio, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 para comprar una máquina remalladora y de material como tela e hilos para seguir elaborando sus prendas de vestir. Con el buen servicio que brinda y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Margarita con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante, al igual que a su familia para ser cada vez mejores.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in her own house, which has water and electrical services.  They live in an urban zone in the Lambayeque department.  This zone is known for farming, raising livestock, and tourism.

Margarita has been making and selling clothes for several years.  This business is set up in her home.  She has her own customers, and she also does work by orders.  There is not much competition in this line of work.  With the income she will get she will be able to cover the family necessities. 

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative through its Seed Capital 2000 program.  She will use the loan to buy an overlocker (a machine that finishes seams) and supplies like fabric and thread in order to continue making clothes.  The good service that she offers and finishing the orders that have been made will allow her to have more income in order to improve her family’s quality of life.  With great effort and work Margarita has known how to get ahead in her business.  She has also gotten her family ahead in order to keep improving.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine and material to keep making clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose has five children. Three of the children are in school. She is a married woman.  She sells tomatoes, eggs and okra. She has been in this business for one year. The loan will be used to purchase more tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es:
Aparicio es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi, esta en Finca Perú desde hace 8 años, su esposa lo invitó, ella es socia desde hace 16 años, desde esa fecha juntos trabajaron con la ayuda que Finca les daba y pudieron con mucho esfuerzo y responsabilidad obtener una Cancha de Grass Sintético, pudieron terminar su casa y se compraron su carrito, tambien tienen un puesto de venta de carne en el Mercado Nery Garcia.
aparicio esta muy agradecido con los prestamos que recibe, porque contribuyeron a poder cumplir sus sueños y ahora su deseo es poder enviar a estudiar a sus hijos al extranjero, el prestamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar reces para poder venderlas.
texts.en:
Aparicio’s a member of the “Musuq Rumi” communal bank.  He’s been in Finca Perú for 8 years.  His wife invited him; she’s been a member for 16 years.  Since then, they’ve worked together with Finca’s help and with much effort and responsibility were able to obtain a synthetic grass playing field, finish their house and buy a car.  They also have a stand in the Nery García market selling meat.

Aparicio is very grateful for the loans he gets because they contributed to his being able to realize his dreams.  Now his wish is to send his children abroad to study.  The loan he’s asking for will be used to buy beef at wholesale to sell.

loans.use: to buy beef at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motocycle

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is married and has four school-aged children. She is 49 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a motorcycle driver on whom the family relies primarily for their day-to-day needs.

Asuncion sells several snack items in the local community to earn a living. She sells rice cakes, sweetened rice, hotcakes, cassava cakes, breads and more. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw materials used in making snacks to sell.

Asuncion is a current member of GDMPC. This is her first loan transaction with GDMPC. 

In the future, Asuncion hopes to expand her product offerings and own a small food stall in a school or in a trading site where there is a potential of gaining more income to support the children's education and provide stability for the business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials used in making snacks to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him, and his desire is to educate his children up to the university level. He is a farmer who grows vegetables to earn a living; he has been doing this for the last 15 years. His challenge is seasonal changes. His dream is to practice mechanised farming. John needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jorge Junior

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  ”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio  es el Sr. Jorge  tiene 23 años de edad; el socio es soltero, el socio trabaja en hotelería, el socio desea  invertir el crédito en la compra de un microondas, el socio ira pagando su  préstamo con el pago de su mensualidad, el socio desea  invertir en la compra de su microondas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un microondas.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the Atipay village bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. Jorge is 23 years old and unmarried. He works in a hotel. He would like to invest this loan in the purchase of a microwave, which he will pay off with his monthly paychecks.
Jorge is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time and in full.

loans.use: to buy a microwave.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 28 years old and still single. He supports a family of three members. Wilfred buys and sells tea leaves from the local suppliers and sells them to the nearby tea factory for processing. He has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.

He has opted to borrow a loan of KES.35,000 from KADET LTD  as his second loan, after he repaid the previous one successfully. He wishes to use this amount to increase the quantity of tea for resale. The profits will be used to plough back to business and repay back the loan.

His dream is to excel in business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves from local suppliers to sell

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 26 years old, married and a father of two children. He has operated a motorcycle transport business in Malindi for the last three years, with a monthly profit of KES 5,000.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 17,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to service his motorcycle repair worn-out parts. Part of the loan will be used to start a green grocery shop for his wife.

He will save the anticipated profits and provide for the basic needs of his family. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and repair worn-out parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Christian Rolando

texts.es:
El Sr. Christian tiene 37 años de edad, está acompañado con la Sra. Olga de 27 años, tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijos, quienes son el motor de la vida de ellos.
El Sr. Christian se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y bebidas, comenta que trabaja en esto hace 2 años. Anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en el exterior con su compañera, pero pudieron hacerse de capital para emprender el negocio, y en la actualidad ya les va muy bien, pues tienen muy buena clientela y muy buena venta.
Solicitó este crédito para la compra de bebidas, hamburguesas, tomates y demás, ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta de sus productos. Tiene como anhelo ir creciendo día a día con su negocio para poder brindarles una vida digna a su familia.-
texts.en:
Señor Christian is 37 years old and lives with his partner, Señora Olga, who is 27. They are blessed with 2 children, who are the motivation for all that they do. 
Señor Christian works selling hamburgers and drinks, and has been doing so for 2 years. Previously he could be found working outdoors with Señora Olga, but they were able to raise enough capital to start their business, and it is now going very well. They have a good customer base adn very good sales. He is seeking the loan to buy drinks, hamburgers, tomatoes and other things, because there is great demand for his wares. He aims to go on growing the business day by day, so that he is able to offer his family a decent life.

loans.use: To buy hamburgers and drinks to stock his snack-bar.

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en:
Yeat is a 42-year-old mother, who is married and has three children, two of whom are dependents working as tailors. She lives in a rural area in the Ponhea Krek district, where farming is common. She started farming on her rice field 20 years ago to make a living. Sometimes, she works for others for additional income. With her current business, she earns around three US dollars per day to feed her family. 

Yeat has been with VisionFund since 2008. She completely repaid her last loan with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund helped her to regularly afford sufficient food and make her standard of living better. Now requesting another loan, she will use this loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield to earn more income to build on some savings for her family’s future needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is a widow. She has two adult sons who left the family. Tatyana sells women's clothing at an open market in Berdyansk town. She has been in this business for 12 years and knows it well. Tatyana would like to purchase additional inventory for the current winter season. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her business conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Angelica tiene 52 años de edad tiene dos hijos adultos quienes han sido su motor para salir adelante y hou en día son su apoyo en todos los proyectos que ella emprende.
Desde hace 10 años la Sra. Angelica inició su negocio vendiendo comida ahi mismo colocó una pequeña vitrina con golosinas, actualmente solo se dedica a la venta de golosinas y aprovecha de campañas para venta de ropa y juguetes.
Gracias a su trabajo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, brindarles estudios y mejorar su casa. Una de sus metas es ampliar su negocio a lo mejor ofreciendo sus golosinas al por mayor.
En ésta ocasión ella invertirá en la compra de adornos navideños para aprovechar la demanda en el mes de diciembre.
texts.en:
Angelica is 52 years old and has two grown-up children who have been the driving force behind her getting ahead in life.  Now they are her support in all the projects that she undertakes.

Ten years ago, Angelica started her food business where she also set up a small display case with some candies inside.  She currently only sells candies but also makes the most of the different sales seasons in order to sell clothes and toys.

Thanks to her work, Angelica has managed to get her children ahead in life, provide them with an education and improve their home.  One of her aims is to expand her business, probably offering her candies wholesale.

On this occasion, Angelica will invest in buying Christmas ornaments in order to make the most of the demand which exists during the month of December.

loans.use: to buy Christmas ornaments to sell over the Christmas period

loans.name: Hoeu

texts.en:
Hoeu is a 46-year-old widow with three dependent daughters who are working as garment factory workers. To make a living, she has been farming on her rice paddy for five years. In addition to rice farming, she also runs a small grocery store selling food, cake, vegetables etc. in front of the garment factory where her daughters work, and she also raises poultry (chickens and ducks) for additional income. 

Hoeu has been a member of VisionFund for one year. She completely paid back her first loan with VisionFund. Now her family's condition has been gradually improved and she can earn nine U.S. dollars per day but is able to save only $3 daily. After her successful first loan, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use the loan to buy more grocery items to sell and a portion to buy animal feed. She hopes to increase her business to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell and animal feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a married woman. She has two children, twins at age of ten years. She describes herself to be patient, caring and determined. She operates a grocery store, where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy populated area, and her primary customers are residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Lillian's business goal is to venture into a retail shop within the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg-5C Group

texts.en:
Maa Thakurani SHG-5C was formed by gathering like-minded women, from similar socio-economic status, residing in a small village of the Koraput district of Odisha. 

Bimala, standing right is the proud member of this group. Bimala has a small scale business and is very hardworking. But in spite of her effort she could hardly manage her basic needs like food, clothes, etc. from her family income and is left with no saving for her children's education. 

With the intention to increase her savings, Bimala approached Peoples Forum for a group loan of 36,000 INR. From this loan, Bimala will add more varieties of fresh and dry fish and will expand her fish shop and Kumari will be able to add more stock to her grocery shop. 

Bimala will be using her savings which she would make after expansion of her business to repay the loan in twelve monthly installments and this additional savings will be used in her children's education in good English medium and will give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to add more varieties of fresh and dry fish in her fish shop

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Being a single mother is quite hard especially when all your children are in college stage according to Milagros,she felt this situation when her husband passed away.Despite of what happened to her husband,Milagros stand in her own feet and divert her loneliness and sadness in running a sari-sari store business.She realized that she needs to be strong and strive hard to sustain the daily needs of her children.It's been 11 years running her business but there’s a time that she   was not able to manage her business well due to accident.By that time she temporarily close it,but later when she was fine she continue her business.This time she runs her variety store and direct selling business.With her determination to increase her stocks of grocery items and AVON products she is seeking for additional capital of PHP8,000.She knows that it has much something to do with the improvement of her income and sales daily.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items and AVON products to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has been running this small store for about 2 years. She is in need of investment capital because she wants to begin selling chicken, beef and eggs. Currently, she can only afford to invest in basic goods such as sugar and oil, but her clients are in demand of many more products. She started the business with the help of her sister in law who has experience in with small stores. Patricia is 45 years old and has 6 children, although only 1 of them still lives at home. She and her husband, who is a construction worker, own their home which is made out of wood and bamboo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Begin selling chicken, beef and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy a computer

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. is a 33-year-old entrepreneur and mother of four school-aged children, including a pair of twins. She and her husband live in Kisumu, Kenya.

Christine was unable to complete her college studies due to family circumstances, and thus tried selling grains as her first business. The cost of transportation, however, substantially limited her profits. Shortly thereafter, she began her current business of selling second-hand clothes. She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, casual and formal tops, and is currently in the process of learning dress-making.

Christine periodically travels to Nairobi, where she can purchase a large variety of clothes at wholesale prices. The prime location of her business on a busy street, her eight years of experience there, and her friendly interaction with customers have enabled her to establish a good clientele base. Her customers return to her shop for her wide selection and to make requests for certain styles. Christine requires US $ 800 to expand her business and purchase additional clothing.

loans.use: Increase clothing stock.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario is a very hard-working and responsible married mother of three. To improve her family's quality of life, Maria started working as a door-to-door saleswoman, but she didn't earn a sufficient amount. She then decided to go out on her own and opened her own convenience store three years ago. Thanks to the good service she provides she has been able to grow her business and increase her sales. Love for her family is a constant motivator.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase supplies to offer a wider variety of products. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in this business' development. Maria is grateful for the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria del Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Maria comenzó a trabajar con las ventas, las realizaba casa por casa pero no recibía una remuneración suficiente, entonces decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace tres años, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. El amor hacia su familia es lo que la motiva a esforzándose más cada día.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrece y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Maria agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, 57 years old, mother of 5 children, lives in Baalback, in the east of Lebanon, and sells clothes at the "local open-air market". Mona has borrowed 7 consecutive loans from Al Majmoua and has an excellent history of on-time repayment.

Most of the time, Mona has been borrowing to increase her business inventory and to help her children financially. Indeed, Mona is the main family breadwinner and through her business profits she was able to pay for her daughters' and sons' weddings and to purchase home furniture and appliances on their behalf.

Mona needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to buy some inventory for her business and buy furniture for her youngest son who will get married soon.

loans.use: Buy clothes inventory for her business and furniture for her son's house

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is an entrepreneur who owns a small retail shop selling different items. She is a widow and has 4 children. Hawa is in the battle against poverty and for the betterment of her family and society as well. She is asking for a loan to buy a small refrigerator to store products. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Buying a small refrigerator

loans.name: Loloma Vaimaa

texts.en: Loloma is new to the SPBD programme. She wants to utilise this first loan to improve the small farm that she currently has. Her family depends on the farm income for all their expenses and she has joined SPBD programme with the hope that her farm can be sustained and will continue to bring in money for the whole family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her small farm

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (E) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Fatumah is 32 years old and married with four children. She has a reail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to increase her sales and pay school fees for the children. Carol has a video library and wants to use the loan to purchase more tapes and DVDs. Patience wants to purchase more shoes for sale.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Kadiba Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Irene K.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Irene is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 2 children aged 15 and 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and add to her business. Irene has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Irene is joined in her small group by Betty K. and Hadijah N.. Betty K. has a hair dressing business and wants to buy more hair oils. Hadijah N. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To boost clothing business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to the Santa Bárbara Community Bank group and lives at Mz Z Lt. 15 in Asentamiento Humano Los Rosales. She sells her products in the Market #2, stand #11 in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She's 52 years old and is the mother of 6 children. She's separated from her husband.

In her stand in the market she sells natural products and medicines. Her stand is open from 8 am - 8 pm.

WIth this loan of 2000 soles, which she will pay back in 5 months, she will purchase more natural products such as: colognes, perfumes, floral baths, candles, medicinal herbs, etc. All of which to increase her business.

Blanca is very happy. Her business is growing and her sales are increasing. All of her strength and hard-work goes into giving the best to her children and having a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, vive en el Asentamiento Humano. Los Rosales Mz Z Lt 15 y vende en el Mercado No 2 puesto No 11, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 6 hijos, es separada En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto donde vende sus productos naturales y medicina natural, abre su puesto a las 8 am., y atiende hasta 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos naturales como: colonias, perfumes, baños de florecimiento, velas, hiervas medicinales, etc. Todo ello para incrementar su negocio. Blanca esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles lo mejor a sus hijos y tener un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more products for her store

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru:
Buri T. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 54 years old, married and has five children. He is in the animal husbandry business and has a small cow house where he breeds several calves. He needs a loan to buy more calves of a better pedigree. It's necessary in order to get a pedigree offspring. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошев Бури проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 54 года. Женат , имеет 5 детей. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство. Где разводится несколько бычков. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить бычка хорошей породы. Это необходимо для получения породистого потомства. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Rosario belongs to the Communal Bank of the Flowers of Paradise, located at Jr Apurimac 526 in the Calleria District, of the Ucayali Department. She is 61 years old and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a merchant, but the income that he realizes does not serve to maintain the family. Therefore, Rosario decided to invest the first loan that shereceived from Manuela Ramos in a business selling fish and bananas.

Now she has a store of fish and bananas in the veranda of her house, and to do this she gets up at 6am in order to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and later she works at the business until 5pm.

With the loan, which she will repay in 4 months , she will buy: 5 bunches of bananas, 10 kilograms of fish, fruit, etc.

Rosario is a very hardworking woman who never liked to depend on anyone, and this is why she has always moved forward based on her own merits. This allows her to feel good and her business is growing little by little thanks to the help that Manuela Ramos has brought.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosario pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Apurimac 526, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Rosario con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio D. venta D. pescado y plátano. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto D. venta D. pescados y plátanos en la vereda D. su casa, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo y luego se dedica a la atención D. su negocio hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,600 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 5 racimos D. plátano, 10 kg D. pescado, frutas, etc. Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora nunca le ha gustado depender D. nadie es por eso que siempre ha salido adelante por sus meritos propios, esto le permite sentirse bien y su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: With this loan, Rosario will buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nilvia Marisol

texts.es:
Nilvia is married and has two children. She started her own business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Two years ago, she started selling shoes, clothing, toys, and assorted products at the local outdoor markets. Because she now has more customers, she deals with a large volume of merchandise, which has led her to pay transportation fees.

She currently needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, because she would like to buy a freight tricycle in order to avoid transportation fees. She would like to transport the merchandise herself since the markets in which she works are not far from her home. With your help, Nilvia will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Nilvia es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Ella inicio el negocio para apoyar a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Comenzo hace 2 años con la venta de ropa, zapatos, juguets y productos diversos en los tianguis, actualmente el volumen que maneja de mercancía la ha obligado a tener que pagar fletes para transportarlos, ya que sus clientes son mas

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que desea comprar un triciclo para evitarse el gasto de fletes y poder transportar la mercancía, ya que los tianguis donde labora no estan lejos de su domicilio. Con tu ayuda Nilvia saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase freight tricycle

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana lives in a neighborhhood called Villa Reconciliacion. She is married and has 4 children, only one of them is still studying in school and dependent on her. Johana has worked selling clothing for 24 years. Her husband helped her by selling an old business he had so that she could start her business. She has had ups and downs in her work, especially when customers don't pay their bills and she sells on credit.

She would like to grow her business and increase her sales. She will use the loan to purchase more women's clothing, which is always in great demand.

Johana habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente uno depende de ellas, está estudiando. Johana se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 24 años, su esposo le ayudó dándole la liquidación de un antiguo trabajo para que ella pudiera iniciar el negocio. Johana tiene temporadas buenas y malas, su trabajo se le hace díficil cunado tiene clientes que no le pagan a tiempo ya que ella vende al crédito. Sus planes son poder extenderse en su negocio y así incrementar sus ventas. El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de ropa de damas, que siempre es la más demandada por sus clientes.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS, ESPECIALLY WOMEN'S CLOTHING WHICH IS ALWAYS IN GREAT DEMAND.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin C., age 36, grows rice and earns around $2 of profit a day. Her husband has a business collecting the villagers' harvest and plowing their farmland. On average, he makes about $3 of profit per day. This couple has three children and all of them are students.
Mrs. Sin C. would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a hand-tractor for her husband. This will allow family to use the hand-tractor to earn more profit to support the family. (Mrs. Sin C. is pictured with her husband.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: Mrs. Sin Chenda would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a hand-tractor for her husband.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Le Thi N. is 33 years old. She joined TYM in 2003. At first she borrowed a loan for her animal raising business. Being quick-witted and resourceful, she realized that there was an increasing demand for food and consumer products in her area while there were not many shops and groceries. That was why she decided to open a grocery of her own. Up to now she has run this grocery for 5 years with additional capital from TYM and her grocery is getting bigger and bigger. With the profit from her business and income from her husband, a carpenter, her family has a stable income of VND 3 million per month and their living standard is improved a lot. In the coming time, she wants to borrow VND 15 million to invest more in her grocery.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Gladys Carola

texts.es:
Gladys Carola A. G. lives in Ayacucho, Perú. She works in her hardware store and sells cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years and has had her hardware store for 1 ½ years. She is single and owns her own house.

She will use her loan of 1,650 soles to invest in her businesses to buy more products for her cosmetics business including make-up, make-up brushes and accessories, and for the hardware store, tools, scissors and locks.
texts.en:
Gladys Carola A. G. lives in Ayacucho, Perú. She works in her hardware store and sells cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years and has had her hardware store for 1 ½ years. She is single and owns her own house.

She will use her loan of 1,650 soles to invest in her businesses to buy more products for her cosmetics business including make-up, make-up brushes and accessories, and for the hardware store, tools, scissors and locks.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan of 1,650 soles to invest in her businesses to buy more products for her cosmetics business including make-up, make-up brushes and accessories, and for the hardware store, tools, scissors and locks.

loans.name: Mr. Phallin Hak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group, consisting of 13 people, is based in the Boeng Krum Kraom Village in Kandal Province. Mr. Phallin H., 28 years old, is the president of the group and earns income driving a Tuk Tuk. His wife, Mrs. Phan Saron, is a garment factory worker. Unfortunately, Mr. Phallin H.'s business currently does not ensure enough income, because the motorbike needs to be repaired. He is therefore asking for a loan to be able to improve his business by fixing the motorbike. 
Village bank loans are mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans, while others have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product, because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Motorbike repair

loans.name: Khoek

texts.en: Mrs. Khoek S. lives in Koktlokroam Commune in Siem Reap Province, is 29 years old, and has two young children. She is a farmer and specializes in growing rice, to pay for their daily living expenses. Her husband, Mr. Chhem Lon, age 26, is a fisherman, and also raises fish in a local pond near his house in his village. Khoek needs to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to make transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to make transportation easier

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Mrs. Neng K. was born in 1961 and lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province. She has three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, one sells cake in the local village, and the youngest stays at home doing housework. Her husband, Mr. Saom Rin, is a farmer cultivates rice on a small piece of land he owns. He is also in the photo.

She earns a living by breeding pigs. Since the business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem S., 41, has operated a grocery store for about 10 years, typically making around $3 each day. She lives in Bati District, Takeo Province, Cambodia, where her husband, S. Thy, 43, pictured with his wife here, is a soldier earning $2 a day. They have two school-aged children. 

Hem is asking for a loan of $1000 to increase her stock of groceries in order to meet client demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Margert

texts.en:
Margret J. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and simsim and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher. She has two children, who both go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her shop rent and her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling groundnuts and simsim.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar S., 33, is a married father of two daughters. His wife is a 32-year-old English teacher at an elementary school. His eldest daughter goes to elementary school, while the youngest one stays at home.

Ganbaatar's family moved from Umnugobi, one of Mongolia's southern provinces, to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, five years ago. As soon as he moved, he began to run a car-supply sales business at a local outdoor car-supply market named "Uguumur." His friends helped him to begin his business. During the spring, car-supply sales normally increase; therefore with this loan, he wants to buy more supplies.

This is Ganbaatar's first ever loan with the bank. He is a humble and friendly person.

loans.use: To buy car supplies

loans.name: Jérémie 3:16 Group

texts.fr: Josée N. est entrée dans le monde des micros affaires depuis 1980 avec un capital initial de $35. Sa première activité était d’acheter et revendre les différents savons. Elle les achetait dans une société de fabrication des savons dénommée « Marsavco » pour les revendre au marché. De 1980 à 1991, son affaire prospéra jusqu’à atteindre un capital de $700. La reforme monétaire et les pillages de 1991 en RDCongo avaient sérieusement affecté son affaire et causé une baisse. Elle relança l’affaire avec 65 cartons de différents savons jusqu’en 1997 quand les grossistes dans des magasins de Kinshasa commençaient à vendre aussi les articles en détail. Josée décida ainsi de cesser la vente des savons. De 1998 à 2003, avec un capital de $100, Josée commença à revendre du thé en cartons. Elle diversifia son activité en 2003 en ajoutant les babouches (flippers) en vue de croitre le bénéfice. Dans le souci de renforcer son affaire de façon permanente, Josée décida d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC en décembre 2008. Son affaire est entrain de se stabiliser parce qu’elle réalise par semaine un bénéfice d’environ $70. Josée est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 9 et 29 ans. Cinq d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Josée N. entered the world of micro-business in 1980 with $35 in capital. Her first business involved buying and selling different soaps. She bought them from a soap manufacturing company named Marsavco” to resell them at the marketplace. From 1980 to 1991, her business prospered, attaining $700 in capital. Monetary reform and the pillaging in 1991 in the Democratic Republic of Congo had seriously affected her business and caused a drop. She started up again with 65 boxes of different soaps up until 1997, when wholesalers in Kinshasa stores also started selling goods at the retail level. She therefore decided to stop selling soap. From 1998 to 2003, with $100 in capital, Josée started retail sales of boxed tea. She diversified her business in 2003 by adding babouches (slippers), with the goal of growing her profits. Wanting to bolster her business in an ongoing manner, she decided to join one of the HOPE RDC groups in December 2008. Her business is in the middle of stabilizing because she’s realizing weekly profit of about $70. Josée is 48 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, who range from 9 to 29 years old. Five of them attend school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mushrooms, peanuts, and caterpillars for resale in order to increase her capital and profits

loans.name: Angeline Achieng

texts.en:
Angeline Achieng J. is a 32-year-old mother of two children and four orphans (her brother’s children). She also takes care of her mother who is sick with cancer. She lives and works in Nyamasria slum where she sells eggs purchased from the chicken coops located near Kibuye market.

Angeline recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: buying chickens and eggs for re-sale

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.es: Vitalia es una mujer que siempre a trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijos Pieri 10, Emilia 8 y Lorena de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Vitalia pasa sus días en las calles tocando puertas y dejando sus productos a domicilio, ella trabaja con productos de belleza y es una vendedora muy persuasiva, pues siempre termina su día con muchas ventas. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas y aconsejarlas sobre cuales son los productos en promoción, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar por las calles tocando puertas, ya que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus sueños de tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos con mayor comodidad. Este es el primer préstamo de Vitalia con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria con el resto de sus socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles de préstamo, Vitalia planea comprar más productos de belleza, para  brindarles a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Vitalia is a woman who is always working hard to get ahead in life. She lives in her relatives' home with her three children, Pieri, age 10, Emilia, 8, and Lorena, 5. Her children are the reason behind all of her hard work. Vitalia spends her days knocking on doors and selling beauty products. She is a very persuasive salesperson, and always has made many sales by the end of the day. She has done this work for three years, and what she likes most about it is talking to her customers and advising them about products on sale. What she likes least is having to to walk the streets knocking on doors, as this is very tiring. But, she knows that it is a necessary step towards achieving her dream of having her own store where she can sell her products more comfortably.

This is Vitalia's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is committed to repaying it on time, as she would like to be eligible for more loans in the future. She is known as a very happy and loyal member of her community bank. Vitalia plans to purchase more beauty products with the 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan. This will help her provide her customers with a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maret

texts.en:
Maret O. is from the village of Danao. She is 27 years old. Maret is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Maret owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Maret is just starting this business.

In 2009, Maret joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maret is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maret from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam P. is from the town of Gracia, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Miriam is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Miriam owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling speciality food products in the local community like longganisa and chorizo. Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase inventory for her new vacant store & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Miriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and help provide the whole family's basic needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her new vacant store & working capital

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie shared that “opportunity knocks only once and blessed are those who open their door in welcoming every opportunity that comes along.” She is 40 years old and married to Milanio, who works as a farmer and carpenter.  They have three children: high-school graduates Mary Jane, 19, and Marina, 17, and Marissa, an elementary student.  

Elvie shared that she is a dreamer and a woman full of hopes.  She hopes that through her hardships in managing her hog-raising business, she could able to help her husband support the education of their children and uplift their poor living situation. She always wanted to maintain her livestock business to save something for emergency needs. 

Elsie is requesting a loan of at least PHP6,000 to have additional capital for supplying her livestock's daily feed and for buying at least one additional piglet to further improve her business for the future of her children.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell grains

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: astou D. est une ancienne de la caisse de bayelaye.elle s'active dans la petite restauration en vendant le petit dejeuner devant chez elle.elle sollicite un credit de trois cent(300 000)frs en vue de mieux rentabiliser son activite en achetant en gros les produits qu'elle utilise pour preparer son petit dejeuner.l'augmentation de ses benefices lui permettre de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou D. is a long-time member of the Bayelaye bank. She is active in food service selling breakfast in front of her house. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs with the aim of making her business more profitable by buying in bulk the products she uses for making her breakfast foods. Increasing her profits allows her to assist her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Noëlie Pulchérie

texts.fr: Noëlie Pulchérie est mariée à un polygame et est mère d'un seul garçon. Pulchérie vend des foulards de façon ambulante. Pulchérie vend aussi de l’huile d’arachide, mais sur commande aux détaillants. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Pulchérie achète ses produits. Pulchérie a déjà bénéficié d’un premier crédit de la part de ALIDé pour cette activité. Pulchérie a bien remboursé ce crédit et sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son capitale en vue de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Noëlie Pulchérie is married to a polygamist and is the mother of one boy. Pulchérie sells her scarves door-to-door. Pulchérie also sells peanut oil, but only according to orders from the retailers. It's in Dantokpa, Benin's large international market, that Pulchérie purchases her products. Pulchérie has already benefitted from her first loan with Alidé for her business. Pulchérie properly repaid her first loan and is requesting a second loan to increase her capital in order to respond efficiently to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 5 barrels of 50 liters of peanut oil and a half roll of scarves

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Verónica Martínez G. tiene 32 años de edad, tiene  5 hijos, los cuales todos son menores de edad. Cabe señalarse, la señora habita con su familia, los cuales le ayudan a cuidar a sus hijos mientras ella trabaja. La señora se dedica a la venta de comida. Además de vende ropa usada seleccionada a personas conocidas y solamente por encargos. Este negocio ella lo inicio con elaboración de comida y sopa solamente los fines de semana, y con el tiempo fue invirtiendo en la compra de ropa ya que le brinda ganancias mayores. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos que le permitirán incrementar sus ventas en las comidas, Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante de comida variada que la atienda sus familiares.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Kurbonoy

texts.en:
For the past 11 years, Kurbonoy has sold women’s national dresses. She is the married mother of five children. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Kurbonoy is hardworking and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and strong customer service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Kurbonoy has a strong business base.

Currently, she is seeking a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new vending facility so as to expand her business. With the increased income, Kurbonoy plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility so as to expand her business

loans.name: Susana Patricia

texts.es: La señora Susana Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos aun en etapa escolar.Motivada por sus ganas de sacar adelante a su familia  y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora, juntamente con su esposo, iniciaron su propio negocio de estampado en tela, con un capital de S/. 500.00, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.Así de esta manera, mantenerlos satisfechos y contentos a sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  comprando más productos como banderolas bordadas, cintas, grecas, blondas brillantes en diferentes colores y por docenas e igualmente telas y pintura para la confección de los estampados en tela.Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce y agradece el apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres, que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas, sin depender de nadie.

loans.use: Comprará banderolas bordadas, cintas.

loans.name: Vaiauau

texts.en:
Vaiauau I. is a 75-year-old woman living in the town of Saoluafata B.  She is married and has 6 adult aged children.  To make a living, Vaiauau owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Vaiauau has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Vaiauau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vaiauau has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1700 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to rent land to raise additional crops.  Vaiauau is now requesting a new loan of 2250 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vaiauau from SPBD.  Vaiauau plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Vaiauau was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to improve her land

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 34 years old and is married with three children. Currently all her children are still schooling. Her husband has been very supportive in taking care of the children.

Stella works very hard and approaches her business with commitment. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She prepares and serves her customers with gari (roasted cassava) and beans. Gari and cooked beans is a local food enjoyed by many Ghanaians for lunch.

Stella obtains her raw materials from the farming communities to prepare her meals. She wants to use the loan to buy gari, beans, vegetables, etc., in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.use: To buy gari, beans, vegetables, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Jahayra Elieth

texts.es: Jahayra Elieth de 32 años es soltera, no tiene hijos, es trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años  y se desempeña como encargada del sistema informatico geografico de esta institucion.
