Esta solicitando su 5to credito para mejorar su casa comprando zinc, pues desea cambiar parte del techo de su casa (cocina) que se encuentra en mal estado, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos cosmeticos de AVON y ZERMAT a compañeras de trabajo y otra clientela que tiene, por lo que desea utilizar parte del credito para compra de los productos y surtir su pequeño negocio, pues obtiene ingresos adicionales que le permiten pagar sus gastos.   El mayor sueño de Jahayra es formar su familia y poder brindarle las condiciones basicas para vivir en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Jahayra Elieth is 32, single, and does not have children. She has worked for the mayor’s office in Juigalpa for three years. She is in charge of the geographical information system in this institution. She is asking for her fifth loan to improve her house. She will buy zinc because she wishes to change the roof on her house (in the kitchen), which is in bad shape. She also sells Avon and Zermat cosmetic products to colleagues at work and other customers that she has. She wants to use part of the loan to buy the products to stock her small business. She gets additional income that allows her to pay her expenses. Jahayra’s biggest dream is to form a family and be able to provide them with the basic conditions to live in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc and cosmetic products

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is a single mother, 28 years old, who dreams of rising up from poverty. The apple of her eye is her son Jomari, 8 years old, a grade 2 student.

Marites is also a business minded woman. She has been in the business of a sari-sari store (a small retail store) for one year now. The business is still a good provider of their daily needs and that’s why she is requesting her second loan in the amount of 10000 PHP.

If the loan is funded, she will use the money to expand her store to gain additional proceeds and to supply her consumers and accommodate their needs. She is eager that her sari-sari store become a groceries store someday.

She benefits from her ASHI-KIVA loan because the profit she will earn will improve their standard of living. Marites also wishes to develop their house to have a comfortable shelter to live in.

loans.use: To buy rice PHP 3500, Red Horse beer PHP 3920, Matador (liquor) PHP 1056, Softdrinks PHP 1536 etc.

loans.name: Armando De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Armando De Jesús N. R., tiene la edad de 60 años, Labora como encargado de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de sus hijos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 6 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Armando de Jesus N. R. is 60 years old. He is the head sanitation inspector in the Eastern Market in Managua. He is single and takes care of 2 children, one of whom is school age. He has received loans with CEPRODEL for the last six years and thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL, he has used these loans to improve the home where he lives. He is an excellent client. The loan that he is requesting is for the labor and to buy construction materials such as: zinc, metal roofing, etc. He will use these to change the roof on his house so that he can offer his children more security and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean F., 33, is making sure that her family is provided with their daily needs. She is married to Fernando F., a factory worker, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been in the rug-making business for 11 years.

Mary Jean has been a regular member of the Kiva field partner, Center for Community Transformation* (CCT), for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow seven times through CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy raw materials for her rug-making business.  She is able to earn a profit of about $275 a month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business for buying raw materials like strips of cloth, crayons and sewing thread.

She dreams that through this added capital, her monthly profit will also increase. She prays that someday they will have their own home and that her children will graduate from college. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like strips of cloth, crayons and sewing thread.

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Mrs. Nakali D. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Chapagaun. She opened her grocery four years ago to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks, noodles, etc. in her shop. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy different types of new grocery goods for her shop.

Mrs. D. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Chandra Ram D., is a driver. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying at university and her daughter is studying in grade 9.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for resale

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn C. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de oro City. She is 35 years old. Bevelyn is single and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Bevelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Bevelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bevelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bevelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bevelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Bevelyn from HSPFI.  Bevelyn chose to have the same amount until its 5th cycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Valerio,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, nuestro socio tiene ganados y los compra y vende, también trabaja con cerámica, el está trabajando en un taller de cerámicas, nuestro socio alterna sus dos actividades y ahora solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de ganados vacunos.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Valerio is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. He lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Valerio is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 5 year old child. He has a business buying and selling cattle. Valerio also has a workshop where he works with ceramics. He divides his time between the two activities and is now requesting a loan in order to buy two heads of cattle.

Valerio is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two heads of cattle

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal CLAVELES, en su Secuencia 8, está formado por 9 clientes, 8 mujeres y 1 varon, la mayoría de las socias pertenecen a la Zona de Pampahasi(La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.

La zona abarca 16 barR. en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia). 

Todas las socias están ubicados por los alrededores de la oficina de Emprender las socias se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ser, de ropa, carteras, cosméticos, venta de comida. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción de dos socias que pagaron con sus ahorros debido que uno de sus familiares falleció, las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. 
 
La Sra. Rebeca Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo de la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de comida en el Mercado 10 de Enero cuenta con esta actividad hace 13 años, también vende Calzados en la feria de la zona San Luís de la ciudad de El Alto los días miércoles y sábados, el préstamo será destinado a la inversión en la compra de calzados por mayor.  Casada con el señor Miguel, que trabaja como carpintero independiente en la zona de Sensata , tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de la socia. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Irene Socia que asume el cargo de tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta de comida por pedidos en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones o  eventos especiales se dedica a esta actividad hace 20 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra de víveres  mayor. La socia es Viuda y mantiene un hijo que estudia en colegio. La Señora Irene Es una de las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera de grupo.

La Sra. Sofía, activa y dinámica para la redacción es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carteras en su taller Ceja  de la Cuidad de El Alto, también se dedica a la confección de ropa. El préstamo esta destinado para la compra de tela y otros insumos para la elaboración de carteras.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The community bank Claveles, in its 8th loan cycle, consists of 9 clients, 8 women and 1 man. The majority of the members live in the Pampahasi zone, located on the east side of the city. From the entrance to the zone, the point called the second crossing, the edge of Villa San Antonio, imposing buildings of up to four stories can be noticed, many of them with finished facades, as well as streets and broad avenues with asphalt surfaces, joined by parks and recreation spaces. The zone includes 16 neighborhoods in three sectors: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (Cancha Venus), and Alto Said-Cruz Pata, formerly SAMAPA, Cervecería and La Guardia). The group members work in the sale of various products such as clothing, handbags, cosmetics, and food. In the previous loan cycle, everyone paid off their loan, with the exception of two members, who paid with their savings because one of their family members had died, and they were retired from the bank. Señora Rebeca represents the group. She now has the role of president of the bank. She sells food in the 10th of January market. She has carried out this activity for 13 years. She also sells shoes in the market in the San Luis zone of the city of El Alto on Wednesdays and Saturdays. The loan will be invested in the wholesale purchase of shoes. She and her husband, Sr. Miguel, who works independently as a carpenter in the Sensata zone, have two children who depend on her. In the communal bank she has stood out as a person who is responsible and punctual in her payments. Señora Irene has the role of treasurer of the bank. She sells food on order in different locations, such as in institutions or at special events. She has worked in this business for 20 years. The loan will be used to purchase greater supplies. She is a widow and supports a son who is in secondary school. Señora Irene is one of the representatives of the community bank, who has been selected for this role because of the responsibility that she has demonstrated with the bank as a guarantor and as a member of the group. Señora Sofia, active and dynamic in writing, was chosen as secretary. She makes and sells handbags in her workshop in Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto. She also makes clothing. The loan will be used for the purchase of fabric and other supplies for making handbags. All the bank members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie was born in 1979. She is married with two children. The first-born child is seven years old and the last is three years old. Pascasie owns a small business selling green potatoes in the Musanze market. In the picture of Pascasie, you will find someone appearing behind her. That is a buyer of her green potatoes. Pascasie’s business is well organized. She employs one person as a helper so that her business runs well. This business has been chosen by her to serve her neighbors who are the first consumers of those kinds of products. 

Pascasie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding new products such as rice, salt, sugar and other foodstuffs needed by her customers. This loan will allow her to attract new clients, which in turn will help her to obtain more profits. With the extra money, Pascasie will try to save money for the future

loans.use: To buy new products

loans.name: Madolyn

texts.en:
Madolyn L. is a 47-year old married woman who supports her family by buying and selling rice, pig fattening and sugarcane farming. She lives in Hda. Bearin, Brgy Linao Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband who is a driver and also helps her run the business. They have 4 children who are between 12 and 21 years old, all of whom still go to school.

Madolyn has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in all of her business activities she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Madolyn is now borrowing PHP 20,000 to use on her business activities of rice sales, pig fattening and sugarcane farming. This will be her 23rd cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Madolyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera I. is 33 and married with no children.  She owns a business, selling ice cream in the local community.  Sera has one year of experience in this business.  Sera needs a loan of WST $1000 buy ice creams of different flavors and cones.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 360 talas or US $150 per week) to financially support members of her immediate family.

In 2010, Sera joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sera's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: Buy ice creams of different flavors and cones

loans.name: Oltimpau Ole

texts.en:
Oltimpau Ole L., 38, is married to Naserian L. and the father of three school-going children. For the past 15 years, Oltimpau has been farming his own piece of land. He learned about KADET from marketing awareness conducted by KADET staff in his area and is now applying for his first loan, to be used for bean and maize farming. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, Oltimpau plans to hire more land for farming to increase his production.

His dream is to practice large scale farming and attain financial independence.

loans.use: For bean and maize farming

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. prepares Fante kenkey for sale at Abura. She has no educational background. She is a widow and has six dependents.

Efua has been in the kenkey production business for some time now and is responsible for the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to prepare Fante kenkey for distribution to her customers. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to educate her children.

To prepare her kenkey, Efua buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften the maize. She washes the maize on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove (ferment) until the next day.

Efua divides the proved dough into two parts, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough) and then mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds it into balls and wraps each ball in corn husk. She then cooks them again till they becomes soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces, such as pepper sauce, with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey or any other kind of meat or fish.

The photo was taken when Efua had just lit the fire under the kenkey to boil it to get it ready for distribution.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize to prepare more Fante kenkey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase polar fleece to make clothes

loans.name: Piedad Justa

texts.es:
Piedad tiene 44 años, casada y tiene 4 hijos, Piedad tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras y carnes, además tiene cabinas de Internet y un billar en el mismo local, el billar lo implemento hace 2 meses, todas las actividades las realiza sola y con la ayuda eventual de su hija. Piedad por las noches vende salchipollos en la puerta de su tienda.
Piedad es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso y solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Piedad son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
Piedad is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Piedad has s store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. She also has Internet services and a billiards table in the same space. She has had the billiards table for 2 months. She manages all of these businesses by herself, with occasional help from her daughter. Piedad sells french fries and chicken right next to the door at her store. Piedad is a member of the “Glorisoso” communal bank and she is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar. Piedad’s dreams are that her children will become professionals and that she will be a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school.  Halima has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 2 years.  

To help expand her business, Halima is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell.  Halima hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to add more capital to her business.  In the future, Halima hopes to fly in an airplane.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan. She is 50 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy building materials such as zinc, nails, wheelbarrows, paint, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey J. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rey owns and operates a business venture operating a tricycle transport service. Rey has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Rey joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide a better service. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married and has a grown daughter whose name is Yuliya. She makes a living selling footwear in her home town of Pavlograd, where she owns two stores downtown. She started her venture over 10 years ago with the help of her husband, who still helps her run the business. It has been growing steadily and today she already has 100,000 Grivnyas invested in her small company.   

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal merchandise and re-stock her inventory with newer, trendier brands of fall shoes and boots. She loves working with this type of merchandise and is hoping to use her profits to pay her daughter’s college fee.

loans.use: to buy more footwear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hangry

texts.en:
Mr. Hangry T. lives with his widowed mother in a small village on National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mr. Hangry T. has been driving a motor taxi since 2006. A recipient of a previous Kiva loan, he is now requesting another loan of $500 to repair his house by laying bricks and plastering the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: To lay brick and plaster on the ceiling and the wall of his house.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the town of Surallah. She is 43 years old. Merlyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlyn also raises pigs for fattening and sale. 

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity W. is 38 years old and is a skilled and experienced business lady who sells cereals and groceries. She is married and together they have three children ages 12 and eight years old.

Purity started her business in 2003 with 5,000 KSH in start-up capital in Eldoret Town. She has been in this business for the past seven years with an income of 10,000 KSH per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer and she is applying for her first loan of 15,000 KSH with KADET LTD and she plans to build a stall for her business.

loans.use: To build a stall for her business.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun N. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

N. is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is employed to transport dirt, earning an income of USD 3 per day. N. has to spend USD 25 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 47 on other necessary expenses every month.  

N. is requesting a loan of USD 250 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow rice field

loans.name: Klichboy

texts.en:
Klichboy is 44 years old, married, and has one son. He is a farmer growing vegetables, something he has done for 6 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Klichboy, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the fruit of his labor grow year after year.

 In addition, Klichboy raises cattle and his family helps him with his business. Now he wants to borrow money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants in order to grow seasonal vegetables. This is the fourth loan of Klichboy from IMON International and he promises to repay the current loan without any violations and thanks all lenders for their support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Komlanvi Jean

texts.fr: Jean a 2 enfants et est âgé de 30 ans. Il est tapissier de profession. Il achète à Ahépé, Kouvé et à Lomé les bois et revient fabriquer des meubles à des clients. Il cumule 6 ans dans cette activité. Il demande un prêt pour acheter 30 bois, 5 mousses, 2 boites de peinture et  5 sachets de clous.
texts.en: Jean has two children and is 30 years old. He is an upholsterer by trade. He buys his  supplies in  Ahépé, Kouvé and, as to the wooden parts, à Lomé and returns home to make furniture for his clients. He has six   years of experience in this business. He is seeking a loan in order to purchase 30 sets of wood, five packs of foam, two boxes of paint and five bags of nails.

loans.use: Purchasing wood, foam, paint and nails

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson K. is 60 years old and a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 35 years. His main products are milk, chickens, bananas, maize, and tea, which he sells at the local market and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also depends on his pension pay to cater to the needs of his family. His major challenges in farming have been unpredictable weather conditions and poor market prices for his products.

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that he will be able to acquire another asset for his family and that they will also be able to get enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to venture into transport business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Préférence Group

texts.fr: Mbambu B.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Préférence, âgée de 40 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants.  Son conjoint est un Maitre Cuisinier dans un hôtel de la place. Elle fait le petit commerce de divers dans un kiosque érigé sur l’avenue Osso. Avant de stabiliser son activité, elle vendait des patates douces, puis les habits usagers.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (Fanta, sucres, savons, habits, cigarettes, pétrole, allumettes, sel de cuisine, babouches,  etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne construire confortablement une maison dans le quartier populaire Ndosho. La cliente Mbambu B.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe préférence est constitué de 39 membres.
texts.en:
Mbambu B., an entrepreneur and the leader of the Préférence group,i s4 0 years of age, married, and the mother of seven. Her life partner is a chef cook in a local hotel.

She has a small business selling miscellaneous items in kiosk on Osso avenue. Before settling on this business, she used to sell sweet potatoes, and later second-hand clothing. Later on, she received a loan of $50 from IMF Hekima. This new credit will allow her to stock up new items (Fanta, sugar, soap, clothing, cigarettes, gasoline, matches, table salt, slippers, etc). In addition, her goal is to be able to build a proper house in the working-class district of Ndosho. As a customer of Hekima, Mbambu appreciates its work to support the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking system. The Préférencegroup consists of 39 members.

loans.use: Fanta, sugar, soap, clothing items, cigarettes, gazoline, matches, table salt, slippers  etc

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: Meri, de 46 años, es una luchadora madre soltera que vive en compañía de su hija Jocelyn de 18 años, con quien vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de la Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer, es la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátanos. “Las mejores ganancias depende del tiempo de cosecha, si recoges el grano en el tiempo exacto, el aroma es mejor”, afirma. Ya que en el primer mes comienza la “rebusca” (proceso de selección de los granos que comienzan a madurar), en el segundo mes es la “plena” (donde todos los granos están en colmada maduración). Sus 10 años de experiencia, le ayudan a obtener buenas cosechas, por ello los mismos comerciantes de café, llegan a sus propios terrenos a comprar su cosecha entera. Ella desea seguir sembrando, y produciendo café del bueno. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se compromete a salir adelante. Meri, dentro de muy poco comenzará a cosechar su grano de café, por ello con el crédito está pensando invertir, y poder contratar peones para que le ayuden en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Meri, 46, is a hard working single mother living with her daughter Jocelyn, 18, in her own house located in the community of Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  What this hard working woman does is farming.  Her main crops are coffee and bananas.  “The best profits depend on the time of harvesting.  If you harvest the beans at the exact time the aroma is better” she affirms.  During the first month the “rebusca” (process of selecting the beans that are starting to ripen) starts.  The second month is the “plena” (when all the beans are at their peak ripeness).  Her ten years experience allows her to obtain good harvests and this is why the coffee merchants come by her fields to buy the entire crop.  She wants to continue planting and producing good coffee.

She is a member of the “Prestatarios de la Unión” (La Unión Borrowers) communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP where she commits to succeed.

Very shortly Meri will begin to harvest her coffee beans so she plans to use the loan to hire field hands to help her with the harvesting.

loans.use: To hire field hands to help with the harvest.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
For two decades, Ramatu M. has been selling banku (a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize/cassava dough, usually served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish) in Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. 

She is married with six children. Her earnings from selling banku help her husband, a mason, with some of the household expenses and their children’s school fees. 

She needs a loan to grow her business in order to increase their household income. She plans to purchase more ingredients (especially maize) with her loan so that she can increase her production. The added profits will be reinvested into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Mere Theresa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MÈRE THERESA est créé le 15 décembre 2009 au 5ème cycle du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont de la même communauté Ecclésiale. Leur activité c'est le petit commerce, l'élevage de porcs. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Sainte Thérèse.

Madame GHISLAINE N. (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de trois autres personne de sa belle famille.

Elle fait un petit commerce de chaussures et d'écharpes. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar (capitale du Sénégal) pour revendre dans son quartier.

Son objectif est d'appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille (par exemple la nourriture, la sante. Elle veut aussi renforcer son épargne pour faire des investissements pour sa famille.
texts.en: The MOTHER THERESA solidarity group was created  on December 15, 2009 during the 5th cycle of the Banc Villageois. It is composed of 11 women who are from the same church community. They are engaged in small businesses and raising pigs. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of St. Theresa Catholic Women. Mrs. GHISLAINE N., standing at the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of three children. She is also responsible for three other in-laws. She has a small business selling shoes and scarves. She gets her supplies in Dakar (Senegal's capital) to sell in her neighborhood. Her goal is to help her husband take care of the family (for example, food and health care). She also wants to bolster her savings to make investments for her family.

loans.use: To buy shoes and scarves

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with two children, one attending school, while one is yet too young to be a student. They live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business selling handbags and shoes from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanaisha also sells natural fruit juice and dreams of wholesaling it in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, she is requesting Kshs 55,000 to purchase a fridge to store natural juice for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge to store natural juice for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, none of whom are in school.  Margaret has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.  Margaret has requested for a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a restaurant.The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and seasonality.  Her aspiration is to build her own house.   Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La señora Isabel es una cliente que trabaja en banca de emprendimiento, es muy puntual y solidaria, ella tiene la actividad de venta de golosinas por mayor, ya que acomoda sus productos el los colegios y tiendas de zona, en su propia movilidad que logro comprar después de que quedo viuda, ella mantiene a sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad también viaja a Oruro y Potosí cada dos semanas llevando la mercadería y acomodar a sus clientas. El dinero del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías dulces por mayor. El sueño que ella tiene es hacer construir el terreno que heredo de sus papas para darles mas comodidad a sus hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Isabel is a borrower who is part of an entrepreneurial (communal) bank. She is very punctual and community-oriented. Her business activity is wholesale candy sales. She arranges her products in the schools and stores in her neighborhood and also in her own vehicle, which she managed to buy after she became a widow. She supports her two children, who are 10 and 4 years old. She also travels to Oruro and Potosí every two weeks, taking her products and supplying her customers. She will invest the money from the loan in the wholesale purchase of merchandise (sweets). Her dream is to build on the land that she inherited from her parents, to give her children a more comfortable life. She is a very hard-working person who is thankful to this institution for the support that they offer.

loans.use: to increase and diversify the merchandise she offers.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 29 years old and is married with one child who is 7 years old. Her business is well-organized. He employees three person for help him. Jean De Dieu works from 7 am until 7 pm every day and has six years of experience.

Jean De Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more bread, juice and water. With these profits, Jean De Dieu will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, juice, and water.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 24 year old.  She is single and lives in Jacob town.  She has been selling charcoal by the bag for the past nine years.  She has a lot of difficulty with her customers because most of them buy on credit and don’t pay on time.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to purchase twenty bags of charcoal.  With land already in her possession, she plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase twenty bags of charcoal

loans.name: Karim

texts.ar: كريم شاب عمره 28 سنة متزوج واب لولدان يعمل في بيع وغيار الزيت للسيارات وغسيل السيارات له في عمله 11 سنة يحب العمل ويسعى الى تطويره وزيادة مدخوله وتحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته هو طموح محب للعمل ويسعى الى زيادة رأس المال في العمل وتأمين سبل الحياة الكريمة لأولاده هو طموح يتميز بالعمل الجيد والتطور الدائم والاسعار الجيدة يتميز عمله بالانفراد في قريته ولكن ما يعيق تحسينه هو نقص في رأس المال فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة البضاعة من خلال شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل زيوت ومعدات للعمل كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد حيث ان تاريخه جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى دائما الدعم من العائلة يتميز بالمصداقية وحب التحسين في الوضع المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en: Karim is 28 years old and married with two children. He works selling car oils and cleaning products and has been doing this for 11 years. He loves his business and aspires to develop it and thereby increase his income improving his and his family's financial and social circumstances. He is ambitious and wants to secure a good standard of living for his children. He is known for his good services, up to date business outlook and competitive prices. His business is unique in his local area, but what holds him back is lack of financial capital. With this loan he wants to purchase more stock such as oils and equipment. The last loan had a positive impact on is business and he has good credit history with the company.

loans.use: to buy new stock for his auto parts store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de carros, ella vende carros en forma independiente, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de carros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para los carros. 
                                                       
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  

She is 39 years old, has a spouse and three children.  She alternates her daily chores with the purchase and sales of cars.  She sells cars independently.  She works from 7am until 2pm and supports her children with this work.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for a loan to buy tires for the cars.

She is happy about the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Sreng.  He is 41 years old and is a humble father of three single children who work in various jobs to earn money. 

Since 2000, Sreng has been cultivating rice on the farmland that he inherited from his grandparents in Baray district. Besides the current farm work, he also buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. His wife has built a pigpen behind their house where she raises many pigs to earn a living.   

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for the family, Sreng has requested a loan to assist his wife in her business activity.  He will use the loan to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Sabanoh Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabanoh II” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Conta village, near Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,2000,000 for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Pa Hassan. Pa Hassan is age 55. He was born in the village of Conta Bombali. Pa Hassan is married and has five children. Three of the children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Pa Hassan sells dried pepper, bowls, cotton, etc. He has been a businessman for many years now. With his share of this loan, Pa Hassan is going to buy pepper, bowls and cotton in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy pepper, bowls and cotton in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Teresa y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 49 años edad, tengo dos hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la venta de comida”. 

Teresa es madre y padre para sus hijos, ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella vende de forma ambulatoria desde las 6 de la mañana y hasta de las 6 de la noche. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas.
texts.en:
(Quillabamba is the capital of La Convencion province and an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convencion valleys.  The main source of income is farming, growing coca, coffee, cacao and fruit.)  
We visited the Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan community bank in Quillabamba and met Teresa, one of the group's members:

"I was born in Quillabamba, I'm 49 years old, I have two children, I live in the city where I was born and I operate a food catering business."

Teresa is mother and father to her children.  She's a determined and enterprising women who has worked to support her children despite all the obstacles she's faced.  She works as a street vendor from 6 in the morning to 6 at night.  She will use this loan to buy supplies--rice and sugar, for example--for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food catering business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat and fish to sell

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es hermosa por su estructura que se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 32 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en su lugar de trabajo.
 
La Señora María se dedica a cuidar una quinta, allí cuida a los animales y labora en la agricultura, lleva 11 años en esta actividad y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También tiene la oportunidad de criar sus propios animales como cuyes y pollos.
 
Este es su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cuyes.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa la misma que está en construcción.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Zhullin communal bank. She lives in the Azogues city. This is a beautiful city because of the mixture of colonial and modern architecture. Its people are kind and pleasant, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Mrs. Maria is 32, a widow, and has two children from that union. They are 9 and 14. Her son, the oldest, is in school, and her younger daughter attends a small school in the city. She does not have her own home so she lives where she works.

Maria tends to a farm. There she cares for the animals and works in agriculture. She has been doing this for 11 years and works every day of the week without a fixed schedule. She also has the opportunity to raise her own animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.

This is her fifth loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of chickens and guinea pigs.

Her goal is to finish building her home, which is under construction.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Diégane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié polygamme avec deux femmes et 7 enfants.Il vend des produits agricoles en saison sèche et  pratique l'agriculture et l'embouche bovine en période hivernale.Cette diversité d'activités lui permet d'avoir des revenus correstes pour nourrir sa grande famille.En cette période d'hivernage, il sollicite un pret de 500000F pour acheter deux boeufs afin de les engraisser et de les revendre sur le marché local.Son ambition est d'avoir une grande ferme d'élevage.
texts.en: Diégane is a polygamist with 2 wives and 7 children. He sells agricultural products during the dry season and practices farming and cattle fattening during the winter months. This range of activities allows him to earn enough money to feed his large family. He is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs for the coming winter, so that he can buy 2 oxen to fatten and resell at the local market. His ultimate ambition is to own a large cattle farm.

loans.use: to buy 2 oxen.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
For the past five years Helen, a 41-year-old married mother of three, has earned a living by operating a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

Helen has requested a loan of PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs as she works tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en:
Mwanamina is a married woman with two children. One attends school while the other is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mwanamina dreams of establishing a café business in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: El sr. Nery, agricultor,  nacido en valle grande, casado con la Sra. Yandy, ella es ama de casa y  en su tiempo libre se dedica también a la elaboración de  queso para la venta tienen dos hijos, ellos tienen una parcela en villa florida a 10km. De San Luis, donde viven  y trabajan  ellos se dedican a la agricultura. Siembran: maíz, sandia, poroto, maní y tomate y también se dedican   a la ganadería, de ahí la esposa del Sr. Nery obtiene la leche para la elaboración del queso. El dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica  el preparado de la tierra, Todo lo que siembra y cosecha lo vende en el mercado del Torno, hace cuatro secuencias que viene trabajando con la institución y se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Nery is a farmer who was born in Valle Grande.  He’s married to Yandy, a housewife who uses her free time to make cheese to sell.  They have two children and a field in Villa Florida ten kilometers from San Luis where they live and work.  They are farmers.  They grow corn, watermelon, white kidney beans, peanuts and tomatoes.  They also raise livestock which is where Nery’s wife gets the milk for the cheese making.

He will use the money from the loan to buy seeds to plant corn and to do what’s necessary to prepare the soil.  Everything he plants and harvests he sells at the market in Torno.  He’s been working with the institution for four cycles and he feels very grateful with the institution for the support it’s given him.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Maysaa'

texts.en:
Maysaa', a 24-year-old married mother of one son and three daughters, is employed with a decent salary and wants to purchase new home furniture such as living room seats, a kitchen table, etc., but due to insufficient funds she is requesting a loan from FATEN. The loan will enable her to provide her family with better living conditions at home. Maysaa' is a conservative woman, so her husband Odai is photographed instead at the FATEN branch.

About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan.

For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Mwanazia

texts.en:
Mwanazia has operated as a religion teacher for the past four years. Her potential clients are the children of her village. She faces the major challenge of lack of students at her school. She is a divorced woman with one child who is enrolled in school. She lives in her family’s house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

With this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Mwanazia wants to purchase stationary for her school. She dreams of expanding her business and adding two more classrooms. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get capital to enhance her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stationary for her school.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Primavera”, está integrado por 10 mujeres que viven en la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad, y se unieron con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos  y de esa forma darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos y familiares. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, pero deciden una vez más recurrir a la ayuda de la fundación para poder seguir creciendo cada una en la actividad que hace.
Una de ellas es la señora Bacilia, quien al igual que sus amigas se dedica a la cría y venta de animales. Gracias a su arduo trabajo en la cría de animales ella ha podido ir creciendo y ganar sus ingresos con lo cual ayuda a su familia y cubre los gastos diarios de casa. Le gustaría poder seguir creciendo cada día más y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de animales para la cría, y también para la compra de alimentos para los mismos.
Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que les da una vez más.
texts.en:
The "Primavera” communal bank is made up of ten women who live in the city of Curuguatay.  They are neighbors and friends in that city, and they came together for the purpose of earning greater income, and in that way giving their children and family members a better lifestyle. 

Currently, they are in their second loan cycle, but are deciding once again to draw on the help of the Foundation, so that each of them can continue growing in the activity that they do.

One of them is Bacilia, who just as her friends do, raises and sells animals. Thanks to her hard work raising animals, she has been able to gradually grow  her business, and earn the income she uses to help her family, and cover the daily household expenses.  

She would like to continue growing more every day, and that is why she is applying for the loan to buy animals to raise, and also to buy feed for them. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that is once again being given to her.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise, and later sell, and also animal feed.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora, vive en compañía de Evadio su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen una hija, “Andrea” a la que cuidan en casa de su mamá, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. A pesar de no contar con terrenos propios, ella obtiene buenas ganancias, pues busca socias quienes le brindan terrenos productivos para sembrar a cambio de que ella cuide los cultivos y fertilice. El dinero de la cosecha lo reparten de manera equitativa. Sus alimentos constan de, papa, alfalfa, habas y maíz. Ya tiene 4 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo también se dedicó al cuidado de sus animales como: ovejas, vacas y cuyes, los que vende a los carniceros, cuando tiene algún apuro. Ahora sembrará papa y desea comprar más ovejas; pues está esperando a su esposo que trabaja en la mina de Casapalca, el llega después de 15 días, para ayudar a voltear la tierra y en otras labores agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “palomitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Rosa, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de alfalfa para sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is a hardworking, 38 year old woman, has lived with her husband Evadio for eight years. The two of them have a daughter, Andrea, who is being raised in her mother's house, which is located in the town of Ataura. 

Although she does not have her own land, she makes a good profit. She is looking for partners who will offer her fertile land for planting in exchange for her looking after and fertilizing the crops. They would split the money from the harvest fairly.  

Her crops are potatoes, alfalfa, beans, and corn. She has four years of experience, during which she has also made a living caring for animals like sheep, cows, and guinea pigs, which she sells to butchers when needed. Now she will plant potatoes and wants to buy more sheep, but she is waiting for her husband, who works in the Casapalca mine. He comes back in 15 days to to help till the land and do other agricultural work.  

Rosa belongs to the solidarity group “palomitas” [little doves], and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She is grateful for all of your help, since you make it possible for her to continue working. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual in her payments, since it is a pleasure to work with supportive and responsible people. Rosa, upon receiving your help, will put the money towards buying alfalfa for her animals.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa as feed for her animals.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old married with 3 children.He operates a retail shop selling sugar, salt, soap and other groceries and has been in this business for 8 years. He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation,high fuel and transportation costs. His business goal is to build a house for his business and his personal goal is to educate his children.
Moses needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, salt and other groceries for sell.

loans.use: to buy  sugar , salt, soap and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu 48, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a business selling farm produce which earns her another source of income. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en: Jenneh is 37 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with four children between 9 and 18 years old. They are in school and live at home. Jenneh has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) for the past twenty-five years. She says her main challenge is the location of her restaurant. Jenneh started this business with the help of her husband and she has learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that her food sells out everyday and she makes good profit. Jenneh is requesting this loan to purchase more goods (coal, rice, onion, peppers, and oil) for her restaurant. In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (coal, rice, onion, peppers, and oil) for her business

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 32 years old and married to Jackylne and they have been blessed with two children. He sells second-hand clothes and  has been in business for six years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 5,000 which he intends to use to purchase additional stock for the business. He plans to open another shop with the anticipated profit from the business.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business beyond his locality by opening new branches.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business.

loans.name: Vergonia

texts.en: Vergonia is 67 years old, married, and has five adult children and  lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns rice farm and is doing well that makes her earn good income for the family. she had repaid successfully her previous loan used for labor cost of her farm. With her investment, she was able to generate more income than before and had support he grand children's education. She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her rice farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate their home for a safe living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
This 55-year-old man has been engaged in this business for 10 years.
This kind man is married, has 3 children. He lives with his family in Baku city Bulbula settlement.
You can see in the picture his flower garden. This flower garden is in the yard of his house.
There are red, white, yellow roses and other sort flowers in his flower garden.
These flowers are always given every support by Fizuli. He enjoys looking after flowers.
For the first time he borrowed a loan of $600 and bought flower seeds.
For the second time  he borrowed a loan of $800 and expand the area of flower garden and began to be busy with seed-bed.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to open a flower shop and a vegetable-shop for sale the flowers and vegetables.

loans.use: To open a flower-shop and vegetable-shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Asai wants to buy six steers to be grazed for at least six months and then be sold one by one

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has her own small beauty salon where she helps many women look their best. She had been interested in this business for a long time and seven years ago was able to begin working for herself. Victoria is a very polite and goal-oriented businesswoman. She enjoys helping her customers and assisting them with the care of their hair and nails.

Victoria is divorced and is raising her teenage son by herself. One of her goals is to develop her business so that she is able to have more time to spend with her son. The income she has been able to earn from her business has been invaluable in meeting the needs of her and her son.

Victoria has requested a loan to purchase necessary supplies and equipment for her day-to-day business operations and to give additional capital to promote her work and increase her business knowledge.

loans.use: Purchase necessary supplies

loans.name: Dib

texts.en: Mr. Dib D. is a 49 year old school director living in Kampong Cham Province.  He earns $5 per day from his job, and he also works with his wife on their farm in their free-time.  Together, they have six children.  This loan will be used to purchase a thresher machine to harvest rice.

loans.use: To purchase a thresher

loans.name: Mayil

texts.en: Mayil is 51 years old and lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has four children. Mayil has been in this business for 10 years. Now he requests a loan of $1200  to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy plot of land

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en: Mr. Vitalis N. is 35 years old.  He is married with 3 children, and he lives in Benin City.  He rides motorbikes for a business.  He started his own in 2003. He is a LAPO member. He needs $400 so he can buy a new bike. He promises to repay within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more additional bikes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria belongs to the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She lives at Asentamiento Humano La Lupuna in the Yarina Cocha district in Ucayali. She is 36-years-old and is the mother of two children, who are still minors. She is married, and her husband is a merchant. She tells us that his income isn't enough to cover their home's expenses. This is why Gloria, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles, decided to invest in buying and selling clothing.

Currently, she has her business selling clothing which she brings from Lima. She works by taking orders from her clients. After taking care of things in her home, she goes out to deliver and sell her clothing. With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a larger quantity of clothing, ten bedspreads, a dozen wallets, ten sheets, a dozen pieces of jewellery, etc. Gloria feels at peace because her business lets her support her home. She is attracting more clients, and her income is increasing, which benefits her family. This is all thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano La Lupuna del distrito Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Nos dice que el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Gloria, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la compra y venta de ropas.

En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio de compra y venta de ropas que trae desde Lima, para lo cual sólo trabaja con pedidos que le hacen sus clientas. Después de ver las cosas en su casa, sale a repartir y vender sus prendas. Con el préstamo de S/. 2.000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas y además diez colchas polares, una docena de carteras, diez sabanas, una docena de joyas, etc. Gloria se siente tranquila ya que el negocio que maneja le permite aportar en su hogar, está captando mayor clientela, sus ingresos están mejorando para el bienestar de su familia y todo gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (garments, bedspreads, wallets, jewellery, etc.)

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi E. is a single mother of 3 children, all students. She has been trading yams for the last 7 years. She is 35 years old. Being single, she can hardly provide for the schooling needs of her children. With this loan, she wishes to increase her business potential so as to increase her purchases and thus her sales. This way she will be able to make a profit allowing her to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Afi E. est célibataire avec 03 enfants tous élèves et exerce le commerce de vente des ignames depuis 7 ans. Elle est âgée de 35 ans . Etant seule, elle subvient difficilement aux besoins scolaires de ses enfants. Elle souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce par le présent emprunt afin d’augmenter ses achats et par là les ventes pour dégager des excédents lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of yams in surrounding villages and resale at the local market.

Achat des ignames dans les villages environnants et leur revente sur le marché local

loans.name: Zulfiya.

texts.ru:
Zulfiya U. lives in Vahdata. She is 58 years old, is married, has 5 children and a high school education. She works on the collective farm in Vahdat and raises livestock. Zulfiya will use her loan to purchase calves for her business. At this time of the year livestock prices are falling due to a shortage of feed and it is thus currently profitable to purchase them and resell them in 40 days for a profit. Zulfiya will pay back her loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Умарова Зульфия проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 58 лет.замужем ,имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее , работает колхозницей в колхозе г. Вахдат.Занимается животноводством. На планируемый кредит хочет купить бычков для дальнейшей реализации.Сейчас время когда цены на животных падают из-за нехватки корма, поэтому покупать бычков в данное время выгодно. А после откормки через 40 дней можно продавать по более выгодной цене.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Maura Cecilia

texts.es:
Ms. Maura belongs to the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank, located at Mercado No 2 Sección Joyería, in the Calleria district of the Ucayali region. She is 84 years old and mother of 15 children. Her husband is retired. With the first loan obtained from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, she invested in the purchase of fine bijouterie.

She is presently selling jewelry, working at her stand from very early in the morning, while in the afternoon she spends time with her family.

With the requested loan of S/.3000, to be repaid in five months, she will buy jewelry, earrings, rings, pendants, necklaces, bracelets, watches, etc.

Marla is a great example for women, as her age does not prevent her from working. Family is her motivation to go on.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maura pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Mercado No 2 Sección Joyería, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 84 años y es madre de 15 hijos. Su esposo es jubilado. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 invirtió en la compra de fantasías finas.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de joyas, abriendo su negocio muy temprano, mientras que por las tardes comparte su tiempo con su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará joyas, aretes, anillos, pendientes para mujeres, cadenas, esclavas, relojes, etc.

Maura es un gran ejemplo de mujer, su edad no es impedimento para seguir trabajando y su familia es su impulso para seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry products to stock her business.

loans.name: Abra Enyonam

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1957 in Agomé Tomégbé in the prefecture of Kloto, Mrs. Abra Enyonam M. is married and the mother of three children. She retails vegetables and charcoal in the Agbalépédo neighborhood in Lomé. She buys her vegetables from market gardeners and sells them to restaurants and neighborhood households.

This first loan of US$ 500 will permit her to purchase 15 bags of charcoal. With the income from her business, she helps out with her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 31 décembre 1957 à Agomé Tomégbé dans la préfecture de Kloto, madame M. Abra Enyonam est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de légumes et de charbon dans le quartier Agbalépédo à Lomé. Elle achète ses légumes auprès des jardiniers et les revend aux restaurants et aux ménages du quartier.

Le premier crédit d’un montant de 200.000 FCFA lui permettra de faire le stock par l’achat de quinze (15) sacs de charbon de bois. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle participe aussi aux dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 15 sacs de charbon

loans.name: Yuli

texts.id: Saat ini klien tinggal di Jl.Laksamana Denpasar bersama suami dan anaknya. Mereka mengontrak tanah dan membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Keadaan keluarganya sehat dan saat ini dia sedang mengandung anak kedua. Usaha yang sedang dijalani oleh Yuli A. saat ini adalah sebagai penjual kue. Ada berbagai macam kue yang dijualnya. Kegiatannya setiap hari adalah mulai jam 03.00 dinihari dia sudah harus bangun untuk membuat kue. Pada pagi harinya dia membawa kue yang sudah dibuatnya ke pasar terdekat. Tempatnya tidak begitu jauh dari rumahnya, cukup dengan berjalan kaki saja. Keuntungan yang didapat selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga, juga rencananya mau ditabung sebagi persiapan buat kelahiran anaknya. Yuli A. sangat mengharapkan diberi bantuan modal sehingga usahanya lebih berkembang.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is a hardworking mother of 4 small children. She works daily in crop production and livestock rearing in order to earn a living for her beloved family. She is very happy with the demand for her products, but is worried at the the same time. To meet all of her current demand, she urgently needs an investment of working capital. For this reason, she has come here looking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Teodora, es una trabajadora madre de cinco pequeños niños se dedica a diario tanto a la actividad agrícola como ganadera en beneficio de su amada familia. La demanda de sus productos la tienen muy contenta y también muy preocupada debido a que para complacerlas en su totalidad necesita de un incremento de capital de trabajo muy urgente y por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Injection of capital into her business in order to improve her agricultual production.

loans.name: Marja

texts.es:
Marja is 38 years of age and is the owner of a motorcycle that her brother drives for work. Marja also works in textile art, which provides supplemental income. Her partner Daniel works as a miner, and when he is able to he supports her in her work. Marja does everything for her two children and wants to give them all they will need to become professionals. At this time, she needs to improve the condition of her motorcycle and to purchase another engine, for which she needs a loan. Marja awaits your help.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.
