Marja tiene 38 años de edad, es propietaria de un motocarro que maneja su hermano, a quien de esta manera le brinda un trabajo, muy aparte Marja se dedica al arte textil, que es un apoyo económico extra. Su pareja, Daniel, se dedica a la extracción de minas y cuando puede le brinda apoyo en su trabajo. Marja hace todo esto por sus 2 hijos a quienes desea brindarles lo necesario hasta que sean profesionales. Ella en la actualidad necesita mejorar las condiciones de su motocarro, como también, comprar otro motor, sin embargo para ello necesita de un préstamo para lograr lo que realmente quiere. Ella espera de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Make repairs to her motorcycle

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng L., and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Auk, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000. They have no children but Saroeun Auk has four children from her first marriage.

Mr. Heng has been driving a motor taxi for two years. He is also a farmer in the local village. Mrs. Saroeun stays at home and does housework because she has a problem with one of her eyes. Heng is in the process of building his house (the house in the picture is not his house) and lacks the money for materials. Therefore, Heng is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase materials to build his house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials to build his new house.

loans.name: Malika.

texts.ru: Ахмедова Малика жительница города Шахритуз. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом уже 2 года. Торгует нижним бельем  и другими принадлежностями . Планирует получить кредит для того ,чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.Этьо поможет ей увеличить доход семьи
texts.en:
Malkia A. lives in the city of Shahrituz. She is married and has three children. For the last 2 years she has been managing a underwear and lingerie retail business. Malkia is planing to use this loan to expand her inventory and wants to pay it back in the next 12 months. This loan will help her get more income from the business and so provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Mané, 55 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bemet Wouly de depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des balais au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang pour les revendre à Kaolack. De Kaolack, elle achète de l’Omo qu’elle revend au village. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges et d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Awa Mané, 55 years old and married with four children, has been a member of the Bemet Wouly village bank for six years. She wants to buy brooms at the weekly market in Yarang to sell in Kaolack. In Kaolack, she would purchase Omo detergent to sell in the village. The income would permit her to assist with expenses and improve her family’s health and way of life. The loan she is requesting would be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and retail sale of brooms and Omo detergent

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Yot Phonis a 59-year-old widow with one child. Her child helps gather palm juice which is processed into palm sugar. They currently need more equipment to be able to gather more palm juice. The job requires Yot's child to climb trees in order to collect the palm sugar. They would like a loan to help deal with insufficient materials and to help improve their living conditions.

Yot is currently the village bank president in the Andoung Russey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. There are 17 bank members in the village bank loan.
This is a village bank loan consisting of end-of-term loans so all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a long bamboo to tie with the palm three for her child to climb up to gather palm juice.

loans.name: Naret

texts.en:
Mrs. Naret K., 24, and her husband, Mr. Phoun Sok, 22, who live along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and have one daughter. The couple lives with Naret’s mother.
 
Naret has been selling grocery items for four years. She buys grocery items from Koki market for resale at her village and she also raises pigs. Her husband has been a mason for three years. Naret is requesting a loan to purchase piglets to raise and some amount for buying grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Beteliana

texts.en:
"Be brave!" Beteliana L. from the Mahayahay Center speaks for herself in starting up their fish selling business. She is married and resides at Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She said that going into business involves a lot of hard work and is often coupled with risks that may result in failures, but she is thankful that their "negosyo" (business) is doing well. Sometimes, however, they get zero income, especially when bad weather strikes.
  
She has been involved in this business since her younger years. Financial assistance came from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very grateful for the financial help. It could not have been started without Paglaum MPC.

Recently, Beteliana applied for PHP 14,000 loan for additional working capital in fish selling. Apart from the capital, she will use a portion of the amount for their side car repair. Deliveries have been paralyzed already due to the problem with their side car.

Mrs. L. dreams most of owning a multi-cab for their volume deliveries. She remembers her family always as they are the reason in all her hardwork.

loans.use: Additional working capital for fish selling

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Khean S. is 27 years old, married, and has one child, who is too young to attend the school. She makes her living by selling Khmer foods to garment factory workers in her village and typically makes a meager profit. To provide for the family's expenses, her husband is a construction worker who usually makes about $5 per day.

Khean S. is requesting a loan for $700 in order to purchase construction tools for her husband. With this loan, she hopes her family will have more income and so increase the family's savings. It is important to say that her family would like to own another business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools to increase income

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena G. is currently in the business of selling hoes, pangas, cieasaw, and other items at the market. Jena is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. She has three children, who all go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand and diversify her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand and diversify her business.

loans.name: Majengo "a"street Group

texts.en:
Zaituni I. has owned a small food vendor store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for eight years. She works at her business every day. She belongs to the Majengo "A" street group loan. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She hopes to grow her business by increasing her profit through this loan.

Zaituni is 45 years old and married. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Pili M., who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 45 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children.

Mahmoud has owned a grocery store since 2007, and has sold scrap metal since 1990. He requests a loan of $1500 from Al Majmoua to purchase a pick up for his businesses. This is the first time Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special because he has two businesses and is doing his best to improve his family's financial situation. His clients are friends and neighbors for his store and traders of scrap metals. Mahmoud decided to open a grocery store because the scrap business didn’t allow him to have a good financial situation. When he first started the grocery business, he didn’t have a lot of clients. In the future, he plans on improving his business, as well as purchase land to start a third business.

loans.use: Purchase a pick up for his businesses.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Thuỷ Nguyen (1323030961) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thuỷ owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks to sell. Thuỷ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND (~US$200) a month from these activities.

In 2003, Thuỷ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Thuỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Thuỷ is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND (US$700). These funds will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё -женщина 24-х лет,замужем имеет 3-х детей.Сурайё вместе со своим мужем Дилшодом занимается продажей продуктов питания на продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района.Она привозит товар из города Худжанда,где рассположен оптовый рынок продуктов питания.Её товары пользуются хорошим спросом,но для расширения ассортимента ей нужны дополнительные денежные средства,поэтому она обратилась в нашу организацию.Cамым ходовым её товаром считаются сахар-песок,конфеты и печенья производства России.
texts.en:
Surayo is a 24 year old woman, married and has three children. Surayo and her husband Dilshodom together sell food products on the food market of the Spitamen region. She brings in the merchandise from the town of Khudjand where the wholesale food market is located. Her merchandise is in high demand, but to expand the assortment she needs additional finances and this is why she has come to our organization. Her most popular items are sugar, candy and cookies made in Russia.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Гуломов Муродали женат, имеет 3 детей. Возраст 37 лет. Проживает в районе Вахдат. Муродали занимается животноводством более 7 лет. Он откармливает бычков, потом продает их на скотовом рынке. Ему помогает его старший сын. Помимо этого Муродали занимается услугой такси. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычка для откармливания и продажи.
texts.en:
Murodali G. is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in the Vakhdat region of Tajikistan. Murodali has been raising cattle for the last seven years with the help of his oldest son. They fatten calves and then sell them at the meat market. Besides cattle raising Murodali also works as a taxi driver. He would like to take out this loan to purchase an additional calf for feeding and subsequent sale.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Akeutu Aswam Adong Pauline Group

texts.en:
Adong P. is 45 years old and married with six children, all schooling. She also looks after one dependent who is also schooling.

She has been dealing in local brew for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase produce such as beans, ground nuts (peanuts), millet, etc. to sell. She is active and encouraging, and her dream is to invest more and more in her business.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as beans, groundnuts, millet, sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma S. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 55 years old, married, and has one adult child. Thelma owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling peanuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.pt:
José Daniel E. tem 30 anos nasceu em homoine um distrito da província de inhambane, vive maritalmente e pai de duas filhas a primeira com 7anos e a segunda com 3anos de idade só a mais velha é que se encontra a estudar.
Jose mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Swazilândia a procura de emprego na companhia da sua tia que já vivia naquele distrito. apos sua chegada não consegue ingressar na escola devido a falta de documentos então começa a trabalhar num estabelecimento onde auferia um valor mensal de 500.00MT e não conseguia satisfazer as suas necessidades pois já havia se juntado com a sua esposa. Anos depois resolve iniciar o seu próprio negocio com o valor que havia colectado nos seus 3 anos de trabalho, começa a vender bolos e recargas de tele moveis na fronteira, trabalhando das 7h às 20h quando a fronteira fecha as portas. Hoje Daniel graças à hluvuku e kiva tem sua própria casa onde vive com a sua família tem como melhor produto recargas que compra por 15,00MT, 45.00MT, 74.00mt e 90.00mt e vende por 20.00mt, 50.00mt, 80.00mt e 100.00mt consecutivamente viajando quatro vezes por mês, tem um rendimento mensal de 5,000. 00mtn e consegue poupar 1.000.00mtn, ajuda os seu avo que se encontra em homoine enviando-lhe uma caixa de sabão, 50kg de arroz e 25kg de açúcar em cada 6 meses que corresponde a 1,500.00mtn.

Este e segundo empréstimo de Jose na hluvuku e kiva. Os primeiros 12.000.00MT aumentaram o volume de mercadoria para satisfazer as necessidades e exigências dos clientes, e pede estes 20.000.00MT para o mesmo fim como se encontra numa zona fronteiriça solicitam muito os seus serviços. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do prazo e pedir um novo empréstimo para ampliar a sua barraca e iniciar com a obra de ampliação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Jose Daniel E. is 30 years old, he was born in Homoine a district of the province of Inhambane, he lives with his wife and has 2 daughters, the first is 7 years old and the second is 3 years old, the oldest is already studying. Jose moved to Namaacha a village at the frontier with Swazilandia looking for a job and stayed with his aunt was already living there. He couldn't enter to school because he didn't have papers so he started working at a place where he makes 500.00MT a month and that wasn't enough because he was already living with his wife. Years later he decided to start his own business with money he saved for 3 years, he started selling cakes and recharge cards for cell phones at the frontier, working from 7am to 8pm when the frontier closes its doors. Thanks to Hluvuku and Kiva now Daniel has his own house where he lives with his family, his best product are recharge cards that are sold for 15,00MT, 45.00MT, 74.00MT and 90.00MT and sell for 20.00MT, 50.00MT, 80.00MT and 100.00MT traveling 4 times a month he gets an income of 5,000.00MT and is able to profit 1,000.00MT he helps his grandmother who is still in Homoine sending her a box of soap, 50kg of rice and 25kg of sugar every 6 months, which is about 1,500.00MT. This is the second loan Jose is requesting to Hluvuku and Kiva. The first 12,000.00MT increased the volum of the merchandise to satisfy his clients' necessities, and now he is requesting 20,000.00MT is for the same because at the frontier there is great demand for his services. He is sure he will pay the loan before the deadline and request a new loan to enlarge his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock in his business

loans.name: Eunice Anyango

texts.en:
Eunice sells cereals and other basic items at her kiosk in the town of Rongo, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She also helps care for her sister’s two children. Eunice has a dream to teach her children the value of hard work, and she is doing it by example.

Things haven’t been easy over the past year. Food prices have increased dramatically in Kenya. Eunice says that sometimes the stock you buy goes bad due to low-quality produce. Through it all, though, Eunice has a vision for her business to grow.

Eunice will use her loan to buy a bigger variety of products to attract different types of customers. She is extremely excited about the opportunity to help her business grow.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of goods

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
M. Sharofat is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Sharofat is doing all she can to ensure the best future for her children. That is the reason that she has been running her own business for 17 years already. She has a place in the central local market for selling foodstuffs such as rice, macaroni, oil, sugar, spices and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. The business is stable and that allows her to improve the level of her family's living conditions. Now Sharofat needs a loan for increasing the range of goods she sells. For this purpose, she requests 4,800 Somoni. Sharofat and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Due to our uncontrollable economic crisis, many are jobless and hopeless for their future. But, according to Marieta U., the ability to rise to the task is within us, with mercy from God. This principle in life has motivated Marieta to work harder towards the progress of her business and her family's living situation. She is only a high school graduate but she has the strong faith and determination to become successful through her patience in doing her business. She is married to Mario U. and they are blessed with two children. They do their best to finance the schooling of their children.
Maritea is venturing into a fish selling business, however, her capital is yet inadequate. This has meant that, so far, the business has not grown. This issue motivated her to request a loan of PHP7,000 from ASKI and Kiva lenders, as additional business capital. She will utilize this amount, if it is granted, to buy a larger volume of fish to sell in her village. She would be thankful for this financial assistance because it would help her very much to improve her fish vending business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mandira

texts.en:
Mandira A. is currently in the business of selling milk tea and bread at the resturant and is requesting a loan to purchase more milk for tea in her resturant. 

 Mandira is 24 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more milk for tea in her resturant

loans.name: Nadith

texts.es:
Nadith tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo, quien tiene un taller de soldadura, y con sus 2 hijos, quienes son su mayor inspiración para salir adelante. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de frutas afuera de su casa, pero no le fue muy bien, por falta de clientela. Debido a ello, hace un año se inició en la crianza de pollos y patos, actividad que le está resultando bastante rentable, pues cuenta con clientes selectos quienes están a  la espera de los pollos y patos que ella cría. Nadith debe dedicar gran parte del día al cuidado de sus animales hasta que obtengan un peso y tamaño adecuado para venderlos a un buen precio. Sus principales clientes son sus propios vecinos, pero en caso de no tener pedidos lleva a sus animales al mercado de su localidad, donde los vende muy rápido.
Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta trabajar con su grupo es que todas son personas responsables y puntuales en sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará para la compra de más pollos y patos, además de suficiente alimento para su crecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de animales y alimento para su crianza

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony K. is married and the happy father of a 3 year old boy. He started his engineering and fabrication business 2 years ago. Unfortunately, last year he lost his only compressor machine for constructing roads as a result of fire. The cause of the fire was as result of business rivalry. Thereafter, he decided to concentrate on welding and metal work. His clients consist mainly of construction companies and schools, among others; for them, he presses metals and does engineering work. He has employed three staff members on a casual basis.

He is requesting a loan of kshs. 20,000 in order to purchase brass. Brass is a metal that is heavily used especially during this time of booming business.

loans.use: purchasing brass, which aids in drilling

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S. est une femme de 60 ans, elle mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Avec son crédit elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle achète des moutons les engraisses et les revend. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge.
texts.en:
Amy S. is a 60-year old woman, she is married and she has 5 children in her care. With this loan she will invest in raising livestock. She purchases goats and fattens them for later resale. This business supplies her with an income that permit her to contribute towards their needs.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Acclamation Plus Group

texts.fr:
Remy A. est dirigeant de la banque communautaire dénommé « Acclamation Plus », composé de 32 micro entrepreneurs déterminés à développer solidairement leurs affaires à partir des microcrédits octroyés par les prêteurs du monde à travers Kiva et l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Remy A. 63 ans, est micro entrepreneur depuis 2006. Il est fournisseur d’emballages et des sachets d’eau pure dans son milieu périphérique la plus peuplée au Nord-est de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est mieux connu à cause de ses bons services.  Remy compte avec le prochain prêt, diversifier son affaire en vendant les outils de la menuiserie. Il est divorcé et père de 6 enfants dont leurs ages varient de 14 et 37 ans. Quatre d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Remy A. is a leader of the community bank known as "More Acclamation", composed of 32 micro-entrepreneurs determined to work together to build their businesses from the micro-loans granted by world lenders through Kiva and the IMF HOPE RDC. Remy A. is 63 years old and has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2006. He is a supplier of packages and sachets of pure water in his local area on the more populated Northeast side of the city of Kinshasa. He is well known because of his good service. Remy counts on the next loan to diversify his business with the sale of joinery tools. He is divorced and the father of 6 children, aged between 14 and 37 years. Four of them attend school.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 crates of packages and sachets for water

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina O. is a hardworking mother, 39 years old, from Jala-jala in the lovely province of Rizal. She has been in her sari-sari business for more than four years. She is the mother of an only child, Jonabelle, 6 years old and a nursery school student. She is married to Vergilio, 54 years old, a driver.

The income of her husband is not enough to meet the needs of their family. There came an opportunity to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in the year 2005. She was given hope and opportunity to have access to capital, so she started her sari-sari store (a small retail store for different goods). This simple business brings them good income. Currently on her fifth loan, she requests 15,000 Philippine pesos as additional capital to purchase more stock to meet the demands of her consumers.

Gina hopes that, with ASHI and Kiva lending a hand, she can fulfill her dreams in life: sending her only child to school until she finds a job and improving her business. She even plans to expand her sari-sari store into a grocery store (a big store supplying all the needs of her consumers). She also hopes for a comfortable house to live in and a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase different goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es una mujer muy alegre, tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja de toda la vida (Roberto), de 39 años, y con sus 3 inquietos hijos: Frank de 10, Jean Pierre de 7 y Derlys de 2 años. Desde hace varios años viven en su casa propia ubicada bajo el cielo azul de la sierra peruana.

Desde muy joven ella veía cómo sus padres trabajaban cultivando las tierras que les brindaban el sustento diario; es así que aprendió todas las técnicas y todo lo necesario sobre la agricultura, lo cual aplicó cuando empezó a trabajar para su propia familia al lado de su esposo.
A diario debe levantarse al amanecer y salir al campo para brindarle el cuidado necesario a sus cultivos de papa y zanahoria; así como también cuida de su ganado vacuno. A Faustina le gusta mucho el trabajo en el campo porque es lo que aprendió desde muy pequeña, además la venta de sus productos, especialmente la papa, le generan buenas ganancias.
Faustina afirma, muy orgullosa, que no dejará de trabajar hasta que sus hijos tengan una profesión, pues quiere que estudien solo así podrán salir adelante solos cuando ella les falte.
Para el futuro, quiere implementar una tienda de comestibles en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad, ya que sabe que este negocio genera buenas ganancias económicas.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que Faustina tiene con MFP y está segura que será responsable y puntual en cada pago, pues sabe que sólo las personas que cumplen con sus responsabilidades salen adelante. A su vez, está contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está integrado por mujeres muy luchadoras con ganas de salir adelante. Faustina ya tiene pensado el destino del dinero que solicita, y será invertido en la empezar el abastecimiento de su ansiada tienda de comestibles, lo que con mucho esfuerzo logrará realizar en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Faustina (34) is a very cheerful woman. She lives with her life partner, Roberto (39), and their 3 lively children: Frank (10), Jean Pierre (7) and Derlys (2). They have had their own house under the blue skies of the Peruvian mountains for some years now. From an early age, she watched her parents farming their land to put food on the table; that is how she learned the techniques and everything she needs to know in order to farm, and she has been applying that knowledge since she began working on her own farm alongside her husband. She gets up at dawn every day to go out to the fields, where she grows potatoes and carrots; she also keeps cattle. Faustina likes farming a lot; it's what she learned when she was a little girl, and she also makes a good profit from selling her produce, particularly potatoes. Faustina proudly says that she will work unceasingly until her children have a profession, since she wants them to study and be able to fend for themselves when she is no longer with them. Looking to the future, she wants to set up a grocery store in the center of the city, since she knows that is a profitable business. This is Faustina's seventh loan from MFP and she is certain to be responsible and punctual with the repayments since she knows that only people who fulfill their responsibilities get ahead in life. She is also happy working with the community bank as the members are hard-working women who want to succeed. Faustina plans to invest the loan in stock for the grocery store she plans to open in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business

loans.name: Lika

texts.en: Mrs. Lika L., who lives in Damnak village in Takeo province, is 43 years old. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for growing rice to support her family. Moreover, she is a pig breeder who owns a lot of piglets. As a breeder, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to support her piglets. Thus, Mrs. Lika L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and piglets. With the rest of the loan, she would buy a cow. Her husband, Mr. Dan Ket, is a construction laborer who can earn a little money to support the family. This couple has two children, one of whom is attending local public school and the other one is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy pig food and piglets

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
M. Mukhtor is 22 years old. He has great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for six years together with his father. He would like to expand his business by adding another cow to the ones he has. This is because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. Mukhtor is requesting $800 USD in order to buy another cow and feed for it. With additional income Mukhtor will be better able to contribute more to his family's finances.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Konr

texts.en:
Mr. Konr V., age 52, is a construction foreman who has many employees to help provide his service. Konr V. is married and has a school-aged child. His wife, who appears in the photo, prepares clothes for industry. 

Konr V. has been very busy at his business because there are many people who order him to construct their buildings. However, he is still lacking the material for construction. Because he doesn’t have money, he decided to ask a loan from Kiva through HKL tto buy more material so he can supply the good services he provides.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Ayde,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años Nuestra socia es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, Nuestra socia trabaja 8 años en una empresa taller de artesanía, ellos exportan y también venden  en su propio local los diferentes trabajos realizados por los empleados, Nuestra socia está encargada del pulido y el acabado final de la arcilla, la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar madera, porque su pareja abrió una carpintería en su propia casa gracias al apoyo que nuestra socia le brindo, juntos salieron adelante y pudieron comprar su terreno y todas sus cosas con préstamos de este banco comunal y con esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Ayde is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Ayde is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a ten year old son. She is an enterprising woman who divides her time between her housework and making handicrafts. For the past eight years, she has managed a craft shop. Ayde exports her products and also sells them in her store. The different tasks are performed by her employees. Ayde is in charge of polishing and adding finishing touches to the pottery. She is requesting a loan to buy wood because her partner just started a carpentry business out of their home. Thanks to the support she will be bringing, Ayde and her partner will be able to get ahead, acquire a piece of land, and purchase all the things they need with the loans from her Communal Bank and through their hard work.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for her partner's carpentry business

loans.name: Julia Saturdina

texts.es:
La señora Julia Saturdina J. Z. es soltera no tiene hijos vive en el barrio Pedro Joaquín  junto a su familia,  tiene tres años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha tenido veintiocho créditos el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, 
Los créditos anteriores han sido importantes ya ha evolucionado con su negocio antes solamente vendía refrescos hoy vende frutas gaseosas popsicles entre otros, también ha mejorado su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Julia is single and has no children. She lives in the Pedro Joaquín neighborhood with her family and has been working with CEPRODEL for the past three years. She has had 28 previous loans, with which she has proven to be responsible. The previous loans have been important because they have allowed her to evolve her business. In the past she only sold a few drinks, now she sells fruit, soft drinks, and popsicles, among other things. She has also been able to improve her home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Good Hope Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
S. Vincent, shown in the photo with his hand raised, is the leader of his lending group. He is a hardworking 24-year-old married man with three kids.

Vincent is into the transportation business with a boda-boda (a motorcycle fitted with a tailor-made seat over the rear wheel) as his only viable means of providing for his children’s welfare. He has a pedigree of five years in this business.

Vincent wants a loan to be able to fund his new blueprint project of rearing pigs. With this loan he also hopes to add to his savings buy a new motorcycle to diversify the boda-boda business that he runs in Lugazi town.

Since he began, Vincent has been making 100,000 shillings weekly. That is a much bigger amount than the peanuts he was making when he was still a fishmonger.

loans.use: To renovate his pigsty for better output and to top up on his savings to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Trust Yourself Group

texts.en:
Kollie K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called 'Trust Yourself'. He is 24 years old, single with a 5-month-old child. He is presently a 12th grade student who is fending for himself through business.

For 3 years Kollie has been running a provisions shop and a video club at the Rihab Road in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells goods that customers always want to buy in order to encourage them to continue patronizing his business.

Kollie started selling with a small working capital and now has a bigger shop where he does his business. He plans to use his 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods for his shop. His goal is to grow and expand his businesses and to improve the living conditions of his family.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kollie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his shop.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene, a 37-year-old farmer, plows a rice field and raises pigs to earn a living. He works hard on his farm to support his two children. His eldest child is 13 years old. He wants them to finish their studies and he is sending them to school. He wants to improve his farm to have greater earnings.

Gene heard that Community Economic Ventures, Inc. offers financial assistance to entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to support his business on the farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rosa Anastacia

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, la mayor parte habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, esta separada de su esposo con el tiene dos hijos de 35 y 20 años. La tienda la tiene hace 8 años atrás cuando su esposo empezo a comprar viveres para que Rosa venda a sus vecinos, esto les ayudo como un ingreso adicional en su familia, despues de un tiempo ella invirtió sus ahorros en arroz, cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para hacer mas grande la tienda. 

Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital y comprando mas productos, trabaja con su hija desde las 07h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, ha comenzado a vender papelería en su tienda. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, enlatados, bebidas para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener otra tienda en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (part of El Suburbio mostly inhabited by retailers), Guayaquil. She is separated from her husband with whom she has two children who are 35 and 20 years of age. She has had her store for 8 years since her husband started to buy foodstuffs for Rosa to sell to her neighbors. This provided additional family income and after some time she invested her own savings to buy rice, notebooks, beverages and display cases to enlarge the store. Gradually her capital grew and she bought more and more products. She works with her daughter from 7:30am until 9pm every day. She has started to include stationery items in her store’s stock. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, canned goods and beverages for the store. In the future, she’d like to have another store in a different location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks, beverages, canned goods.

loans.name: Silvia Argentina

texts.es: Silvia Argentina tiene 57 años  hace  mas de 16 años que tiene esta pulpería, inicio por la necesidad generar ingresos para su familia, por lo que ha sabido manejar muy bien esta actividad pues fue por medio de ella que logro sacar adelante a sus 8 hijos, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias y proporcionarles a sus hijos lo que más necesitaban en este negocio aprendió muchas cosas, con sus clientes pues algunas veces solicitaban nuevos productos y ella tiene que comprar diversidad en productos. El crédito será invertido en materia prima granos básicos, dulces, detergentes, gaseosas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Sueña con tener otro negocio que sea herencia para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia Argentina is 57 years old and has run this store for more than16 years. She started the store out of the need to generate income for her family. She has learned very well how to run the business, the result being that she has been able to help her 8 children move ahead. With much effort she has been able to increase her earnings and provide for her children that which they needed most. In this business she learned many things. Her clients, for example, at times request new products and she has to buy a variety of inventory. The loan will be invested in supplies like basic grains, sweets, detergents, soft drinks, and cosmetics among other items. She hopes to have another business that will be an inheritance for her children,

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha Paola

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Paola E. L., tiene 38 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo e hijo. Trabaja como obrera de campo en la empresa Ica Pacific desde hace 4 años. Su esposo tambien trabaja en la misma empresa desde hace 6 años. Quiere terminar la construcción de su vivienda, la cual ha venido construyendo poco a poco con sus ingresos. La Sra. Martha es una  persona muy trabajadora que le ha brindado una buena  educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra Martha Paola E. L., agradece la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad su sueño a tráves de esye financiamiento.
texts.en:
Martha Paola E. L. is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has been working as a field laborer for the Ica Pacific business for the past 4 years. Her husband has also been working for the same business for the past 6 years. She wants to finish building her house, which she has been building bit by bit with her income. Martha is a very hardworking person who has provided a good education to her children through much hard work and she aspires to a better quality of life. Her dream is to finish building her house. Martha Paola E. L. is grateful for the support we are providing her so she can achieve her dream through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her housing

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa C. quiere poner un salón de belleza al frente de su casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión de su negocio.
Esta solicitando su cooperación para este crédito ya que es madre soltera y tienes dos hijos pequeños, a quines les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Desea acondicionar un cuarto de su casa  y así tener más clientas ya que actual mente las atiende en la sala de la casa. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elisa C. wants to open a beauty salon in the front part of her house, but she doesn't have enough momey to invest in her business. She is asking for your cooperation for this loan, since she is a single mother and has two small children to whom she wants to give the best. She wants to outfit a room in her house and thus have more customers, since at present she attends to them in the livingroom of her house. She plans on paying for the loan with a portion of her income that she gets from her business, since it is the source of the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Mother Blessing Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Mother Blessing. He is 25 years old, single, has two children, 7 and 9 years old, and cares for one sibling. Emmanuel is a college student.

For 5 years, he has been selling charcoal on Newport Street, Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. He describes himself as a determined man. His dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina V. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Saturnina is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Saturnina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables to the local community. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Saturnina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Saturnina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en: Mardia L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Jesus Is Lord. She is 45 years old, widowed, and has five children between five and 25 years old. She is a sophomore college student. For 5 years, she has sold home-made bread on S.K.D Boulevard outside Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 60,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, and eggs for her bread making. She describes herself as a faithful woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and eggs to make bread

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a resident of a small city called Riwind in Pakistan. Riwind city is famous for its dairy industry. She owns a 3-room brick house in the area of Haveli Ghatia Wali of Riwind and lives in it with her husband and a son. She is 50 years old and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife and takes care of her family. 

Her son’s name is Usman and he has completed his education through 10th standard. Then he started working with his father in a photo studio in a nearby market.  Her husband’s name is R. A.. Both her husband and son spend their time in a photo studio where they provide services to their customers by taking their photographs and framing them. They also sell used mobile phones from their photo studio. They have a good clientele base which enables them to cover the financial expenses of their family.  

Ayesha has applied for a loan from Asasah for her family business. With the loan amount they will buy digital cameras and used mobile phone sets to offer better quality services to their clients. She hopes that her husband and son will be able to improve their business with the help of this investment. 

Ayesha is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 4th loan cycle. In the previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy digital cameras and used mobile phones

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es: Guzmán, de 62 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en el poblado de Triboline, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. A pesar de tener estudios incompletos, eso no lo impidió a que siguiera su sueño, por el cual se había propuesto desde su adolescencia, que era tener su propio negocio agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercialización de cacao. Desde luego que no lo fue tan fácil, ya que en varias oportunidades tuvo éxitos y fracasos, pero el más frustrante fue cuando se enfermó, impeliéndole a seguir trabajando, sin embargo sacó fuerzas para recuperarse. Hoy, vende su producto agrícola a sus clientes potenciales, además ofrece su producto a los clientes nuevos, con la necesidad de que capte mayor clientela, a pesar de ello, su economía se mejora paulatinamente. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita la ayuda de su familia, con el propósito de que extraigan su producción. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su producto de cacao, con la finalidad de que pueda satisfacer a sus clientes más exigentes. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando, tal como lo hizo en sus anteriores préstamos, además augura en que seguirá en banco comunal, ya que lo trae ventajas positivas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono con la necesidad de preservar la calidad de sus plantaciones de cacao, así como sacar la mala hierba de su terreno de cultivo.
texts.en: Guzmán is 62 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives in the village of Triboline, located in the tropical jungle of Peru, where he has his own wooden house.  Even though he did not finish school, this has not stopped him from following his life-long dream of having his own agricultural business, specializing in the production and sale of cocoa.  It has been difficult for him, and he has often had success and failure, but the most frustrating thing was when he got sick and was unable to work.  He was able to recover and today sells his produce to customers and also offers it to new clients, as he needs to increase his clientele.  His business has gradually been improving.  He usually works by himself, but during harvest time he needs his family to help.  His plans for the future are to increase his production of cocoa in order to satisfy his most demanding customers.  This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he is committed to make the payments, just as he has with his previous loans.  He will remain with his community bank, because it brings him benefits.  He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer to maintain the quality of his cocoa fields and to kill the weeds on his land.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is from the city of Preza Tangub City. She is 30 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as canned goods, milk, coffee, candies,spices, vinegar, oil, and snacks in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Faridah has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap and sugar. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Faridah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Faridah hopes to study and become a pilot.

Faridah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by always having educational discussions among themselves.

loans.use: To buy soap and sugar.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa;   la socia tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de semillas fertilizantes, alquiler de terrenos, compra de ganados y agricultura, la socia apoya a su conyugue en tod lo referente a la agricultura y ganadería; pero la socia también está dedicada en estos últimos meses a la artesanía ella teje mantas y las lleva a vender al pueblo, la socia cuando no está apoyando a su conyugue teje como parte de distraerse y hace frazadas también.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas y alquiler de terreno para su nueva siembra.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is part of the PACHA ILLAIRY village bank, located in the Ocongate district of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Jesusa: she 42 years old and has three children. She buys and sells fertilized seeds, rents land, buys cattle and agriculture, and supports her spouse with his agriculture and livestock. In the past couple of months she has also worked as an artisan, sewing blankets that she sells in the village. When she is not supporting her husband she sews as a way to distract herself. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of seeds and to rent the land for her new crop. 

This member appreciates and values this loan and promises to fulfill the repayment of her loan in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and rent land for her crop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma D. is a widow who lives in Purok 2, Barangay 9, Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating four business ventures. She sells gasoline, firewood, dried fish, and she also operates a fishing business. She has no children. Emma joined the Kiva Field Partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1998 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $418, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 23rd cycle loan, she is borrowing 22,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future improvements in her businesses. Emma D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, onion, tomato etc

loans.name: Kodzo Adodo

texts.fr: Adodo est âgé de  65 ans et  a 4 enfants en charge. IL fait la vente des articles scolaires pour s’occuper de sa petite famille. IL a débuté ses activités en 1978 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. IL revend ensuite ses articles dans la Librairie la Lumière en face de l’hotel John Palace dans le quartier Akodessewa sur la route de Zorro bar.  Il demande un prêt pour acquerir de nouveaux articles scolaires et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Adodo is 65 years old and has 4 children to support. He sells school supplies to take care of his small family.  He started his business in 1978 and stocks up at the main market in Lomé.  He then resells the items at the Librairie la Lumiere (Light Bookstore) in front of the John Palace hotel in the Akodessewa neighborhood on the Zorro Bar road. He is asking for a loan to acquire new school supplies and satisfy more clients.

loans.use: Purchase of School Supplies

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flora; ella tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de plantas para luego distribuirlo de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia se dedica al préstamo de dinero ganando ella un porcentaje del monto que presta, la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y de esta forma ella sale adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercadería ( plantas) para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Flora is 30 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling plants.  She delivers her plants to her customers who request them.  Flora also lends money.  She makes a percentage on the sums that she lends.  She is a very happy and optimistic person and, in this way, she gets ahead in life.

Flora is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise (plants) for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (plants) for her business

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old and lives with one brother. In 2008, Salah decided to open his own barber shop after having gained good experience in this field. He is well known in his area and has a good reputation. He is requesting an $1800 loan to renovate his shop and buy a small generator. He aims to improve his business and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and buy a small generator

loans.name: Manuela Adelaida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y 8 años todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, tarjetas telefónicas de Porta y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos lo que es Yanbal lo recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa y tarjetas telefónicas en el centro en una distribuidora. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, tarjetas y ropa de catalogo. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir en sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The village bank Estrella de Belén meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with local and foreign tourists year-round.  Most of the people there make their living from fishing or other work related to the ocean.

There we met Manuela, who is 43 years old, married and has three children - 29, 17 and 8 years old.  They are studying in the university, high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own money, sells catalog clothing, Porta phone cards and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day since she sells from home, where she has a small store.  She sells her products on credit and charges every week or every 15 days, depending on what her customers want. She receives the Yanbal products at home and the clothing and phone cards downtown from a distributor.  She has been doing this for 4 years. 

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, phone cards and catalog clothing.  This is her fourth cycle with the village bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dreams are to continue with her business and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, telephone cards and clothes.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 40-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have three children, aged 20, 15 and 10 years old. Two additional dependents live with their family because they are relatives of her husband. In 2002, Fatmata established a food sales business because she sought independence in her work life. By working 7 days per week and 10 hours per day, she earns approximately 950,000 SLL every month from her business.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL ($925), which would be used to buy additional food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 203,200 SLL. With the additional income she expects to generate as a result of this loan, Fatmata intends to educate her children up to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Triunfo lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Josefa Dolores Lopez Muños  de 33 años quien se dedica a la realización y venta de nacatamales y pan. Ella al inicio no sabía cómo realizar los nacatamales pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo.
L. con el crédito comprara materiales ya que con lo que realiza no ha justa para la demanda que tiene.
Los otros integrantes de grupo son Olga María G. quien desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de leña y carne rubro en el que está iniciando y Isabel G. se dedica al comercio de leña y Tortilla.
texts.en:
The group "El Triunfo" [The Triumph] is made up of three hardworking women.  One of them is Josefa Dolores Lopez Muños, 33 years old, who sells nacatamales and bread.   When she began, she didn't know how to make nacatamales, but she learned as she went.  

Ms. Lopez will use the loan to buy ingredients, since what she has doesn't meet the demand.  

The other members of the group are Olga Maria G., who for 20 years has sold firewood and meat.  In the same line of work, Isabel G. is beginning to sell firewood and tortillas.

loans.use: Pork, corn

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her biggest monthly expense is school tuition fees.

She operates a food market selling coconuts and vegetables by retailing to her neighbours and passersby. Eunice has been operating this business for the past two years, which has helped her meet her family needs with her income. She dreams of expanding and becoming self reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Tagavuma

texts.en:
Tagavuma is married with three children, two boys and one girl, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. They live at a house that they own, that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the cost of purchasing thread and needles for her business.

For over fifteen years, she has operated a tailoring business; she operates from home whereby her potential customers are her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a palm leaves selling business, also selling coconuts and paraffin, which contributes to her living. Tagavuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her area of operation. She purchase her products from the town center and transports them to the village for resale.

With the Kshs 80,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase cloth, material, paraffin and coconuts for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, material, paraffin and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria V. Hernández, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, ella es casada y  ya no tiene hijos a su responsabilidad.
Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y en algunas comunidades cercanas de donde ella vive, en esta actividad lleva un año y según nos comenta que le va bien.
Comenzó con ésta actividad para  poder  incrementar  sus ingresos ya que también quiere apoyar a  su esposo trabajando y  así  juntos poder solventar sus gastos que se generan en su hogar.
Su más grande deseo es seguir trabajando hasta que dios le siga prestando vida para así  continuar con el préstamo que fundación le está otorgando.
    Las personas que integran en el grupo son: Brígida Pérez E., compra y vende pollos  de rancho, Candelaria V. Hernández, en la  compra y venta de maíz, Inés Romana López García, se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para luego venderlo y Soraida Pérez Pérez, invierte en la compra de productos naturales para venderlo en la misma localidad.
texts.en:
Candelaria V. Hernández lives in Coapilla in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married and no longer needs to care for her children.

She is asking for this loan to buy dried corn to resell in the same location and in a few other nearby communities.  She’s been doing this for a year and tells us that it has gone well for her.

She started doing this so that she could increase her income because she wants to help her husband pay the household expenses.  Her greatest desire is to continue working as long as she can, in order to continue repaying this loan.

The people who make up the group are Brígida Pérez E., who buys and sells chickens; Candelaria V. Hernández, who buys and sells dried corn; Inés Romana López García, who makes tamales; and Soraida Pérez Pérez, who buys and sells organic products.

loans.use: to buy died corn for resale

loans.name: C4823 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Olive is 27 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years old. She is the presidente of a group called “Abizeranye” and she sells clothes. This is her one successful year in this business, which she runs from 8 am until 5 pm every day.

Olive and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing the quantity of clothes. With this expansion, she really hopes that the earned profits will increase. With these profits, she will be able to satisfy the basic needs of her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a single man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and clothing.                    

For the past 3 years, he has been operating a vending business, selling sweets, biscuits and groundnuts from door to door. His potential customers are passersby and neighboring community members.   Edward faces a major challenge of competition from other vendors in the village.  He dreams of expanding his business and purchasing a tuk tuk for the business. 

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Edward wants to purchase packets of sweets and biscuits to resell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy sweets and biscuits to resell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok, a single mother of one child who works as a taxi driver, lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband. To earn a living, she sells fresh fish to people in the market. Mrs. Sok will be using her loan to buy more fish for resale, and will use the profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo las hijas de Dios lo conforman las señora María Elena, Guisssel y Veronica tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya, ciudad de las flores. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Elena quien desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de gaseosa. Ella tiene la meta junto a su esposo de tener una pulpería.
Ella con el crédito comprar más gaseosa para su negocio. 
La señora Guissel vende chiverías, gaseosa y chicha, y Verónica tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de golosinas y poco a poco fue creciendo.
texts.en:
The group, Las Hijas de Dios (The Daughters of God), is comprised of María Elena, Guisssel, and Veronica, three hard-working and entrepreneurial women originally from Massaya, the city of flowers. The group's coordinator is María Elena, who has been selling soft drinks for five years. She and her husband have a goal to own a general store.

With the loan, she will buy more soft drinks for her business.

Guissel sells dairy products, soft drinks, and corn malt. Veronica has a general store that she started by selling snacks, and little by little it grew.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married and is 54 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of groceries. She has had this business for 5 years.

Rufina is requesting a loan of PHP 6000 to buy additional biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks and coffee to sell to her customers. Each month, Rufina earns about PHP3000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Rufina hopes that she can maintain her retail shop business so that she can provide for her family and improve her store. Rufina would be thankful if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy additional biscuits, canned goods, softdrinks and coffee to sell

loans.name: Manon

texts.en:
Manon is a 45-year-old farmer who lives with his family, consisting of four children and his wife. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Manon has 20 years of experience raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Manon’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for $2,000 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Manon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and fodder

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
