Two of their children are newly married and starting families, while other two are still in school. Mrs. Hoeurn Sopha's husband (who we see here) who works in construction. Because raising and selling livestock is this family's main source of income, Mrs. Hoeurn S. is applying for a loan for $100 to buy an additional cow to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy an extra cow to raise and resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to complete his stock

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nidia P. tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, todos estudiantes de la secundaria.
La Sra. Nidia junto con su conyuge se dedica a la compra venta de pescados de todas sus variedades. Esta actividad lo realiza hace más de 20 años, se inicio comercializando primeramente con la pesca directa del río, como lo hicieron sus padres, luego comercializo con mayor cantidad vendiendo en un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal.
Actualmente comercializa en el mercado y posee un comedor donde realiza diferentes tipos de alimentos a base de pescado..
Solicita el crédito para la compra de diversas variedad de pescados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nidia P., 40, is married and has three children, all in secondary school.  Nidia and her spouse have been fish merchants for over 20 years; they sell all kinds of fish.  She started out primarily selling fish directly from the river the same as her parents had done.  Later she began to sell a greater variety in a stall in the municipal market.  She now sells in the market and also has an eatery where she prepares different fish-based dishes.

She is asking for funds to buy a variety of kinds of fish.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Esperanza dedicada a la venta de comida, desde muy temprano ella se levanta para cocinar sus deliciosos platos que son vendidos a medio día, ya conocida en el lugar ella tiene un propósito que es la de ampliar su negocio y así llegar a todos los clientes de Cochabamba y ser reconocida en el ámbito de la comida, cocina muy bien y tiene mucha clientela, es muy amable con sus clientes y muy carismática, desde muy niña trabajo ayudando a su mama,  este crédito ayudara a la señora a comprar un refrigerador y así poder mantener sus verduras frescas para la elaboración de su platillos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Esperanza sells food for a living. She gets up very early to cook her delicious dishes and sells them at midday. She is known in the area. Her goal is to expand her business and reach all the customers in Cochabamba and become more well-known in the field of food. She cooks very well, has a lot of customers, and is very friendly with them as well as very charismatic.  Since she was a child she worked helping her mother. This loan would help Esperanza to buy a refrigerator and keep the vegetables she uses in her dishes fresh. She is very grateful to Emprender for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima H. lives with her husband and son’s family with one child.  The whole family is engaged in cattle farming, and this is the only activity that brings some income to them, following days and nights of hard work. Rima has applied for the loan to buy cattle feed for this winter.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed for this winter.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon K. is 55 years old.  She owns a small shop by the street where she sells soft drinks, food and other goods. She typically makes around US$ 3 in profit each day to support her family. She had been married but she divorced her husband years ago. She has five children, all are married and most are employed in different jobs. They often help Chuon K. by sharing their earnings to help her with daily expenses. 

At the present, Chuon K. is concerned that her kitchen is too small and old. She wants to rebuild it but lacks the money to do so. To address this situation, Chuon K. is seeking a loan from Kiva to rebuild her kitchen.

loans.use: To rebuild the kitchen

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: La Sra. Daysi es una de nuestras socias antiguas que pertenece al Banco de Emprendimiento "Renacer", quien actualmente ocupa el cargo de tesorera dentro su grupo. Ella tiene 3 hijos pequeños. La Sra. solicito un crédito individual para poder montar una grúa ya que les facilitaría el transporte de las movilidades y  así poder aumentar sus ingresos, tiene como negocio una Chapería junto a su esposo, trabajan juntos, son una pareja muy unida que están consolidándose con esta actividad donde les va muy bien, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Mrs. Daysi is one of our old clients who belongs to the Renacer ["Rebirth"] Lending Bank, where she currently holds the post of treasurer. She has three small children. She is requesting an individual loan for a tow truck, as it will facilitate the transportation of the vehicles and thus increase her income. She and her husband have an auto body repair store. They work together; they are a very united pair who are working together in this business and it is going very well for them. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered in the authorization of this loan.

loans.use: the purchase of a tow truck

loans.name: Rutuba

texts.en:
Rutuba is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food selling stall for the last two years, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. Her husband also contributes to the family's basic needs. Rutuba faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and meet her customers' needs and satisfaction in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng S. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she is also a crop farmer in the province of Kompong Tom. 

Kheng and her husband are blessed with two children who are learning in school. Her husband and life partner is a security guard, and has a fixed monthly salary and shares responsibility with Kheng S. to support the family’s needs. 

Kheng S. lacks farming supply to support her labor on the farm, so she would like a loan from Kiva to buy a cultivating machine which she will use to plow her farmland. In addition, she will rent the new machine to other farmers for fees.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata, es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, es casada, 55 años, 5 hijos. Honorata tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general que atienD. en su casa.  El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, harina, leche, huevo, etc,  para surtir su tienda.
Ingresó a Finca Perú, por la invitación D. su hija, le gusta porque en las capacitaciones que recibe le hablan mucho D. la familia, matrimonio, salud y del negocio. Con sus ahorros incrementó mas sus mercaderías en su tienda, ahora esta ahorrando para que sus hijas puedan obtener su titulo profesional D. contabilidad y odontología.
texts.en:
Honorata, 55, is a member of the Lirio (Iris) communal bank.  She’s married and has five children.  Honorata has a grocery store at home.  She is asking for the loan to invest in merchandise like: rice, sugar, noodles, oil, flour, milk, eggs, etc. to stock her store.

She joined Finca Perú invited by her daughter.  She likes it because in the training sessions they talk a lot about the family, marriage, health and business.

Her savings maD. it possible for her to increase merchandise in her store.  Now she’s saving up so that her daughters can get their professional degrees in Accounting and Dentistry.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Kargbo Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “K.” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Memuna K.. Memuna was born in the village of Sengo, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a businessman, two of her children are attending primary school, and two are in secondary school. For twelve years now, Memuna has been selling firewood and charcoal. With this loan, she will buy firewood and charcoal in larger quantities to resell. 


(Pictured in the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers)

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal in larger quantities to sell

loans.name: Rafael Arcangel

texts.es: Rafael Arcángel se dedica a brindar los servicios de carpintería. Es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de su negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le realizan diferentes encargos, por lo que Rafael siempre deposita mucho esfuerzo en lo que realiza, tiene más 6 años en esta actividad, su padre le enseño a sobrevivir con este negocio, no es un trabajo fácil, pero esto es lo que más le gusta a Rafael.  El financiamiento es para la compra de pega, clavos, maque, madera, junco, tintes, herramientas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Rafel Arcangel provides carpentry services. He is a very hard worker and enjoys his work. Most of his customers return because Rafael puts a lot of effort into what he makes. He has six years of experience and his father taught him this trade. It is not easy work but it is what Rafael enjoys doing.

The loan is to buy glue, nails, lumber, reeds, dyestuff, tools and such things.

loans.use: to buy glue, nails, lumber, reeds, dyestuff, tools...

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela, de 24 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive sola en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de secretaria que realiza Gabriela, le ha ayudado mucho a mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que los largos días de trabajo que en la empresa de transportes donde labora, le generan los ingresos económicos que necesita, para cubrir sus gastos. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que le ha sido muy rentable en estos últimos meses. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar su labor, ya que sus jefes confían en las decisiones que toma, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su oficina. Con el tiempo, desea seguir trabajando muy duro, ya que siente que todavía es muy joven y tiene mucho camino por recorrer. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza para así tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 24 year old, happy hard working girl.  She lives in her own home and her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life.  She works as a secretary, which has been a large help in improving her quality of life.  She works long hours for a transportation company which helps cover her economic needs and expenses.  

She has a second job selling beauty products, which has been very profitable in recent months.  She especially enjoys the freedom to work how she wishes, because her supervisors trust the decisions she makes.  She has been doing this for two years and considers the most difficult aspect to be the obligation to stay in her office all day.  Looking forward, she wishes to continue working very hard, given that she feels that she is still young and will have many opportunities yet to come. 

This will be her third loan from MFP.  She is very committed to making her payments on time, as she will want to request other loans in the future.   She is very participative in her communal bank and is close with the other members.  

She plans to use the loan to buy more beauty product so that she can offer more products to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es una mujer muy responsable todas la mañanas de Lunes a Sábado y algunas veces Domingos sale a su lugar de trabajo que es una ferretería para comenzar su labores diarias, lo que ella hace es andar por las calles a pesar de las inclemencias del tiempo visitar clientes para cobrar. Su trabajo es cansado más que todo por que su única fuente de transporte es su bicicleta para moverse de un lado a otro. 
A  Yolanda le encanta realizar esta actividad ya que de esta manera lleva ingresos para sostener a su hijo, pero ese no es su problema sino el que tienen es que a su casa, el techo de madera se le esta deteriorando por lo que necesita capital para poderlo arreglar y así ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Yolanda is a very responsible woman.  Every morning, Monday to Saturday and sometimes Sunday, she goes to her work place, which is a hardware store, to do her daily work.  She goes door to door, in spite of at times inclement weather, seeing customers to collect on their accounts.  Her work is very tiring especially since her only transportation is a bicycle.  Yolanda loves doing this work because in this way she can make money to support her son.  Work is not her problem, however what is disturbing her is that the wood roof on her house is deteriorating and she needs money to fix it,  this way providing her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Américo, reside en San Miguel  vive  junto a su esposa y se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días de 4:00am a 3:00pm, el aprendió de sus padres y hasta el momento no tiene problemas en el negocio.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollo, carnes, arroz, aceite, vegetales y condimentos, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener todos los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar los menús necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes, y atenderles de la mejora manera.
Su aspiración es mantenerse en el negocio, fortalecerlo y atraer nuevos clientes, así mismo ayudar a su esposa y juntos trabajar por mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Américo lives with his wife in San Miguel.  He has been selling food for five years.  He works every day from 4:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.   He learned this business from his parents, and so far he has not had any problems.

He is requesting a loan to buy chicken, meat, rice, oil, vegetables, and condiments.  This loan will help him to keep on hand all of the ingredients he needs to make the catered meals for his customers.  It will also help him tend to his customers better.

His goal is to stay in the business and to strengthen it.  His goal is also to help his wife so that they can work together to improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, oil, vegetables, and condiments.

loans.name: Salustiana

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Salustiana tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, con dos hijos: uno ya mayor de edad  y otro en edad escolar. 
Salustiana es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos a cuotas en la localidad de Capiata, a donde viaja cada mes a colocar y cobrar sus productos, pues vive en Carapegua. 
Gracias  a su sacrificio y esfuerzo pudo brindarle a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerles estudiar, para que en el futuro puedan ser independientes y sepan progresar con una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y telas de color para tejer hamacas, pues en ésta temporada es un trabajo muy solicitado por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Salustiana is 49 years old.  She is a single mother with two children: one grown up and one school age.

Salustiana is very entrepreneurial.  She weaves blankets and tablecloths and sells them herself on credit in the town of Capiata where she travels every month to drop off and collect payment for her products (she lives in Carapegua).

Thanks to her sacrifice and efforts, she has been able to provide her children with all the comforts of life and also an education so that they can live independently in the future and know how to make progress with a better quality of life.

Salustiana is requesting this loan to buy threads and colored fabric for weaving hammocks since this is something which is very much requested by her customers during this season.

loans.use: to buy supplies, thread and colored fabric for her weaving business

loans.name: Mshindani

texts.en:
Mshindani is a married woman with five children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation. 

For the past 3 years, Mshindani has been operating a clothes business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Mshindani faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door to sell clothes. She dreams of becoming self-reliant and providing for her family in the future.

With this loan of 50,000 Kshs, Mshindani wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cafetín, ella prepara desayunos, sándwich y bebidas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negoció la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de cafetín. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carnes, pollo, panes y verduras.
                                                         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Yahuar Maqui” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and operating a café. She prepares breakfasts, sandwiches, and beverages. The member works from 6am to 3pm. Through her business, she is able to succeed on behalf of her children. She wants to expand her café business, so she is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking such as meat, chicken, bread, and vegetables.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, bread, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is 45 years old and is a married man with 3 children.  His oldest child is 20 years old. 

Anecito is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. He has been growing rice for 7 years. He earns 3600 PHP per month from this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fuel for his tractor, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, he hopes to have his children finish their studies.

loans.use: buy fuel and farm inputs

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with three school-going children. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past eight years, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he also sells charcoal which contributes to his other source of income. His major challenges are theft and seasonality in his business. Bakari dreams of expanding to be a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future.

With the 40,000 Kshs, he plans to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of charcoal. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is 25, single and does not have children. She lives with her two brothers in la Mina Guifarro neighborhood, in the city of Juticalpa in the state of Olancho. She is a young woman who has always had to work since her mother immigrated to the United States illegally and someone had to help out with family expenses. Every weekend she works as a roving saleswoman, offering merchandise such as sandles, cosmetics, women's accessories and clothing. From Monday to Friday she has another job. Ana is asking for a loan because currently she does not have much inventory and she needs to travel to the city of Tegucigalpa to buy merchandise, above all the latest fashions. With the loan she will be able to increase her income because she will obtain more earnings which will allow her to support her brothers, who are both studying. One of the problems that she has had is that her mother is not in good health and she cannot be close to her to offer support. Her hopes are that her mother's health improves, and to have her own space that is large and beautiful to display her products, and for her brothers to have good careers. This is her second loan with FAMA and she has made her payments punctually.

Translated from Spanish:
Ana Cecilia tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, y junto a sus dos hermanos reside en la Colonia Mina Guifarro en la ciudad de Juticalpa, departamento de Olancho. Es una joven que desde temprana edad ha tenido que trabajar porque su madre emigró a Estados Unidos de forma ilegal y alguien tenía que ayudar con los gastos familiares. Los fines de semana ella se dedica a vender de forma ambulante mercadería como ser sandalias, cosméticos, accesorios para mujer, y también ropa mixta, etc., y de lunes a viernes tiene un empleo fijo. Ana solicita el préstamo porque actualmente no tiene mucho inventario y necesita viajar a la ciudad de Tegucigalpa para comprar mercadería sobre todo estilos que están a la moda. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella podrá tener mayores ingresos porque obtendrá ganancias y con estas apoyará a sus hermanos ya que ambos están estudiando. Una de sus dificultades es que su madre está mal de salud y no puede estar cerca de ella para apoyarla. Sus anhelos son que la salud de su madre mejore, tener un local propio que sea amplio y bonito para poder exhibir su producto y que sus hermanos sean profesionales. Es su segundo crédito en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Vilma que nació en la ciudad de Huancayo (Perú), tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades económicas, Yo me dedico a la elaboración de productos lácteos como por ejemplo yogurt y manjar junto con mi amiga Karen. Ya es un año que me dedico a este negocio y me va muy bien. También me dedico a la venta de cosméticos en mis horas libres. Yo requiero el crédito para comprar cosméticos. Mi sueño es construir mi casa por la zona sur de la ciudad del Cusco”.
texts.en:
The communal bank Vamos Juntas [Let's Go Together] meets every month in the city of Cusco. Cusco is known for being a heavily touristed area with a lot of commercial activity, and for its traditional Inti Raymi festivities, as well as for having one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu. 

In this place we met Ms. Vilma who was born in the city of Huancayo, Peru. She is 40 years old, married, and has from that union three children. She tells us "Currently I live in the city of Cusco where I carry out my business activities. I devote myself to making dairy products such as, for example, yogurt and caramelized sweet milk with my friend Karen. I have been in this business for one year now and it is going very well. I also sell cosmetics in my free time. I need the loan to buy cosmetics. My dream is to build my house in the area south of the city of Cusco."

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old. She is a widow and has six grown children living with her in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Big businesses start small - that is what she always bears in mind. For six years, Emelia has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store in her place of residence to earn a living for survival and enhance hidden capabilities in managing a satisfactory business. The store exists till the present time. She gets PHP 6,000 a month from this activity.

Earlier this year, Emelia became a GDMPC member. She began her loan application with the cooperative at the amount of PHP 5,000. The money is borrowed withe the intention of purchasing a few sacks of pig feed to sell retail. She believes she will earn more from this because most residents grow pigs. The probable revenue will be used to gradually buy necessary store facilities such as refrigerators, stock shelf and more.

loans.use: To purchase a few sacks of pig feed to sell retail.

loans.name: Obelva

texts.es:
La señora   Obelva, es casada con el señor Francisco y con quien procreo   tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y estudian en secundaria y primaria.
 
    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  herramientas para su taxi, en donde lleva practicando   diez años y comenta que le va muy bien ya que con ellos ha logrado estar sacando    adelante su familia.

   Lo que lo  motivo  a dedicarse a esta actividad fue su papá quien la animo a  tener un negocio  que le deje ganancia  y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingreso de la casas y no verse limitada con el dinero.
 
    Lo quemas desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir obteniendo un  poco mas de ahorro para ir aumentado día con día su actividad  y así a poyarse con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Obelva is married to Francisco, and they have 3 dependent children who are in elementary and middle school.

She is requesting a loan to purchase tools for her taxi.  She has had this taxi business for 10 years, and she says that it is going very well because with it she and her husband have managed to get ahead with their family.

Her father encouraged her to have her own business and income, and so this motivated her to devote herself to this business.  With the business, she can contribute income to the household and not be constrained by a lack of money.

What she wants the most is to save money over time with this activity, so that she can gradually expand the business and rely on this income.

loans.use: to pay for tools for her taxi

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Chamroeun is 27 years old and her husband, Ny, is 27 years old. They have been married since 2008 and just have a young daughter. The family is living in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chamroeun and her husband are vegetable farmers. They grow cauliflower and cucumbers on their farmland in the village. Chamroeun is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a cow to raise. She will also purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain a vegetable farm.

Photo: Chmroeun and her husband and their young daughter.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise and to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain a vegetable farm.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a grocery shop business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation. Mwanamisi dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase green grocery items for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase green grocery items to sell

loans.name: Gemma Group

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in Nangcaan, Rizal. She is married and has two children. 

Gemma has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately 3200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. 

Gemma has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve the general living situation of her family. 

Gemma is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Elvita has a food shop that sells "halo-halo" or flavored ice. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy raw ingredients for making "halo-halo" or  flavored ice.

Elvita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elvita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making "halo-halo"  (flavored ice).

loans.name: Oday

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30-years-old, married and a father of one child.

Oday has been the owner of a blacksmithing shop since 2004; making metal doors and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2000 in order to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Regina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Regina Isabel es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación básica, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio este trabajo con su señor padre, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es profesor de educación física.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores para poder producir corte típicos y poder mejorar su negocio, espera en el futuro ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Regina Isabel is a 27-year-old married woman who completed three years of elementary school study. She has two children who are studying. She works weaving traditional clothes. She started the business with her father and now has 10 years of experience. She also has her husband's support, who works as a physical education teacher. 

She is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of colored threads in order to make traditional clothing and be able to improve her business. She hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of the group called Fuente D. Vida (Source of Life) 3, 4 & 6, which is located in the rural outskirts of L. Romana. She lives in a "batey," a community set up for workers who cut sugarcane. Santa lives with her long-term partner and their five children in their small home.

Santa is excited to take her 4th loan with Esperanza, and she joined this group almost 2 year ago. Her business has been running for 5 years, which she started with a little amount of capital and bought some merchandise. Santa is selling cosmetics and perfume by walking in her community and nearby. She will invest this loan to buy different miscellaneous products.

Santa said, "My most important challenge is to serve to the Lord", and her most favorite activities are to eat, to sleep and to work. She is dreaming of having a successful business and better income. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been in the tailoring business for the last three years and earns a monthly profit of KES. 6,000. He is 33 years old, married to Rose and they have three children aged between three and nine years.

He has applied for his third loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD; he plans to use the loan amount to rent good premises for his business.

He will save the anticipated profits and pay school fees for his children. David hopes to grow his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to rent good premises for his business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Gloria is 43 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 15 to 22. These eight children are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been selling rubber dishes in the market. Gloria enjoys the profit making in her business, and she is requesting a loan to purchase rubber dishes for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario Alberto  tiene 37 años de edad, él vive en Ica ,ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agroexportaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta construir casas;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Mario Alberto le agrada es “Carapulcra con sopa seca”.  Mario Alberto estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria y le hubiera gustado estudiar Medicina Veterinaria. El es conviviente y su pareja es ama de casa, juntos tienen 2 hijos el menor de sus hijos tiene 3 años va a un centro educativo inicial, y su otro hijo tiene 17 años el cual cursa el quinto año de secundaria.
	
El es Maestro constructor dedicado a su trabajo de manera eficiente y responsable, trabaja aproximadamente 9 horas diarias, sus amigos lo entusiasmaron para que trabaje en este tipo de negocio ya que debido al terremoto del año 2007 aumento la necesidad de contar con maestros constructores. En un día puede atender a un cliente  debido a lo complejo de la labor y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/52 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/100 soles lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, su negocio tiene éxito porque realiza su labor de manera responsable y con honradez y con ello muchas personas comentan lo buena de su labor y recomiendan su trabajo. Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlo para poder comprar más herramientas y con ello brindar un mejor servicio  y no tener la necesidad de alquilar las herramientas necesarias, Mario Alberto desea poder pagar en 6 meses el total de su crédito.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle en su labor diaria con herramientas en buen estado y con ello aumentar los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así poder ahorrar el dinero suficiente para tener una empresa avícola lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propia empresa de construcción."
texts.en:
Mario Alberto is 37 years old. He lives in Ica, a city that has recently had a large increase in investment, not only in agricultural exports - in other words, large farms - but also in the opening of new commercial centers that bring many jobs to regular citizens of Ica. In his free time, Mario Alberto enjoys building houses. Peru is well known for having some of the most delicious foods int he world, and one of the dishes that Mario Alberto enjoys is "carapulcra con sopa seca" (a combination of a pasta dish and a beef or pork stew that are often served together). Mario Alberto studied until the fifth year of secondary school, and he would have liked to have studied veterinary medicine. He lives with his partner, who is the head of the household, and they have two children together. The younger child is three years old and attends an early education center; the older child is 17 years old, and he is in the fifth year of secondary school.

Mario Alberto is a master construction worker, always working efficiently and responsibly. He works about nine hours a day. His friends encouraged him to go into this type of work, and because of the earthquake in 2007, the need for skilled construction workers has increased.In one day, he can attend to one client, and because of the complexity of the labor involved, he is able to earn an average of 52 soles (roughly 20 USD); on a good day, he could early 100 soles (roughly 38 USD), which helps him with a few additional household expenses. His business is successful because he does his work in a responsible and honorable way, and because of this, many people comment on his good work and recommend him to others. Now, Mario Alberto hopes that Kiva lenders can help him to be able to buy more tools, and with these tools offer better service and not have to rent necessary tools. Mario Alberto will repay the loan in six months.

This improvement of having good tools will help him in his daily work, and in this way, he will be able to increase his income to improve his family's quality of life. He would also have enough money to start a poultry business, which would help him accomplish his long-term goal: to have his own construction company.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 26 years old and married with two children. For the past six years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables in Kilifi and she is doing great. 

Riziki is requesting for a second loan from KADET to purchase more cabbages, kales, onions, oranges, bananas, and tomatoes for sale. She will use the profits to educate her children and further expand her business

She hopes to expand her business and   and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dorcas Lom Group

texts.en:
“The reward of hard labour is life,” says 35-year-old Lhingkhochong. She also says, “no work, no life” as she and her husband are daily wage earners and their source of income is unreliable and irregular based, mainly on work availability and appropriate workload. She is the featured borrower for Dorcas Lom Group and she is pictured with her hand raised.  Her kids are in the capital town to study in good schools as the village does not have a good school. Her husband is a farmer and works in a paddy field. During off farming season, he usually sieves sand and digs underneath the riverbank for massive stones and sells them at a good price. It is completely manual work and takes a hard toil on the labourer. Deprived of all basic education, both Lhingkhochong and her husband work hard to manage the family expenses with all available work.

Lhingkhochong's main source of income is selling her own vegetable produce. She usually plants all seasonal vegetables and sell them after a period of four months, when the plants are fully grown. Her other income-generating activity is selling rice in the village and nearby villages. The rice supply is bought from the neighbouring state and sold in the town market and also in the village. The generated income is meager and can’t provide enough capital to start her livestock farming business, which had been her plan for quite a long time.

With the Kiva loan Lhingkhochong  plans to purchase two does and two bucks when she accesses the loan. Her plan is to rear the young goats while she is working in the fields and sell them when they mature. With the income she also aspires to start a charcoal business which is one of the highest demands in the area. It is non-seasonal and has no threat of expiration which is a very good option for generating income for them.

She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the wonderful support, enabling the group members to fulfill their desires and plans. She says she will always remain obliged and will also repay the loan on time. She also made a request that Kiva will continue helping them and hopes the co-operation will be a grand success. She says, "thank you so much, Kiva!”

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving, farming, selling vegetables, piggery etc.

loans.use: To purchase two does and two bucks, raise them, and sell them for a profit when fully grown.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
KAIM, who is in his early 40's is married with three schooling children.  He has been selling charcoal for four years now. He works from 06 am to 07 am daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be KAIM's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the charcoal stock  and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customer's demand. He Dreams of opening a retail shop.

Kaim will share this loan with his loan group  Mt Udzungwa which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to buy a bull

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en: Shukria is 35 years old and lives in District 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is the mother of five children. She requests a loan for $175, which will be used to buy the wood, flour and new baking equipment she needs to grow her business and earn more income. She works very hard to bring positive changes to her life and to support her family economically.

loans.use: To buy wood, flour and new baking equipment

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en: Zemfira A. is 52 years old and she has lived in Sabirabad for her entire life. She is married and has five children. She is the owner of a small business- a clothing store. Her workplace is very small, and she applied for a $1000 USD loan to enlarge her store.

loans.use: Mrs. Allahverdiyeva would like to enlarge her clothing store.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en: Nariman R.  is a 33-year-old single man. He lives in the southern Azerbaijani town of Imishli. He has seven years of experience; when he started selling goods in his store he was only 26. In the beginning, he sold only biscuits and candies. As soon as he found success, he borrowed $2,300 and purchased goods such as sugar, flour, salt, rice and other goods. Nariman is applying for a $1,200 loan to purchase more beverages and begin selling them, because they are in high demand.

loans.use: To add beverages to his inventory

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Lorn has been married since 1995 and has 3 children - a son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1983, and started her own silk-production business that same year. Her husband is a construction contractor, and has been in the house-construction business since 2000. 

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. Of the US$700, she will use US$300 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, while the remaining US$400 will be used to buy construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: Purchase of 1) silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, 2) construction materials

loans.name: Rosula

texts.es:
Señora Rosula M. is 42 years old, and is married to Mr. Melanio Esquivel. Together they have five children, two older ones and three school age children.

Rosula started her business with their savings generated with the money her husband earned working for a transportation carrier of passengers in the year 2000. They rented a small space just outside at the terminal of the company where her husband worked, where every day there was an interesting movement of people traveling. This is how they were inspired with the brilliant opportunity for this type of business.

At first she began selling fast foods such as pastries, croquettes, vegetable tarts, and so on. And then began diversifying her products and foods with more sophisticated offerings. Today this business is very profitable, especially since she already has a customer base, and even developed a catering service for people who work in the area.

The loan will be used to purchase various goods, as well as to supplement the sale of meals in her small shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosula M. tiene 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Melanio Esquivel, matrimonio con cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres en edad escolar.

Rosula comenzó su negocio con los ahorros que genero con el dinero que ganaba su marido que trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transporte público de pasajeros, en el año 2000, alquiló un pequeño salón justamente en la terminal de la empresa donde trabajaba su marido, en donde cada día había un movimiento interesante de personas que viajaban, por lo tanto vio una oportunidad brillante para este tipo de negocio.

Comenzó vendiendo comidas rápidas tales como: empanadas, milanesas, croquetas, tartas de verduras, etc. y luego fue diversificando sus productos ya con comidas mas elaboradas. Hoy en día dicha actividad le es muy rentable, porque ya tiene una clientela formada e incluso ya ofrece servicio de catering a personas que trabajan en la zona.

El crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías varias, ya que además de la venta de comidas posee una pequeña despensa.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, meat, etc. (Compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, carne, etc.)

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is 40 years old, and she dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and cosmetics. Her husband is an industrial worker. They have one young child. She would like to obtain a loan to make some repairs to their home which is in bad disrepair. She would like to add a better bathroom/sanitary facility, which currently consist of a latrine and sheet metal walls.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Martha tiene 40 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de Ropa y cosméticos. Su marido trabaja en una vulcanización. Ellos tienen un niño menor de edad. Ella quisiera obtener el crédito porque quiere empezar a reparar su casa que está en muy mal estado; quiere empezar haciendo el servicio Sanitario y el Baño que actualmente está hecho con paredes de zinc y el servicio higiénico es una letrina.

loans.use: Build a bathroom/sanitary facility for her home.

loans.name: Adzoto

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzoto G. is 39 years old and a married mother of six children. She has been in the baking business for nearly ten years. Mrs. G. has a difficult time meeting her children’s needs, as her husband is unemployed. With this loan, Mrs. G. would like to purchase ten bags of wheat flour and five bags of granulated sugar and build a second oven in order to increase her production, satisfy her customers and earn more so that she can improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Adzo G. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle opère dans ce secteur d’activité bientôt 10 ans. Madame Adzo subvient difficilement aux besoins de ses enfants étant donné que son mari n’a aucun boulot sous les mains. Par les fonds dont elle bénéficiera, madame Adzo veut acheter 10 sacs de farine de blé, 05 sacs de sucres en poudre et se faire construire un second four afin d’augmenter sa production et de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et in fine gagner plus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of wheat flour and 5 bags of sugar to make and sell bread. She would also like to build a second oven.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is a mother of 5. She is 48 years old. She hails from Lagos State; Nigeria. She sells drinks and ice blocks and is also a hair stylist. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy a sewing machine, weavon attachments, and  more hair cream for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, more weavon attachments for hair styling, and hair cream

loans.name: Tei

texts.en: Mr. Tei N., 55, is a farmer and fisherman in the Kork Snay Village, Kampong Thom Province. N. earns up to $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Yoem Roem, is a 53-year-old farmer and grows crops, including watermelons, earning about $5 per day. They have seven children, one married and the others single. N. requests a loan of $1,100 to buy fishing tools and to plant dry season rice. He thanks Kiva for their support and promises prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools and to plant dry season rice

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 32 years old and is married with two children, ages 8 and 5. Violet is a clothes and soft drinks seller, a business she started in 2005. She works from 8am to 8pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and soft drinks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Omosefe

texts.en: Mrs. Omosefe O. is 30 years of age; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with a child. She does hair and also sells drinks and pure water, a trade which she learned in 6 months and started in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more drinks, pure water, and salon materials for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, pure water, and salon materials for sale

loans.name: Saory

texts.en:
Mrs. Saory R. is a middle(wo)man in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Saron Prak, is a recycle collector. Mrs. Saory R. would like to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy more bitter melons to sell for a profit. With the rest of the money, Mrs. Saory R. would like to invest in her husband's business.

Mrs. Saory R. is 27 and the mother of two children. One attends school while the other is too young. Previously, Mrs. Saory R. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike to start her husband's business. Last year, her youngest child got dengue fever and Mrs. Saory R. spent a considerable sum to have her cured.

Mrs. Saory R.'s husband appears in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: To buy more bitter melons and to invest with her husband business.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi D., 40 years old, has 2 children who are still going to school. She joined the TYM Fund since 1997. At first, she used the borrowed money in planting vegetables. However, this activity did not bring her a large amount of profit. She then switched to investing in a general store. After 10 years of membership, she has helped improving her family economy. She is able to furnish her house with tables, closets...Her children are sent to good school. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to buy more merchandise for her store. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Doãn năm nay 40 tuổi. Hiện gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học.Chịtham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Các vòng vốn đầu chị vay để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi trồng trọt song nhận thấy các dự án này mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế không cao chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển và ổn định hơn. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn và tiết kiệm trong chi tiêu chị đã mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị như tủ,bàn ghế và một số vật dụng khác .Các con của chị được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để mua thêm hàng tạp hoá về bán cho người dân địa phương. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: general store

loans.name: Lek

texts.en:
Lek V., age 46, lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling rice and baskets to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$10 in revenue per day. Her husband Yen Vanny, age 50, is a local teacher in a primary school in the village. On average, he makes around US$4 per day. This couple has eight children together, of whom three are employed and the five other are students.

Mrs. V. is seeking a loan of US$1,000 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a plot of land to resell and the remainder will be used to raise pigs to sell. (Mrs. Lek V. is pictured with her daughter.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to resell and the remainder will be used to raise pigs to sell.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N., 48, and her husband, Mr. Sarun Sanh, 49, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, were married in 1985 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Their first daughter is a garment factory worker and the second daughter sell fruits in front of a factory. Their two sons study in the local school.

Mrs. Sokhom has been selling meals for five years. She cooks by herself for sale in front of a garment factory about one kilometer from her home. Her husband has been a wooden house constructor for fifteen years. The couple is in the process of repairing their house and lacks the money to finish part of the house. Therefore, Sokhom is requesting a loan of US1000 to purchase materials for making a wall for her house.

loans.use: To make a wall for her house.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso que le permitiera darles de comer a sus hijos, ya que su esposo falleció y ella se quedé con la responsabilidad de sus hijos, razón por la que buscó varias alternativas para ganar dinero y esta fue la que mejor se acomodaba a sus necesidades, ya que de esta forma también podía estar al pendiente de sus hijos. una vida mejor, además de que le gustan mucho las ventas. Primero comenzó lavando y planchando ropa ajena y haciendo el aseo en casas de sus vecinas y algunas otras actividades que le daban ingresos para sostener a sus hijos, pero a partir de Abril de 2002 fue que comenzó a vender ropa usada, cuando su hijo que vive en los E.U.A. le empezó a mandar pacas de ropa usada para venderlas y de esta forma mantener a sus otros hijos y también ayudar a sus nietos. Gracias a su anterior crédito con KIVA pudó comprar mas pacas de ropa y en la actualidad va a ocupar el dinero para comprar ropa usada para el otoño y el invierno.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir mas pacas de ropas y tener un mejor surtido que ofrecerle a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana started her business out of necessity to earn an income that would help her feed her children. Her husband had passed away and Juana was left with the responsibility for her children. She looked for various alternatives to earn money and this was the best way to accommodate her needs, because she can also care for her children while she works. This is a better life, and Juana enjoys sales. First Juana began washing and ironing clothing and cleaning the houses of her neighbors, plus a couple of other activities that combined, earned enough income to support her children. In April 2002 Juana began to sell used clothing when her son, who lives in the U.S., sent her boxes of used clothing. She sold them, and was able to support her other children and help her grandchildren. Thanks to a previous loan with Kiva, Juana could buy more boxes of clothing. Now she'd like to buy used clothing for autumn and winter. Juana needs a loan of US $400, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy more boxes of clothing so as to offer better supplies to her clients and increase her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. sells yams at Use market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She buys the yams from the north.  She is 50 years old and married with 6 children.  She and her family live in Benin City.  The demand for yams in Nigeria is high because it is a staple food.  She needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more yams to sell.  She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase yams to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married to Marnelie, who chose to become a housewife to take good care of their only child, Princess Joan Mae. Still young at the age of 27, he is very aggressive in continuously improving his cell phone shop. By doing so, he knows that more customers will come in, thus providing more income and savings for his family. His cell phone shop has been their sole source of income since they got married. His family is now living in Barangay Arcon, Tumauini, Isabela, Philippines.

Because of his goal to make his business successful, Joel has decided to borrow money to use as his additional capital. He knows that success is only possible if he expands his business. Also, he plans to start a new venture: a hog-raising business that he has engaged in before. He wants to borrow at least Php7, 000 to assist him in fulfilling his dreams.

“The bottom line in a business' success is patience, hard work, and, most of all, trust in God,” Joel says.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Chang Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Chang Lim T. is a villager in Trapaing Ampil village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the household. Her husband, Mr. Nem Mao, owns a small shop from which he sells construction supplies. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy steel to re-sell. Thus his wife, Mrs. Chang Lim T., decided to ask for a loan to buy it for her husband. Mrs. Chang Lim T. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is presented next to her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy steel for her husband's metal shop.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Алиева Зухро живет городе Яван. Возраст 44 года , замужем и имеет шестерых детей.Уже около четырех лет , как она занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует тканями и детской одеждой. Ее бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей развивать свою деятельность и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Zuhro A. lives in Yavan town. She is 44 years old and is married with 6 children. For the past four years she has been selling fabric and children's clothing. This business is her primary source of income. She would like to get a loan in order to increase cash flow, attract new customers, and expand her business. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Nidia Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, de Santa Bárbara, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, su negocio es la venta de calzados (zapatillas). Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (zapatillas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas mercadería, es decir más zapatillas, que piensa venderlos en los mercados de Puno y Arequipa, uno de sus mayor sueños es abrir su propia tienda de artículos deportivos con lo cual podrá garantizar la educación de sus hijos y una buena calidad de vida para toda su familia. 
 
Ella piensa que es importante el apoyo a las mujeres con créditos, para mejorar sus negocios y esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por ese apoyo
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of Banco Comunal "3 de Mayo." She lives in Santa Barbara, within the Ilave district and El Collao province, inside the department of Puno. She's 22 years old (with a secondary school education), has one child, and lives with her partner. She's worked with the Manuela Ramos institution for 3 years, during which time she has dedicated herself to selling shoes. She used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase merchandise (shoes) for her business. With this loan of 1000 soles ($325 dollars), that she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to purchase additional merchandise that she will sell in the markets of Puno and Arequipa. Her dreams include owning a sporting goods store, which will help ensure a proper education for her child, and a good quality of life for her whole family. She believes that providing credit to women (so they can improve their businesses) is very important, and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise (shoes) for her business.

loans.name: Idris

texts.ru: Джалолову Идрису исполнилось 40 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Занимается предпринимательством на центральном рынке города Исфары. В отличии от многих предпринимателей Идрис знает как привлечь покупателей в свой маленький магазинчик. То как разложен его товар, как он общается с покупателями показывает, что он имеет постоянных покупателей. В его бизнесе ему помогает его племянник,  который заменяет Идриса во время его отсутствия. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес Идрис решил получить займ и для этого обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Idris J. is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He is an entrepreneur in the Isfara central market. Unlike many entrepreneurs, Idris knows how to attract customers to his small store. The way he lays out his goods, and how he interacts with customers show that he has regular buyers. His nephew helps with the business and takes over when Idris is gone. In order to expand his business Idris decided to request a loan, and came to Microinvest to do so.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank A. is twenty-two years old. He is a single young man who lives with his brother. He says that, as a young man, he needs to work very hard to make some income and investments before he marries. He lives with his elder brother in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Frank deals in mobile phones and phones accessories, such batteries, housing, key pads, etc. He buys from dealers in Kumasi and sells in a showcase at the local market. He also treks to markets in nearby communities to sell. Frank has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock his business. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy phones and accessories

loans.name: Rosemary Juma

texts.en: Rosemary Juma O. is a 32-year-old mother of two children. She is married to a "casual worker", which in Kenya is relatively equivalent to a "day laborer”. Rosemary runs a small restaurant in Nymasaria township where she sells chips, beans, onion rice and cabbage. She is working on purchasing and fixing up some houses that she hopes to rent out. She is asking for 20,000 KES (US$275) to purchase more food stock. Rosemary recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase food stock for a restaurant.

loans.name: Nowel

texts.en:
K. Nowel is a businesswoman of 41 years. She is married with four kids, three of whom are going to school. She started her shop business three years ago with the help of her husband, but now she is self-reliant.

She is using the loan to purchase items in the shop. Her future plan is to build more houses for rent.

loans.use: To purchase items for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad nació en la ciudad de Lima hace 40 años, contrajo matrimonio, y fruto de esa unión tuvo 4 hijos. Segura de que la venta de cervezas y gaseosas le generaría buenos ingresos, inició su negocio hace 2 años, en lo cuales, su buen trato, cortesía y la alegría que trasmite le sirvieron para cautivar a sus clientes, y la demanda fue aumentando, superando sus metas e incrementando su carga de trabajo. Trinidad tiene nuevas proyecciones, siendo una de ellas la instalación de un bar en el centro de su distrito, por lo que está buscando un local en una zona atractiva donde abunden centros comerciales y de recreación para aprovechar la concurrencia de personas. Esta idea la concretará con el apoyo de su pareja, quien incondicionalmente se ha involucrado en las labores que embarga esta actividad. Este es el 8vo préstamo de Trinidad con MFP, y junto a sus compañeras del banco comunal tienen a la perseverancia y a la paciencia como las claves de desarrollo con las que trabajan. Los 3500 soles que solicita serán utilizados para aumentar la cantidad de cajas de bebidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Trinidad was born in the city of Lima 40 years ago. She married, and the fruit of this union is the four children she had. Confident that the sale of beers and sodas would generate a good income, she began a business two years ago. Her good relations, courtesy and the joy that she transmits brought in customers, and demand grew, exceeding her goals and increasing her workload. Trinidad has new goals, including the installation of a bar in the center of her district. She is looking for a location in an attractive neighborhood with a lot of recreation and shopping centers so that she will benefit from the numbers of people. She will achieve this with the support of her partner, who has involved himself unconditionally in the labor that this will entail. This is Trinidad’s eighth loan with the MFP. Together with her colleagues in the communal bank, they have perseverance and patience as keys to the development of their work. The 3500 soles that she requests will be used to increase the number of boxes of drinks that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
La señora Baltazara R. R. D. Z. tiene 39 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa,  tiene  3 hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Baltazara se dedica a la Venta D. Ropa, este negocio se inicio hace 3años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra D. ropa como buzos, ropa interior, polos, camisas.
El crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. ropa como buzos, ropa interior, polos, camisas.
Baltazara tiene como sueño tener su Tienda D. Ropa para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Baltazara R. R. D. Z. is 39 years old, and lives in a neighborhood called Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the Porvenir district of the Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad, Peru.

She finished primary school and has three children who depend on her economically. Baltazara has been selling clothing from her home for the past three years.

Her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) that she received from the communal bank Lideresas en Accion II, was used to purchase clothing such as sportswear, undergarments, polo shirts, and t-shirts. She will use this current loan to purchase the same types of merchandise.

Baltazara’s dream is to own her own clothing store in order to grow as a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing articles like sportswear, undergarments, polo shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Lala Dom

texts.fr: Monsieur A. est marié, pour subvenir à ses propres charges et à celles de sa femme, il a ouvert en 2007 une boutique qu’il a appelé « AFRIK SEL TOGO », l’activité qu’il exerce dans sa boutique est la vente de sel. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et à Dakar. Il vend à des tenanciers de restaurant et à des bonnes dames. Voulant agrandir son commerce, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  10 sacs de sel au Togo et 15 sacs de sel du sénégal.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is married and, to provide for his own needs and those of his wife, he opened a shop called AFRIK SEL TOGO in 2007. His shop sells salt and he gets his supplies in Lomé and Dakar. He sells to restaurant owners and to good women. Wishing to expand his business, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 10 bags of salt from Togo and 15 bags of salt from Senegal.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase salt

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Clarita T.’s family. Through their farm, she is hoping that her youngest child, unlike her other children, will finish college. Though sometimes the family struggles to manage the farm because of the calamities and pests that hit their palay, those problems do not keep them from continuing their farming.

In order to improve her family's chances of a good harvest, Clarita is applying for a loan from Kiva in the amount of PHP12,000 for them to maintain their farm. With the loan they can buy fertilizers and pesticides that they can use in maintaining their palay.

“I know that, with the assistance from Kiva lenders and with our perseverance, we are able to achieve our dreams,” Clarita shares.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a mother of nine living in Mile 90, a community just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. Living there, she has been able to take out five separate loans from GHAPE to be able to expand her farming practices, and also open up her own grocery store. 

With this next loan that she is applying for, Magdaline hopes to be able to grow her store, and also support her pig farming practices, a very profitable venture in this area. 

She is sure that these activities will be a success because of her prior experience in this business, and also because of the variety of products that she is able to carry in her store. This variety gives people more choices of what to buy, and it attracts them to her business as opposed to others, because of the sheer volume of what she is able to put out for sale in the store.

With the profits of this business, she will be able to continue to support the education and apprenticeship of her children in learning different skills and making their own lives more fruitful because of the empowerment that they have received. Magdaline also plans to put the money that she makes back into the business. 

Through the credit and the trainings that she has received, Magdaline has been able to make a notable difference in the life of her family members, and also in the conditions that they are subject to on a daily basis. She originally came to GHAPE because of the low interest rate, but now continues to stay with the organization because of the non-monetary gains that she has received. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and seedlings to support her farming practice, and purchase of items to grow her grocery store

loans.name: Yejide

texts.en:
Yejide sells drinks. She has been in this business for the past nine years and desires to expand her business. She opens her business from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 6pm. She said her business affords her the opportunity to assist her husband in feeding and clothing the children and paying their school fees.

Yejide hopes for the loan amount N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell so as to be able to meet the demand of customers. Her customers appreciate knowing she will always have what they need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana Aide

texts.es:
Juana tiene una oficina en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz que funciona como notaria de fe pública,.
Vive en la zona de Miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de equipos y muebles para su oficina).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro
texts.en:
Juana has an office in downtown La Paz where she operates as a notary public. She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of La Paz in her own home. The loan will be used for capital investment (the purchase of equipment and furniture for her office). This is the second loan that she has applied for with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Investment (purchase of equipment and furniture)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 57 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Agnes is a trader. She trades in pastries. She supplies retailers and snack bar operators in her community. She sells food (rice and stew) as well. Agnes buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es soltero, tiene 32 años y actualmente vive con su madre. Él se dedica al cultivo y venta productos agrícolas, desde pequeño aprendió las labores de la agricultura y ahora lo hace independientemente. Pero, él no sólo vende sus productos luego de cosecharlos, sino que también les da a sus clientes un valor agregado, pues dependiendo del producto, los limpia y pela o pica. Por ello, obtiene mayores ganancias en el momento de su comercialización, además la mayoría de sus clientes son de otras ciudades y de empresas de alimentos. Ricardo reparte su producto en su movilidad propia que es su motocarro, siendo su deseo a futuro, tener más terrenos de cultivo y una piscigranja de truchas. 
Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, el es parte de un banco comunal y además de ser muy entusiasta, es puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar arveja.
texts.en:
Ricardo is single, 32 years old, and currently lives with his mother. He works harvesting and selling agricultural products. Since he was a small child he learned how to carry out agricultural work and now works independently. However, he does not just sell his products after harvesting, but rather he also adds value to them by, depending on the product, cleaning, pealing, and cutting them. For this work, he earns better profits; the majority of his clients are from other cities and from the food industry. Ricardo sells his products from his own mobile motorcar, hoping that in the future he will have more land to cultivate and a trout farm (aquaculture).

This is his third time acquiring a loan through MFP; he is a member of a Communal Bank and in addition to being very enthusiastic, he is punctual in his payments. The money that he is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and planting peas.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: La Poma Group

texts.es:
Integrantes  3000   6000 María de la Concepción B. R. 5000

Isidra de Fátima L. B. de 38 años desde 1991 tiene una dulcería donde realiza postres y dulces tradicionales como pioquinto, piñonate, hojuelas, cajetas de leche y coco, papaya con piña,  etc.
Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre y comenzó a realizarlos para venta. Este negocio es unos de los que inicio  junto con Adim y han ido creciendo juntos. L. aseguro que lo que más le gusta es el sistema de trabajo ya que le es favorable.
Las otras integrantes son María de la Concepción Valtodano R. de 65 años realiza cajetas de leche y coco, piñonate, sapoyo (sapote en dulce), ayote en miel….etc. y  Rosa L. de 39 años desde 1990 se dedica a la agricultura de flores, plátanos y cítricos y a la crianza de aves de corral. A sus inicios solo criaba aves pero luego fue creciendo y empezó a cultivar.
texts.en:
Isidra de Fátima L. B., 38, has had a sweet shop since 1991. She makes desserts and traditional sweets like “pioquinto” (rum cake), “piñonate” (candied pine nuts), “hojuelas” (a type of fritter), “cajetas de leche y coco” (coconut caramels), and “papaya con piña” (papaya with pineapple), etc. She learned how to do this from her mother, and she started to make the sweets to sell. This is one of the businesses that she started with Adim, and they have been growing together. L. affirms that what she likes most about this system of work is that it is profitable. Another member is María de la Concepción Valtodano R., 65, who makes cajetas de leche y coco, piñonate, “sapoyo” (a candied regional fruit), and “ayote en miel” (squash and honey, similar to a sweet potato pie) etc. The third member, Rosa L., 39, has been growing flowers, bananas, and citrus since 1990. She also raises poultry. When she started she just raised birds, but then that was growing and she started to farm.
