He has had to start doing some of those things his wife did that  he had taken for granted. Challenged by these realities he has doubled his effort towards meeting the needs of his children. This made him  join GHAPE in early part of 2006. With his first loan he bought palm nuts for processing as he already had an oil mill. The demand for palm oil is very high now and people come from neighboring communities to buy oil from him. Relying on one oil mill is not enough as it sometimes get bad and may take some time to be repaired.

Given a loan of $300, George plans to buy another small oil mill in order to increase his production. His community will have good palm oil for cooking and stands a chance of benefiting from his activities as he will have to employ somebody to work with the mill because he cannot work with both machines by himself. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term

loans.use: purchase of a palm oil mill.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Doña María Antonia is a married woman, her husband works as a security guard and they have four children. She started her business to contribute to the household income. She is fond of sales so 4 years ago she started selling cosmetics of a well-known company in Mexico, and little by little she has contributed to the income and helped keep her family going. She started sales from catalogue among her friends who have recommended her and thus she has improved her sales and wishes to expand her business.

María Antonia needs a loan of $375 to buy more products to offer her clients and also she has several orders to fulfill. Her plan is to repay in 3 months. She and her family appreciate the support offered to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María Antonia es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad y tienen cuatro hijos, ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a la economía familiar. A ella le encantan las ventas y fue por ello que hace 4 años atrás decidió iniciarse en la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca en México y así poco a poco ha ido colaborando en los ingresos a su hogar y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Empezó su negocio de venta por catálogos primero entre sus amistades quienes a la fecha la han ido recomendando con otras personas y han mejorado sus ventas y desea continuar con su negocio.

María Antonia esta solicitando un préstamo por US 375 para comprar mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y por que tiene varios pedidos que surtir, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to improve sales and fulfill orders.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran N. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. Now he is settled with his wife and three children in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. Kamran is 36 years old. He sells women's clothes in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business ten years ago. He wants a $1200 loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Mrs. Huy A., 45, works with her husband raising pigs and earns collectively about $2 per day in revenue.

She has six children; three are currently employed A. a garment factory and three are enrolled in school.

This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase more piglets and feed in order to improve their lives in the next four to five months.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria I. has been selling cosmetics during the past 17 years at La Estacion market in Nicaragua´s Leon province.

She began her business subletting her stall in the market, but she was not making enough money so she decided to speak with the market managers to obtain her own stall. This was a sound business decision which lowered her fixed costs and helped her to reach her sales targets and increase her benefits.

Mrs. Maria Teresa I. has been able to do this thanks to the business loan given to her by Ceprodel. Thanks to this loan she has incresed her product range at her market stall in León.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Cosmetics purchase

loans.name: Ugo

texts.en: Ugo A. is married with 5 children. She is 40 years old and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and cooked food. She has been in business for the past 13 years and she needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cooking items and drinks

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mirabu N.. She is currently in the business of running a kiosk and is requesting a loan to add more stock and buy a weighing scale. Mirabu is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a coffee trader for work. She has 3 children ranging from ages 11 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Mirabu makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re- invest in her business. Mirabu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mirabu is joined in her small group by Happy Tibinwera and Jane K.. Happy Tibinwera has a business in craft sales and wants to increase her capital stock. Jane K. is currently operating a business selling matooke and wants a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To increase stock in kiosk shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 25 years old and is a single woman. Mariam is a clothes seller, a business she started in 2006. She works from 7am to 7pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

Mariam has taken out a previous successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Raky

texts.fr:
Raki B., age 48, is married and has three persons in her care, in addition to her five children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Houlata, in Vélingara, for five years. She wants to buy peanuts, shell them, and make peanut butter from them to sell. The income derived from her business enables her to take care of schooling for her children. Raki is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Raki B., 48 ans, mariée, 03 personnes en charge en plus de ses 05 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides, les décortiquer , les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants. Raki sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en: A. Mairam is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Khujand and is engaged in the commercial services and national boot sales businesses. Mrs. A. works as a registered nurse in the local policlinic and has been selling massi, the national boots, in her free time for the past 18 years. Mrs. A. has now applied for a business development loan of US$775 to be repaid within 4 months. She will use the money to increase her business assortment and turnover. Mrs. A. thanks KIVA for its important work and the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Increase in business assortment and turnover

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol H. is a farmer in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Phan Rim, uses transport soil by motorbike to sell in different villages. They have three children who are too young to work or attend school. On her plantation, Mrs. Thol H. faces a small problem because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Thol H. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to help her plow her field. Mrs. Thol H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to help plow field

loans.name: Aminjon.

texts.ru:
Aminjon A. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He is 32 years old, married and has four children. He is unemployed. He earns an income by raising large-horned cattle and selling milk. Two of his cows have given birth so it is important that he increases the size of his cow barn. That is why he wants to receive a loan so that he can buy building materials. By building a strong cow barn he will be able to be well prepared for the winter and not worry that the cold weather would injure the cows. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Азимов Аминджон житель города Яван. Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет четверых детей. Нигде не работает . Зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота и продажи молока. Двое из коров отелились и теперь ему необходимо увеличить коровник. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит , для того , чтобы закупить стройматериалы. Построив крепкий коровник он сможет хорошо подготовится к зиме и не беспокоится о том , что холодная зима повредит животных. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Maiyas

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiyas K., 42, and her husband, Mr. Ly K., 43, who live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives in the family home and the other three children study in the local school.

Mrs. Maiyas and her husband have been raising ducks for ten years. They sell duck eggs to the middleman in the village. Beside this business, the couple has been fishing since they were young. Ly fishes in the Mekong River and his wife sells the fish in the village.

Maiyas is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase feed and ducks for raising and to buy fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: To raise ducks and purchase fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene 41 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 18 años de edad, el mayor esta estudiando, su esposo es albañil trabaja independiente y a veces por contratos. Doña Verónica trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos desde hace veinte años a diferentes familias, pues anteriormente cuando comenzó era madre soltera ya que su esposo la abandono y tenía que cubrir sus necesidades con la suerte que le dieron trabajo el cual hasta hoy ha sido su sustento y ayuda para su familia, con suerte se volvió a casar y tiene una familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura ya que quiere cambiar el techo de su vivienda que esta en mal estado, y con estas lluvias ha estado pasando necesidad ya que se moja.  A largo plazo es poder tener un negocio propio y así poder estar en su casa, ayudar a sus hijos con los  estudios.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. She has two children ages two and 18 years old. Her oldest child is in school. Her husband is a construction worker who works independently and is also sometimes contracted. Veronica has worked as a domestic worker for over 20 years for different families. She was given the opportunity to work as a domestic worker when she was a single mother who had been abandoned by her husband. She had to pay for the necessities and this work has, until this day, allowed her to support her family. Luckily she remarried and she now has a family. This loan will be used to repair the infrastructure of her home. She wants to change the roof of her home which is in bad shape and is in need of repair because it leaks. Her long term goal is to have her own business and be able to stay at home and to help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the roof of her home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, amala (a dish made from ground, dried yams), pepper soup, and drinks. She is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She is a LAPO client. She is requesting the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga owns a small cafeteria in an industrial district of Uzhgorod, Western Ukraine. She offers quality services and delicious meals to all workers of this factory zone (4 factories in the district). Olga has been in the trade for 6 years. Her perseverance, confidence, experience and consistency in work have guaranteed the growth of her business. She is constantly increasing the assortment of dishes she serves in her cafeteria, which helps her increase her income.

Olga is presently renting the facility which serves as her cafeteria. She is hoping to generate enough income and eventually to purchase these premises, which would give her more flexibility and income as a result. Olga is very focused. She is a typical high-achiever and knows how to set goals and achieve them. 

This time, she is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase additional grocery items to diversify her cafeteria menu. She is hoping to repay the current loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Tiem

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiem S. is a duck breeder who lives in Por Steang village in Kampong Cham province. Because her ducks have grown very fast, she does not have enough money to buy food to feed them; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food.

Her husband, Mr. Phin Phan, is a farmer who can gather a little rice revenue, which cannot support the family well. Mrs. Tiem S. is 45 years old and the mother of five children -- one of whom is a chicken seller, while another three are attending the local school, and the youngest one is only two years old and too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Neth

texts.en:
Neth N. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She earns a living buying rice for re-sale after taking off the husk. On average, she makes US$6 a day. Her husband, Ty Saruon, 49, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver. He has been operating his business since 2004 and is able to make US$7 per day. Neth N. and her husband have six children, one of whom is employed, and two are students. 
Mrs. Neth N. presently needs a loan of US$1,000 to purchase rice in bulk for re-sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado D. Chijichalla, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercero D. primaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es la elaboración, compra y venta D. productos D. la zona (chuño negro, tunta cebada, quinua, etc.); su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería D. la zona para poder venderlo en las ferias D. Arequipa y Puno. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir y mantener su mercadería (mas chuño, papa, cebada, etc.), su anhelo es convertirse en mayorista D. los productos que venD.; asimismo quiere dedicarse al engorD. D. ganado mayor (toros) y sostenerse así misma.
texts.en:
Cecilia is an associate of the "Cuidad Blanca" communal bank in the central village of Chijichalla, Ilave district, province of Del Collao, department of Puno. She is 60 years old, is married, has four children and has completed a part of her primary education (up to graD. three). She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six months. Her business is the production, purchase and sale of local products (dehydrated black potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, barley, quinoa, etc.). Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, with which she was able to purchase local goods to sell at the markets in Arequipa and Puno.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, an amount which she undertakes to pay off in three monthly instalments, she will be able to purchase and maintain her merchandise (more dehydrated potatoes, potatoes, barley, etc.). Her desire is to become a wholesaler of the products she sells; likewise she would like to fatten up larger livestock (bulls) and to support herself on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase and maintain her merchandise (more dehydrated potatoes, potatoes, barley, etc.).  Her desire is to become a wholesaler of the products she sells; likewise she would like to fatten up larger livestock (bulls) and to support herself on her own.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26 year old Bahati M. from Mwanza.  She is married with two children, between the ages of 1 and 4 years old. Bahati has been running a shop since 2006.
She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week. Bahati currently earns about 120USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase cooking oil, sugar and kerosene.
In the future, she plans to expand her business. 
Bahati thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar and kerosene

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia FORTUNATA; nació en el pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas,  vive en el barrio de nombre callejón chico en Urubamba a 10 minutos de la provincia.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos de (33, 30, 24, 23) años, ella es madre soltera, y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de chicha de jora, ella compra maíz y jora para la elaboración de la chica a base de estos productos y los macera y procesa para su venta, ella vende en su casa, para lo cual requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y jora, así mismo ella criará algunos cuyes para hacerlos reproducir y posteriormente venderlos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le permitirá mejorar sus ganancias, y se compromete al pago total del préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Fortunata was born in the middle of the sacred valley of the Incas. She lives in a neighborhood called “Callejón chico” or “Little alley” in Urumbamba, Peru, about 10 minutes from the provincial capital. Fortunata is 56 years old and has four children (33, 30, 24, and 23 years old respectively). She is a single mother, and she alternates her activities between home and the purchase and sale of chicha de jora (a corn-based traditional Incan alcoholic drink). She purchases corn and jora in order to make the chicha from those products and she soaks and processes them for their sale. She sells them from home. She needs the loan in order to invest in the purchase of corn and jora, and she will also raise some guinea pigs in order to make them reproduce and later resell them. Fortunata is thankful for and values this loan which will permit her to improve her income. She promises to repay the full loan in the time period allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell corn in order to make chicha de jora (a corn based drink)

loans.name: Saidakram

texts.en:
R. Saidakram is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of home-grown vegetables, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his three children. Saidakram has been characterized as a person who is hard-working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Saidakram is determined to raise the standard of living in his family, and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Horacio Israel

texts.es: Horacio Israel  A. sus planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y darle un mejor bienestar. El construyo una barda en la parte trasera de su casa el cual la quiere utilizara para levantarla mas y así hacer un cuarto para extenderse y estar mas amplios tanto como el como su familia. El necesita material para la losa y pagar mano de obra. Su casa es de interés social por lo que es muy pequeña el quiere hacerla mas grande poco a poco pero primero una cosa y luego otra.
texts.en:
Horacio Israel A.’s plans for his family are to better the conditions of life for his children and to give them a better situation. He built a wall in the rear part of his home which he wants to use to raise it more, and so to make a room to extend the house, and to be larger like his family. He needs materials for the flagstones and to pay labourers. His house is public housing and so it is very small and he wants to make it bigger, little by little, but first one thing and later the other.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build

loans.name: Milcerio

texts.es: Milcerio tiene 46 años, es un hombre muy sensible y responsable, vive felizmente con su esposa que es la madre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales viven con tres de ellos que lo apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas. La siembra y cosecha de papa es la actividad a la que se dedica diariamente desde hace 30 años, pero antes de acudir a su chacra alimenta a los animales que tiene como su burro y sus mulas, los cuales le son muy útiles para transportar los sacos durante la cosecha. Por ello que a  las 8.00am sus animales ya deben estar bien alimentados para que no sientan cansancio ni hambre durante la jornada de ida y vuelta a su almacén. Después de haber acumulado las papas, comienza la selección con la ayuda de su esposa, y finalmente los transporta al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Milcerio ama la labor que realiza, puesto que sabe que gracias a ella obtendrá el dinero para sostener a su familia. En los 30 años que lleva en esta actividad ha disfrutado de la abundancia de sus cosechas que le permitieron vivir temporadas de bonaza, como también de impotencia al ver que sus siembras se quedaban bajo el hielo y otras veces los gusanos malograban la totalidad de sus cultivos, pero esas circunstancias sólo han sido pasajeras, pues no han mellado en su ánimo de seguir luchando para mantener a su familia. Este es el cuarto crédito de Milcerio con MFP, durante los anteriores ciclos demostró mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos, y para este ciclo se compromete seguir la misma dinámica, ya que los demás integrantes son muy buenos colaboradores para el progreso de su banco comunal. Los dos mil soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Milcerio is 46 years old, he is a very sensible and responsible man. He lives happily with his wife, the mother of his 5 children, three of whom are still with them and help him work the fields. He sows and harvests potatoes, daily work that he has been carrying out for the last 30 years. But even before he starts tending to his fields he must feed the his donkey and his mules. They help him transport the large sacks of harvest. By 8a.m. the animals must already be well fed so that they do not feel tired or become hundre during the trip to and from the silos. After having collected the potatoes he and his wife must go through a selection process, and only then will they transport them to the wholesale markets in the city of Tarma. Miclerio loves his work and it is thanks to this work that he obtains money to support his family. In the 30 years that he has been working he has enjoyed abundant harvests, giving him the opportunity to live through times of plenty. He has also seen harvests fall under a sheet of ice and other harvests that were completely spoiled by pests. But these times of hardship have been temporary and they have not impeded his will to keep struggling for the sake of his family. This is the fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). In the past he has shown great responsibility in his payments and for this time around he promises to be equally responsible. The others inthe group are wonderful collaborators in the progress of their community bank. The two thousand soles he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for this next harvest.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Elisa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Elisa Margarita L. G. tiene 54 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no tiene estudios, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Elisa se dedica a la Crianza de aves también teje y lo vende en las ferias semanales de la sierra, este negocio se inicio hace 15 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra cuyes, patos, pollos.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de lanas de diferentes colores y gruesor para tejer chompas, ropones.
Elisa tiene como sueño tener  granja de animales para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Elisa Margarita L. G. is 54 and lives in the el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II Etapa, in the Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Department, Peru. She has no education, and has one dependent daughter. She earns her living raising birds and knitting, and sells her products in the weekly fairs in La Sierra. She started her business 15 years ago, and she works from her home. Elisa used her first loan, 300 soles that she received from Lideresas en Acción II (Women Leaders in Action II) Village Bank, to buy guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens. She plans to use this loan of 500 soles to buy wools in different colors and widths to knit sweaters and christening gowns. She dreams of having an animal farm so she can grow as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wools in different colors and widths to knit sweaters and christening gowns.

loans.name: Equator Kyotukire Molly Group

texts.en:
K. Molly is 25 years old and married with one child and also takes care of one dependent who attends school. She has been running her retail business for a year. She is using the loan to purchase items such as sodas, sugar, salt, soap, match boxes, etc., for her retail shop. 

She is expanding on her business for more profit. She believes in growing her business, and she is a living example to others in the community. Her hope for the future is to educate her child and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sodas, sugar, salt, soap, match boxes, etc., for her retail shop.

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
H. Trần Thị (1816071351) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has three school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling pork products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 51-year-old father of seven. He joined GHAPE all the way back in 1998, when the organization was founded. Since that time, he has been able to take out eight separate loans to be able to develop his farm, purchase a motorbike, and also to pay for renovating his house and sending his children to school. 

In his life, Moses has been able to overcome many different obstacles, from the death of his first wife to his political imprisonment in the wake of the strikes that occurred in Cameroon in 2008.In spite of this all however, Moses has been able to develop his businesses and provide his children with more opportunity than he was ever afforded.

With his next loan, Moses hopes to be able to purchase a motorbike, fund the necessary documentation, and also be able to sponsor a driver in the short term, with these arrangements being made.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike, licensing, documentation

loans.name: Winfred Mwende

texts.en:
Winfred Mutene is twenty-five years old and single. She has been operating a cosmetics shop for the last three years.

She was introduced to KADET through a marketing awareness exercise that took place in one of the churches in Nairobi. This will be her first loan and she does not have a credit history with any other Microfinance institution. Winfred believes she is hardworking and focused, and with the extra profit she plans to supply cosmetics wholesale. Winfred's future plans are to own a supermarket of beauty products. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase stock of hair pieces and imported cosmetics.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline vive en casa D. los suegros con su esposo e hijos en la calle Rosendo Gutiérrez D. la zona D. Sopocachi D. La ciudad D. La Paz el esposo trabaja con su auto como transporte publico. La actividad que ella tiene es la elaboración D. queques, tortas, empanadas, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar en cantidad los ingredientes D. esta manera tener mayores ingresos.

Es cliente D. Impro y paga muy bien pueD. acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her husband in sons in her in-laws' house on Rosendo Gutiérrez street in the Sopocachi zone of La Paz. Her husband works driving their car. She works as a baker, making sweet breads, cakes, empanadas, etc. She is asking for a loan to increase her capital and to buy her ingredients in bulk so she can make more money. She is a member of Impro, and since she repays very well she can ask for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients

loans.name: Yirtankaka

texts.fr: Cette femme est divorcée de son époux et a à sa seule charge son enfant, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à celle de son enfant elle a entamé en 2005, le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut augmenter son stock pour vendre plus et assurer les charges de la rentrée scolaire de son enfant, elle sollicite donc un crédit pour acheter 200 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: After being so upset with her two eldest children who did not pursue their education until college, Emerita G. who is a mother of three children whose age range is from 17 to 29 learned to accept her failure in life. She can not blame her children for such default because their life being poor has m made that circumstance to happen. Instead of getting herself stuck in bitterness, she decided to have her own business which is bamboo buy and sell to be able to augment the income of her husband being a laborer. Profits she will be getting through her business will be used to sustain the education of her youngest child who will be going to college until she graduates. Emerita also wants her business to grown further so that she can be of help to her grandson who lives with her and to her two unemployed children. She wished that she can still make their lives better through her business and with the loans she can request in the next cycles (increasing amount of loan after the other).

loans.use: Will be used to pey for purchasing bamboo (used for manufacturing house furniture, and material for housing) for selling.

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun S. is a 54-year-old retired soldier who lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and two of his children. He typically receives approximately US$1 on account of his military service. His wife, Kong Phalla (pictured), is 44 years old, and she runs a grocery store in the local market. By doing so, she normally earns approximately US$4 of profit per day. Tun and Kong also receive financial support from one of their children, who is a construction worker.

Tun is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$1,000 so that his wife can expand her grocery store.

loans.use: To expand his wife's grocery store by purchasing additional inventory
